loans.name: Andrés

texts.en:
Andrés is single, healthy and lives with his parents in El Alto, Bolivia. He sews vests and baby clothes to make a living and earns extra income by painting signs.

Andrés took out and successfully repaid a prior loan through Kiva's field partner IMPRO. He has now applied for a 8,000 BOB loan to buy another sewing machine. His business is getting better and better, so he hopes you will help him again. Andres is on the street where he lives in the picture

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more supplies for her business.

loans.name: Liz

texts.es:
Liz está estudiando la carrera de administración  de empresas, está cursando el segundo año, y comenta que para cubrir sus estudios está poniendo su mejor esfuerzo.
Su meta es graduarse, obtener su título, conseguir un trabajo y así ejercer su profesión.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo esta haciendo.
texts.en:
Liz is studying business administration. She is in her second year, and says that she is doing her very best to cover her studies.
Her goal is to graduate, get her title, get a job, and exercise her profession.
She is requesting this loan to pay her university tuition and continue with her studies as she has been.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en: Iman is a 35-year-old,married woman from Khan Younis city. She lives with her husband in a simple house. Because the economic situation in Gaza is not good, A few years ago, Iman started her own business.  She manages a stall selling clothes. This is the only source of income for the family. Iman took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help her to buy a new collection of children's clothing for her store. This will increase her sales and also her income. Iman appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new collection of children's clothing for his store.

loans.name: Azmabeth

texts.en:
Azmabeth is a married mother of 3 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 35 years old, and all of her 3 children are in school.

Azmabeth has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 13,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase additional boxes of mangoes to resell.

Azmabeth has successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Azmabeth has been in this business for 9 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of mangoes to resell.

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
Angie is 36 years old and married.

Angie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Angie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Angie has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Angie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena earns a living by running a sari-sari (or variety) store in Paranaque. This business has been operating for almost two years. Without help from CCT and her perseverance and hard work, it would not have grown as fast as it has. Magdelena supplements her income by selling dry goods and managing a printing business. She is 58 years old, has two children and is planning to improve her sari-sari store by buying more products to display and sell. She is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan to make this possible. Her goals for the future are to expand her business and turn it into a grocery store. At the same time, she also prays that she will earn enough money to build a house-renting business. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: buy more products to display and sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Adaza

texts.en:
Adaza is 30 years old and a parent of two children, who are in school. Adaza works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a repair shop. Adaza is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy an additional gallon of gasoline, a fishing net, etc, for her fishing business.

Adaza has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money for her children to go to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional gallon of gasoline, a fishing net, etc.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a single, 22-year-old student, living in Irbid.  Ahmad is studying Finance in his third year in the university. Ahmad`s father is retired from his work and his pension does not enough to cover all needs for his family. 

Ahmad`s purpose of applying to the loan is to finish his university fees and to get a job to help use his knowledge.

loans.use: to finish his university fees for a BA in Finance

loans.name: Phal's Group

texts.en:
Phal, a farmer living in Kampong Cham province, is 40 years old and a mother of three schoolchildren. She overcomes her family’s hardship via cassava growing on three hectares area as her single main source of her income. She has been growing cassava for 12 years and she can save her daily income about 33,400KHR per day. 

This is her fourth cycles with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has paid back her past loans completely. For her past loan, she can get more income to improve her living to get better and support for her children’s education. She leads a group of two to get a new loan. 

As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to pay for laborers fees to support her farmland to get a good yield. She hopes that her cassava will produce more yields with a better income, so that she wants to expand her farmland to grow cashews for next year.

loans.use: to pay for laborers fees to support her farmland to get a good yield.

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad is a 55-year-old married woman.

Her financial condition is not good; she has to think a lot time about starting any task. Now her son has just begun to drive a moto rickshaw (a type of three-wheeled rickshaw). This rickshaw is being drive over local roads and for small distances. He has been driving it over rough roads, which caused it to break down. Now the rickshaw needs to be replaced because it rattles when being driving. This is the reason he wants to buy new moto rickshaw.

Shamshad has requested a loan for her son so he can buy new moto rickshaw and can drive it smoothly. 

Shamshad thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a moto rickshaw for her son's transportation services.

loans.name: Alhaji

texts.en:
Alhaji is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Magami Village. Alhaji joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, 

Alhaji will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Alhaji now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to purchase a motorbike to do business with.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Samya

texts.en:
Samya is a 45 year’s old married woman and a mother of four. She asked her daughter Haya to appear in the photo with her.  Samya has always wanted to provide her children with the best education. 

Her 21 years old daughter Haya is a university student majoring in pharmacy, and she is in her second year. She is seeking to pass her Bachelors’ so that she will be able to get a good job in her field. But because of the financial problems her family has been facing, Haya couldn’t pay for her upcoming semester fees. 

For that, Samya wants to help her by applying for this loan to cover her university fees and achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's B.Sc. 2nd year fees in Pharmacy

loans.name: Alhaji Haruna

texts.en:
Alhaji Haruna is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Magami Village. He joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Alhaji Haruna suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay his children's school fees.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Alhaji Haruna will have access to the best farm inputs in the market. These fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably.

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Alhaji Haruna now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm’s yields

loans.name: Alhaji Alasan

texts.en:
Alhaji Alasan is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Magami Village. Alhaji Alasan joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Alhaji Alasan suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children's school fees. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Alhaji Alasan will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Alhaji Alasan now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields

loans.name: Kosol's Group

texts.en: Sokol, 29, lives with her family in a rural village in Kampong Cham province. She is the mother of three children, one of whom is in school while the other two are too young to attend. She earns money to support on her family by growing cassava and rice. Sadly, her recent cassava crop was destroyed by insects, which has created many difficulties for the family. Sokol has been involved with her businesses for eleven years and earns her about 37,200 KHR per day. She has applied for her first loan from Kiva's partner VisionFund, and also leads a loan group made up of four people. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine for her family. She hopes that this will allow her family to live a healthier life.

loans.use: to build a latrine for her family.

loans.name: Saidbibi

texts.en:
Saidbibi is a generous woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1956. She lives in a rural area with her family. She is a widow and has five children. She is a business lady who buys and sells grocery products such as wheat, macaroni, candies, toys, soft drinks, etc. She has a small store in the domestic market.

Each year she tries to widen her assortment and attract more customers. She likes her activity a lot. Her business helps her to provide for her family. She is planning to enlarge her assortment of products and requested a loan from Kiva lenders to buy them. She awaits your compassion and wishes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy products to sell in her store

loans.name: Emma Elizabeth

texts.es:
Emma, estudio hasta cuarto grado, pero eso no le ha impedido salir adelante, ya que es una mujer trabajadora, es madre de un hijo; anteriomente adquirio un crédito para mejorar su negocio de pupusas, en el cual ha obtenido muy buenos resultados y a logrado ampliar un poco más su negocio.

Emma, está solicitando otro crédito para hacer crecer mucho más en su negocio y comprar reces para destazo y comercializar la carne para obtener mayores ingresos. 

El sueño de Emma es, seguir con sus negocios y obtener buenos resultado y darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo.
texts.en:
Emma has a fourth grade education, but that has not prevented her from getting ahead because she is a hard worker. She has one child. She previously requested a loan in order to improve her pupusa stand, and she obtained very good results and managed to expand her business a little.

Emma is requesting another loan so that she can make her business grow much further. She wants to buy cattle to butcher and sell the meat in order to make more income.

Emma's goal is to stay in business, get good results, and give her son a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy meat and expand her business.

loans.name: Patria

texts.en:
After Typhoon Haiyan in November 2013, variety stores located in devastated areas like Iloilo had a significant decline in terms of profit. It is of course expected because almost all businesses in those areas dwindled. Entrepreneurs worked hard in the past one and one-half years to “build back better” their enterprises. Patria from Tigbauan, Iloilo is one of those who was able to rise above the situation and regained her variety store operation. She is single who assumes a lot of responsibilities for her nieces and nephews. Her business not only supplies her everyday needs but it also extends the blessings to her relatives.

As of now, she continues to develop her variety store. She plans to purchase more canned goods, grocery items, and cases of soft drinks. She hopes for your generous assistance to enable her to buy all these through a loan worth PhP 18,000. 

May you be God’s blessing to her as she aspires to improve her business.

Patria is a devoted member of CCT Credit Cooperative and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more canned goods, grocery items, and cases of softdrinks

loans.name: Yanelli

texts.es: Yanelli tiene 36 años, es casada, tiene 3 hijos y vive en Morelia. Ella es licenciada en administración de empresas, actualmente trabaja como profesora de computación en una escuela de su ciudad. Yanelli es una mujer muy apasionada por enseñar a los otros lo que ella sabe, es una mujer perseverante y tenaz que siempre alcanza los objetivos que se propone. Su principal motivación son sus 3 hijos pequeños y sobre todo poder ofrecerles una vida mejor. Ella hace más de un año comenzó un negocio propio de venta de bisutería (cadenas, pendientes, collares, etc.), ella emprendió este negocio porque le gustan las ventas y porque quería obtener más ingresos. Con un préstamo de MXN 10,000 Yanelli podrá comprar más productos para tener una oferta mayor y poder ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes, ella pretende hacer muy conocido su negocio, tener un lugar establecido y poder mejorar aún más sus ingresos. Ella agradece mucho a todas las personas que serán parte de su desarrollo económico y que confían en ella porque no los defraudará.
texts.en:
Yanelli is 36 years old and lives in Morelia. She is married and has three children. She holds a degree in Business Administration and currently works teaching computer training at a local school. 

Yanelli is passionate about teaching others what she knows. She is a persevering and tenacious woman who always achieves the goals she sets for herself. Her three small children are her main motivation, particularly because she wants to give them a better life. Over a year ago, she started her own business selling costume jewelry like chains, pendants, necklaces, etc. She started this business because she enjoys sales and wanted to supplement her income.

A loan of 10,000 pesos will allow Yanelli to buy more merchandise so that she can offer her customers a wider variety of products. She wants her business to become well known and set up well-established shop so that she can further improve her income. She is very grateful to everyone who is contributing to her financial development. She appreciates their trust and will not disappoint them.

loans.use: to buy a wider variety of merchandise.

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en: Gulnora is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1962. She is living in a village with her family. She is a widow and has four children. She has 22 years of experience working at secondary school. She is a teacher of beginner classes. During her free time she is busy with sewing traditional women dresses to order. She wanted to develop her activity and appealed to IMON. IMON provides training to startup clients, which helps clients to start their business efficiently. She requests a loan to buy a sewing machine. She hopes to be understood and supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Diego Mauricio

texts.en:
Diego is a 35-year-old married man who lives in the municipality of Caldas at the south of Medellín. He has always been interested in caring for the environment and in being a spokesperson on the topic. Thanks to a friend, he found a way to turn his interest into a business, using his acute social sense, he founded a recycling business.

He’s very professional when it comes to business; that’s why one of his goals is to be more productive by optimizing the operation of the process, and reducing the waste. He would like to have a loan so he can buy inputs like baskets to save what he recycles so he can accomplish the objectives that he set out for his business.

He wishes to be able of improve the conditions of his house so he can offer his family the protection and comfort they deserve. Diego is a responsible man and committed to caring for the environment. Not only does he want to increase his profits, but to create awareness about the importance of protecting the earth. Help Diego by making a loan.

loans.use: buy inputs like baskets to save what he recycles

loans.name: Maria Domitila

texts.es:
Domitila, es una persona emprendedora, solo estudio hasta cuarto grado, está casada y su esposo es agricultor, ambos siempre han luchado juntos para sacar adelante a sus tres hijos.

Domitila, solicito un crédito anteriormente con lo cual compró mercadería para su propio negocio de venta de ropa, en el cual le ha ido muy bien con las ganancias obtenidas.

Ahora Domitila, está solicitando un nuevo crédito para comprar otro tipo de mercadería como trastos de cocina, para surtir más su negocio y obtener más ingresos.

Su sueño es seguir prosperando con su negocio y darles el estudio necesario a sus hijos, para que lleguen a ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Domitila is an enterprising person. She has only a fourth grade education. She is married and her husband is a farmer. They have both always fought for their three children together in order to provide for them.

Domitila used her previous loan to buy merchandise for her clothing business. Things turned out very well for her and she made a good profit. Domitila is now requesting a new loan in order to purchase other types of merchandise, such as kitchen supplies. She wants to diversify and make more income.

Her goal is to continue to prosper with her business and pay for her children's education so that one day they can pursue a career.

loans.use: to diversify by buying kitchen supplies.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 48 years old. She is living with her five children and husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband has been selling vegetables for many years. He uses a four-wheel manual cart for selling, and as a hawker, he can easily reach his customers. People like to buy vegetables at their doors instead of going to the market.

Due to his vegetables' freshness, he has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. Due to his reputation, the demand for vegetables has increased, and around noon his stock comes to an end.

Shamim feels proud of her husband and appreciates his efforts for his family. She is receiving this loan for her husband so that he can buy seasonal vegetables in greater quantity and an equilibrium scale to weigh them. She wants to save the excess profit so that she can utilize these savings for future sudden needs and for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fresh and seasonal vegetables and an equilibrium scale to weigh them for her husband's green grocery business.

loans.name: Alhaji Idris

texts.en: Alhaji Idris is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Magami Village. Alhaji Idris joined Babban Gona to improve the life of his family and children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Alhaji Idris will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds, which will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will increase his household income significantly. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Alhaji Idris now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to buy a maize grinding machine.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen's husband owns a vehicle spare parts shop in which he sells spare parts for motorbikes. He sells brake shoes, brake levers, hubs, rims, mud guards, filters, chains, head lights, batteries, etc. He has been in this business for many years and is earning a sufficient amount to afford household expenses. 

Her husband has to support his family and elderly parents as well. The spare parts shop is his single source of income. He estimated his future expenses and came to realize that he needs to grow his business to be able to easily cope with future expenses. Therefore, Nasreen has requested a Kiva loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband so he can buy the described spare parts for reselling purposes. 

Nasreen is the mother of five children; some of them are very young and fully dependent upon their parents. She spends her whole day at home and looks after her children. She hopes that her husband will be successful in his future planning and that this loan will prove beneficial for his business. Nasreen thanks Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy brake shoes, brake levers, hubs, rims, mud guards, filters, chains, head lights, batteries, etc. for her husband's spare parts shop.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in Kampong Cham province, Sokha is 45 years old and a mother of six dependent children. She provides for the needs of her family’s living via cassava growing on a two hectares area. Moreover, she can get more income via growing cashews. Her cassava did not grow well because there was a lot of grasses covering her cassava farm. 

For Sokha, this is her second cycles with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has repaid her past loan successfully. The previous loan that she has used to support her family’s business and has earned her more income than before. 

She is a group leader of three members to seek a new loan. She will manage her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, organic pesticide and pay for laborers fee to work on her farmland. She hopes that she can sell her cassava at a good price to increase her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, organic pesticide and pay for laborers fees to support her farmland.

loans.name: Valle Joa Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Valle Joa está en su ciclo número 6 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, cada una de las integrantes de este grupo se ayuda para poder salir adelante y mejorar sus vidas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Carmen, quien en su última encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza mostró que ha mejorado a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la cría y venta de cerdos que hace se gana la vida de una manera digna y honestamente.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de cerdos para la cría y de esa forma poder seguir con su humilde trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: The group called Joa Valley is in its 6th cycle of the women's committee program where all of the members work and help each other to get ahead. Each one of the members of this group helps themselves to get ahead and improve their lives. One of the members is Carmen who has demonstrated that she has improved her situation through her efforts and her continuous work. She makes a living in a dignified and honest way through the raising and selling of pigs. She is seeking this loan to purchase pigs to raise to be able to continue with her humble work as she has done before.

loans.use: to purchase pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy: corn, lime, fresh goods and soft drinks in order to increase daily sales and have a better quality of life.

loans.name: Celia Soledad

texts.es: Celia tiene 47 años de edad, vive muy feliz en casa propia, sus hijos son mayores de edad y ellos ya viven aparte con sus propias familias; pero sus hijos a pesar de ello la apoyan económicamente. Por su parte, Celia hace unos meses se ha dedicado a brindar servicios domésticos, actividad que realiza diariamente, y es así como ella cubre sus necesidades básicas. Anteriormente, Celia solicito un crédito pero por problemas  de salud no pudo invertir para lo que lo había solicitado y tuvo que utilizar el monto  para compra de medicamentos. Nuevamente Celia solicita un nuevo crédito a FUSAI para poder reparar el techo de su hogar porque no está en buenas condiciones. Ella invertirá en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y pines para reparar el techo lo antes que la época de invierno llegue.
texts.en: Celia is 47 years old. She lives a happy life in her own home. Her children are adults and they now live apart with their own families. But in spite of this, her children support her economically. On her part, Celia started working to provide household services a few months ago, an activity she carries out daily and is how she is able to cover her basic expenses. Previously, Celia requested a loan but due to health problems, she was not able to invest it in what she had requested it for, and had to used the amount to buy medicine. Now, Celia is requesting a new loan to FUSAI to be able to repair her roof of her house because it is not a good conditions. She will purchase galvanized steel, wood and pins to repair the roof because the winter season begins.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized steel, wood and pins to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Juan Bautista

texts.es: Mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, pagar la educación de 3 hijos que son menores de edad, tener un terreno basto, fértil, que sus hijos algún día hereden los terrenos que con tanto sudor y días de trabajo construyo es lo que desea Juan, un hombre casado de 38 años de edad que se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para la compra insumos agropecuarios como lo son; abonos, riegos, pesticidas, fungicidas, insecticidas, semillas, para mantener sus terrenos y plantar otros nuevos.
texts.en:
Juan, 38, is a married man who wants to improve the conditions of his home; pay for his three minor children's education; and have a large and fertile piece of land to build, with a lot of sweat and days of work, for his children to inherit one day.

He's requesting a loan to buy farming supplies such as soil amendments, irrigation, pesticide, fungicide, insecticide, and seeds to take care of his crops and plant new ones.

loans.use: to buy farming inputs to take care of his crops

loans.name: Francisca María

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador, por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América.
En este lugar vive la señora Francisca, tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 4 hijos,  tres son mayores de edad e independientes y uno de 16  años trabaja como ayudante en una mecánica. Su esposo es pescador. Viven en casa propia.
Doña Francisca para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar hace ocho años empezó un negocio, ella tiene un pequeño local en su casa  donde vende materiales de pesca (anzuelos, nylon, redes, entre otros). Trabaja sola y cuando está desocupado su hijo le ayuda,  su negocio puso con el primer crédito que la fundación le dio y lo ha ido incrementando.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar materiales de pesca (Boyas, anzuelos, plásticos, descorchadores, guantes, bujías). Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 12 años  y le gusta porque es muy unido el grupo y  la Fundación es muy seria. Su meta es seguir adelante en su negocio y tener un local más grande con más variedad de productos.
texts.en:
The city of Manta is considered the most important, most popular, and most-visited coastal city in Ecuador, known for its beautiful, welcoming beaches, and as the first deep-water port in Ecuador and South America. 
This is where Francisca lives, she is 48, married with four children, three of whom are adults and independent, and one is 16 and works as a mechanic's assistant. Her husband is a fisherman. They live in their own house. 
To help her husband out with the household expenses, eight years ago Francisca started a business. She has a small space in her home where she sells fishing supplies (hooks, nylon, nets, etc). She works alone, and her son helps out when he can. The business is over ten years old, she started it with the first loan the foundation gave her and it has been growing steadily. 
She will use this loan to purchase fishing supplies (buoys, hooks, plastic, fish skinners, gloves, spark plugs). She has been a member of the Grupo de Credito for twelve years, and she likes it because the group is very unified, and the Foundation is very serious. Her goal is to keep going with the business and have a bigger space with a wider variety of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy fishing supplies

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a married mother of nine children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over four years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sugar,tea leaves,wheat flour and two tables to use in her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar,tea leaves,wheat flour and two tables to use in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new Juki sewing machine, some packs of zippers, laces and spools for her daughter.

loans.name: Alhaji Gambo

texts.en:
Alhaji Gambo is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Badamasi Village. Alhaji Gambo joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  In the past, Alhaji Gambo suffered from poor yields that crippled his to ability to pay for his children's school fees. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Alhaji Gambo has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. Thanks to the support of Babban Gona, Alhaji Gambo can now ensure that his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Rim

texts.en:
Age 46 and a resident from Kampong Cham province, Rim is married and blessed with four children. She struggles to make a living via rice farming on two hectares area and working for others for a fee to make extra income. This year, her rice did not grow well because it was destroyed by insects. She has been involved in her current business for 28 years. 

This is the first microloan for Rim with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is seeking this loan in order to buy more farmland to expand her rice farming to produce more yields. She hopes that she can get high yield from her rice crop, so she can earn more income to upgrade her living condition to get better than before.

loans.use: to buy more farmland to expand her rice farming to produce more yields.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Duo Sefora Group

texts.es:
DUO SEFORA
Este dúo formado por Jesica,de 19 años de edad, es soltera, tiene 19 años de edad, y desde hace 2 años tiene un negocio de librería  que al principio comenzó con mucho esfuerzo, vende útiles escolares y ahora comenzó a vender  carteras y algunos regalitos, su sueño próximo es estudiar en la universidad, y por eso necesita surtir su  negocio para contar con el dinero necesario  para estudiar, espera que la puedan ayudar con el credito ya que solo así podrá seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
This group, Duo Sefora, was formed by Jessica, 19 years old and single. For two years, she has had a bookstore that she started after much effort.   

She sells school supplies and has now started to sell school bags and small gifts. Her next dream is to study at the university and because of that she needs to supply her business in order to have the necessary money to study. 

She hopes that with this loan she will be able to continue studying.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell at her bookstore.

location.town: Aldea Cruz Blanca San Juan Sacatepequez

loans.name: Victor Alfonso

texts.es:
Víctor es un hombre con 30 años de edad, dedicado a la cría, cuidado y venta de aves, un medio por el cual ha logrado salir adelante ante la ausencia de su esposa, quien falleció hace poco.
Trabaja todos los días entre 5 y 7 horas.

Actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo en la Corporación Interactúa el cual lo invertirá en la compra de pollo, alimento, vacunas y bebederos, con esto espera que sus clientes lo sigan buscando por cálida, economía y buen servicio.

A pesar de las circunstancias por las que ha pasado, Víctor no se rinde, quiere seguir trabajando para cumplir el sueño de brindarle a su hija una mejora calidad y buena estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Víctor is a 30-year-old man, who works raising, caring for and selling poultry, a means through which he has managed to get ahead in the absence of his wife who passed away recently.

He works every day between 5 and 7 hours.

Currently he is asking Corporación Interactuar for a loan which he will invest in the purchase of chickens, feed, vaccines and drinking troughs, with this he hopes that his customers will continue seeking him out for warmth, economy and good service.

Despite the circumstances he has experienced, Victor does not give up. He wants to continue working to realize his dream of offering his daughter a better quality of life and good economic stability.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, feed, vaccines and drinking troughs.

loans.name: Luis Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo es un hombre de 48 años de edad, trabajador y humilde, que gracias a un pequeño negocio, una tienda de abarrotes, ha logrado un gran progreso, pues de allí se generan los ingresos mínimos para cubrir sus necesidades básicas.

Debido al poco surtido, sus ventas han bajado de manera notoria, es por esto que se encuentra solicitando un préstamo con el cual surtirá su negocio de productos de la canasta familiar, de aseo personal y otros.

Su sueño es continuar con su negocio y en un futuro dejárselo a sus hijos. Ayuda a Eduardo a cumplir sus sueños a través de un préstamo.
texts.en:
Eduardo is a 48-year-old man. He is hardworking and humble. Thanks to a small business, a grocery store, he has achieved great progress. There he generates the minimum income needed to cover his basic needs.

Due to low supply, his sales have decreased in an obvious way. That is why he is requesting a loan with which he will supply his business of staple products, such as personal hygiene products and others.

His dream is to continue with his business and in the future, to leave it to his children. Help Eduardo to fulfil his dreams by supporting him loan.

loans.use: to supply his business with staple products such as personal hygiene products and others.

loans.name: Damir Antonio

texts.es:
Damir es un hombre de 39 años de edad, trabajador y humilde, dedicado desde hace poco a la cría, cuidado y venta de ganado, con esto ha tenido un gran progreso, pues con los ingresos que obtiene ha logrado pagara sus estudios e invertir en el futuro de su familia.
Trabaja todos los días durante 4 horas diarias.

Actualmente se encuentra solicitando y préstamo con el cual comprara lechones, alimento y los materiales necesarios para remodelar su establo.

Uno de sus sueños es ver su casa bonita, ya que esta con el tiempo se ha ido deteriorando y su estado no es el mejor.
texts.en:
Damir is a 39 year old man who is hard working and humble. For a short time he has been making a living in the breeding and care of livestock and has had great progress in this. With the income he earns he has been able to pay for his studies and invest in the future of his family. He works 4 hours a day daily.

He is now requesting a loan with which he will buy piglets, feed, and the necessary materials to remodel his barn.

One of his dreams is to see his home look nice, since with time it has been deteriorating and it is not in the best condition.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed, and the necessary materials to remodel his barn.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La socia Marcelina se dedica al negocio de venta de frutas,la socia vende platanos,naranjas y uvas, por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante, la socia es una mujer emprendedora, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de frutas . La socia solicita el crédito para comprar manzanas, naranjas, platanos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The partner Marcelina works in the fruit selling business. She wants to succeed through this business. This partner is an enterprising woman. Her dream is to increase her fruit selling business. She is applying for a loan to buy apples, oranges, and bananas. 

This partner is happy about the loan, and she promises to fulfill her installments.

loans.use: to buy apples, oranges, and bananas

loans.name: Eulalia Josefa

texts.es:
Eulalia es una mujer pujante, servicial y trabajadora, a sus 53 años de edad, es soltera y madre de 3 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.

Desde hace 15 años se desempeña en el campo de la confección, prestando el servicio de confección a terceros y a clientes directos, el oficio lo aprendió sola y trabaja con 1 empleado todos los días, así genera los recursos suficientes para apoyar a su familia con la carga económica del hogar.

Actualmente se motiva a solicitar el crédito para comprar una maquina bordadora, esto le permitirá tener un mejor volumen de producción.

Eulalia manifiesta que desea continuar realizando su labor con mucho empeño, pues quiere ampliar su negocio y poder generar oportunidades de empleo, además de garantizar una estabilidad económica para dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Eulalia is a thriving, helpful and hard-working woman, 53 years old, single, and the mother of 3 children who she has gotten ahead with a lot of effort and dedication. 

For the past 15 years, she has worked in the field of sewing, working to sew products for third parties and to direct customers. She learned the profession alone and works with 1 employee every day, int his way she generates sufficient income to support her family with the household economy. 

Currently, she wants to ask for a loan to purchase a serger, which will allow her to have a larger production volume.

Eulalia says that she wants to continue with her work with a lot of determination since she wants to expand her business to be able to create employment opportunities, in addition to guaranteeing economic stability to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a serger which will allow her to have a larger production volume.

loans.name: Luís René

texts.es:
Luis estudio hasta 2° grado, está casado, su esposa es ama de casa y tuvieron 2 hijos y todos ya están casados.

Luis, creció solo con su madre y por esa razón no pudo ayudarle para que siguiera estudiando; desde la edad de 8 años su madre ya lo llevaba a que le ayudara a deshijar algodón y a la edad de 15 años ya trabajaba como jornalero y de esta forma aprendió a sembrar maíz, yuca, algodón y sorgo.- Actualmente, siembra 7,500 metros cuadrados de yuca y de maíz y además cría 5 bovinos.  

El crédito será invertido para comprar ganado, porque a Luis, nunca le ha gustado depender de una sola actividad económica.

El sueño de Luis, es mejorar su vivienda y tener una mejor calidad de vida y tener más ganado.
texts.en:
Luis studied up to the second grade and is married. His wife is a homemaker and they had four children, all of whom are already married. Luis grew up with just his mother and therefore she wasn't able to help him to continue studying. From the age of 8, his mother took him with her to help prune cotton, and at 15 years of age he was already working as a day laborer. In this manner, he learned how to plant corn, cassava, cotton and sorghum.  Currently he is planting 7,500 square meters of cassava and corn, and he is also raising five cows.  

The loan will be invested in buying cattle, since Luis has never liked depending on a single business. Luis's dream is to improve his home and have a better quality of life, and to have more cattle.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Alida Del Socorro

texts.es:
Un almacén de cosméticos y artículos varios son es lo que mantiene viva la ilusión de Alida, ya que su sueño es salir adelante, mejorar su situación económica y sostener a su familia, pues considera que lo mas importante en la vida es el trabajo duro y la perseverancia.

Trabaja incansablemente todos durante 9 horas para generar su propio sustento. 

El nunca pensó en que podía crecer y ahora que interactuar le da la oportunidad de prestarle dinero, quiere aprovechar para realizar la compra de surtido en general de juguetería, peluches y cosméticos, ayudándole a conseguir más clientes para que se antojen de estos artículos.
texts.en:
A store with cosmetics and various items is what maintains Alida's dream alive. Her dream is to get ahead, improve her economic situation and support her family, since she thinks that the most important thing in life is hard work and perseverance. 

She works tirelessly every day for 9 hours to generate her own income. 

She never thought that she could grow and now that Interactuar is giving her the opportunity to borrow money, she wants to take advantage of it by purchasing an assortment of toys, dolls and cosmetics, helping her to get more customers that fancy these items.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of toys, dolls and cosmetics.

loans.name: Yuri Vanesa

texts.es:
Yury, a sus 20 años de edad, es madre de 1 hija, a la que ha sacado adelante con arduo esfuerzo y dedicación. 

Durante mucho tiempo ha trabajado como comerciante independiente en su propio negocio de ropa; allí trabaja todos los días durante 4 horas y ha logrado generar los ingresos para solventar las necesidades familiares.

Expresa que su interés con el crédito es invertir en la compra de surtido al por mayor como blusas, jeans, pantalones de dama, entre otros para abastecerse lo suficiente y poder satisfacer los gustos de su clientela con la variedad que ofrecerá; esto le ayudará a mejorar las ventas  y los ingresos que recibe, además le hará frente a su mayor desafío que es sostenerse frente a la competencia desleal que se presenta en el sector. 

Yury manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda y pagar la educación de su hija.
texts.en: Yury, 20 years old, is the mother of a daughter she has raised well thanks to her hard work and dedication. During a long time, she has worked as an independent merchant in her own clothing business. There, she works every day for 4 hours, and she has been able to generate the income to pay for family expenses. She comments that her interest in the loan is to buy an assortment of clothes such as blouses, jeans, women's pants, among other things at wholesale prices, in order to stock up enough and be able to satisfy her customers' tastes with the variety she will offer. This will help her improve her sales and the income she receives. It will also make her face her greatest challenge, which is to support herself against the disloyal competition there is in her region. Yury declares that her greatest wish is to improve the conditions of her house and to pay for her daughter's education.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of clothes, such as blouses, jeans, women's pants at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Lucia Graciela

texts.es: Lucia tiene 57 años de edad, ella es una señora colombiana que se vino de su país natal hacia Ecuador desde hace 31 años en busca de trabajo y una vida tranquila ya que en Colombia el trabajo es muy escaso y además existen muchos enfrentamientos, Lucia agradece esta Institución Financiera y por apoyarle en su negocio ya que otras instituciones le niegan crédito a las personas colombianas, Lucia vive en el campo y se dedica a la crianza de animales y a la agricultura, ella es casada y tiene 3 hijos mayores de edad, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos y de este negocio espera mejorar sus ingresos y quedarse viviendo en Ecuador y de ser posible comprarse una casita.
texts.en:
Lucia is 57 years old. She is a Colombian lady who came to Ecuador from her native country 31 years ago in search of work and a peaceful life, as work is very scarce in Colombia, and in addition, there are many conflicts.

Lucia thanks this Financial Institution for helping her in her business, because other institutions deny credit to Colombian people.  Lucia lives in the country and works raising animals and as a farmer. She is married and has three grown children.

She is going to invest the loan in the purchase of pigs and in this business. She hopes to improve her earnings and keep living in Ecuador, and if possible, purchase a little house.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Irma Abigail

texts.es:
Irma, de 46 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, actualmente está casada, su esposo trabaja sembrando granos básicos como maíz, frijol y maicillo, tienen una hija de 29 años de edad, que aún está en casa y ayuda en las labores domésticas y en la casa también vive un nieta de Abigail de 4 años de edad.

Irma, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos desde hace muchos años, está actividad la aprendió de sus padres, ella se encarga de comprarlos pequeños y luego los crece hasta la edad de 6 meses para luego venderlos.- Abigail, en su casa tiene mucho espacio suficiente para realizar dicha actividad.

Irma, necesita el préstamo para comprar más cerdos pequeños y comprar concentrado para alimentarlos, para que crezcan sanos y fuertes, también comprara medicamentos para el cuidado de su salud.

Irma, lo que más desea es, darle a su familia todo lo necesario para vivir en mejores condiciones y para que en su casa no falte nada para su bienestar.
texts.en:
Abigail is 46 years old and studied through the second grade. She is currently married and her husband works planting basic grains such as corn, beans, and millet. They have a 29-year-old daughter that still lives at home and helps with the household chores. Abigail's granddaughter that is 4 years old also lives in the home.

Abigail has earned a living raising pigs for many years. She learned this occupation from her parents. She is in charge of buying them when they are small and then raises them to the age of 6 months to then sell them. At her home, Abigail has plenty of space to perform this job.

She is requesting a loan to buy more small pigs and to buy feed to nourish them so they grow healthy and strong. She will also buy medicines to care for their health. What Abigail wants most is to give her family all the necessities to live in better conditions so the welfare in her house is never lacking.

loans.use: to buy more small pigs and to buy feed to nourish them.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 54 years old and is married to Teresa and supports 3 children. 

He has been a small scale farmer for the last 20 years. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25000 from VisionFund Kenya to improve his farming through purchase of certified fertilizers and seeds.

He plans to expand her farming activity and repay his loan from the proceeds raised. 

He hopes and dreams is to lead a financially stable life.

loans.use: to improve his farming through purchase of certified fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Isela Nataly

texts.es: Isela tiene una edad de 19 años de edad y habita con su compañero de vida quien se dedica a prestar sus servicios en una granja cercana a su lugar de residencia, Isela es una joven que se dedica a trabajar ofreciendo sus servicios domésticos en casa particular y es de esta manera que junto a su compañero de vida logran mantener la economía del hogar, ella tiene grandes proyectos a cumplir en su vida y uno de sus principales propósitos es iniciar lo antes posible con la construcción de un cuarto dormitorio de lamina para poder gozar de una vida más digna y en mayor comodidad, pero debido a que no cuenta con la capacidad económica suficiente a decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para la compra de: lamina, madera, clavos, polines, etc., para iniciar con la construcción  lo más pronto posible.
texts.en:
Isela is 19 years old and lives with her life partner who makes a living working on a farm close to their residence. Isela is a young woman who makes a living offering domestic services to private homes. In this way, together with her life partner she is able to maintain the household finances. 

She has great plans to achieve in her life. One of her main objectives is to start, as soon as possible, the construction of a fourth bedroom with laminate so she is able to enjoy a more dignified life and live in more comfort. But because her financial capacity is not sufficient, she decided to apply for a loan from FUSAI for the purchase of laminate, wood, nails, wood beams, etc. to start construction as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy laminate, wood, nails, wood beams, etc.to begin construction of a fourth bedroom

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
This is Leonila and she's a vendor by trade at Paranaque City. She's been operating her sari-sari (variety) store business for 8 years now and already trained two employees with her to assist in her general store. Handling a business that long, she already experienced different circumstances that really tested her faith. But she remained tough, because this is her only means of income for assisting her two children who are with her.  

Sari-sari store is often seen everywhere in the Philippines, most especially along the sidewalks and streets. It is most like a convenience store, but quite a bit of smaller than the usual and offers only limited items for sale, which are commonly needed such as toiletries, food, beverages and other commodities. Unlike grocery stores, sari-sari stores offer products at low-cost and on a retail basis, which is really an advantage for the customers.

Now, she would like to humbly request a loan that would supply her store with a quantity of grocery items to sell. She wants to improve her sales to be able to earn more. She wants you to know that PHP 50,000 would be enough to help her family grow her business. 

Someday, she dreams of expanding her inventory even more. She always wanted a better life, not just for her but also for her children. She wants them to finish college and to be professionals in the future. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy  a quantity of grocery items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell veterinary products business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of veterinary products to sell for her buy and sell veterinary products business.

Lucia has been in this business for 11 years. Lucia earns more income from raising pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of veterinary products to sell

loans.name: Nelsy Arely

texts.es:
Nelsy, es madre de 3 hijos, solo estudio hasta noveno grado, ya que sus padres eran de escasos recursos y no le pudieron continuar apoyando en su formación académica, está acompañada, su conyugue es empleado de centros penales y sus 3 hijos están estudiando en la escuela.

Nelsy, tiene seis años de dedicarse a la siembra de granos básicos, ya que sus padres le enseñaron desde  muy jovencita a ser trabajadora y responsable, su compañero de vida le ayuda con las labores agrícolas en sus momentos libres, donde ella cultiva está muy cerca su vivienda y se desplaza a pie por una distancia de aproximadamente 1 kilómetro de donde alquilan la parcela.

Nelsy, necesita el crédito para comprar fertilizante, formula y sulfato para el maíz, con ello espera tener una mejor producción y poder ganar más dinero cuando venda su cosecha y darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.

Nelsy, planea tener una mejor producción de granos que la temporada anterior, además sueña con ver a sus tres hijos como profesionales y darles las condiciones que ella no tubo de niña.
texts.en:
Nelsy is the mother of 3 children.  She only went to school until the 9th grade since her parents didn't have the necessary resources to continue supporting her in her studies.  She is in a relationship and her partner is employed at a prison center and her 3 children are in school.  

Nelsy has made a living growing basic grains for 6 years, since her parents taught her since she was very young to be hard-working and responsible.  Her life partner helps her with the farm work in his free time.  The place where she grows her crops is very close to her home and she walks approximately 1 kilometer to get to her rented parcel of land.

Nelsy needs the loan to buy fertilizer, formula, and sulfate for the corn, which she hopes to use to produce more and make more money when she sells her harvest so that she can give her children a better quality of life.  

Nelsy plans to produce more grains than the time before.  She also dreams of seeing her 3 children become professionals and giving them the opportunities that she didn't have when she was a girl.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, formula, and sulfate for the corn.

loans.name: Graciela Edis

texts.es:
Graciela, de 40 año de edad, es madre de tres hijos, quienes aún se encuentran en etapa escolar, ella solo logro estudiar hasta noveno grado, debido a que su familia no le pudo seguir apoyando para formarse profesionalmente, está criando sola a sus hijos porque se separó de su pareja pero él siempre le ayuda económicamente para los gastos de sus hijos.

Graciela, se dedica a la agrícultura desde que tenía quince años de edad, sus padres le enseñaron el trabajo de campo, para que aprendiera a valerse por si misma.- Sus cultivos están a una distancia de 2 kilómetros de su casa aproximadamente y se desplaza a pie y en las tardes coloca una venta de frutas y golosinas para lograr obtener un mayor ingreso y mejorar las condición de su familia y en los momentos libres le ayudan sus hijos en las labores agrícolas.

Graciela, utilizará el crédito para comprar fórmula y sulfato para sembrar maíz, con ello espera mejorar la producción de sus cultivos y obtener una mayor ganancia al momento de comercializar sus cosechas.

Graciela, sueña con ver a sus hijos como profesionales y espera mejorar la condición de sus cultivos y poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos; además sueña con ampliar más el área de sus cultivos y mejorar las ventas en su negocio.
texts.en:
Graciela, aged 40, is a mother of three children, who are still of school age. She managed to study only up to ninth grade because her family could no longer support her studies. She is raising her children on her own because she separated from her partner; however, he always helps her financially to cover their children's expenses.

Graciela has been earning a living working in agriculture since she was 15 years old. Her parents taught her to work in the fields so that she could learn to be self-sufficient. 

Her crops are located at approximately 2 kilometers from her home, and she gets to the location by foot. In the evenings, she sets up a fruit and snack stand in order to generate a higher income and improve her family's living conditions. Her children help her with the farm work during their spare time. 

Graciela will use the loan to buy formula and sulfate (different types of fertilizer). With this purchase, she hopes to improve her crop yield and generate a higher profit when she sells her harvest. 

Graciela dreams of seeing her children become professionals. She hopes to improve the condition of her crops and provide her children with a better quality of life. She also hopes to expand her crop area and improve her sales.

loans.use: to buy formula fertilizer and sulfates to plant corn.

loans.name: Aura Emilsen

texts.en:
Aura is a 49 years old married woman who has three children, two big ones and one little boy. Aura has found the way to do what she loves and to support her family, and that way is an art that she’s very good at, she paints in porcelain beautiful different kind of objects like ceramics, traditional people in porcelain, animals, and utensils. She has become famous in her town for her amazing job; her art is bought by many foreigners and local people. 

They live in a very humble town called Ciudad Bolivar in the Colombian Atlantic coast, but well recognized for its culture and legacy to Colombian traditions, something Aura supports very mucho through her art. She asked for a loan because she wants to buy more ceramic, paint, paintbrushes and flowers, she wishes she can increase the products she makes so she has more to offer, what will allow her to improve her business and get more profits.

Sadly she doesn´t have a local on her own, but is a dream that she has and wants to accomplish soon, such as the possibility of paying her children’s education, so they can be not only successful, but good people. Aura has a talent that with a little help will be recognized and valuable; you can support her and get her closer to her goals. Make a loan now and be part of her dreams.

loans.use: to buy more ceramic, paint, paintbrushes and flowers

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia weaves clothes and she has compared weaving clothes to shaping life itself. Just like in real life, before an end product comes, the fabric needs to undergo cuts from its edges and a lot of piercing with needles. To end up with success, one needs to inevitably face hurdles and overcome them.  

She is 59 years of age and lives at Payatas City. She is involved in a tailoring business where she weaves uniforms, mostly for students and teachers. This business has already helped her in maintaining her household. 

She dreams that this business will expand and grow. To start reaching this dream, she needs your help. She would like to take a loan worth PHP 22,000 that she would utilize to buy additional supplies of materials she needs to weave more clothes such as needles, fabric, and thread. Part of the amount will be used also for the maintenance of her sewing machine. 

She is diligent enough and hardworking in her trade. She meets up with her co-fellowship members every Wednesday to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies of materials she needs to weave more clothes like such as needles, fabric, and thread.

loans.name: Kousar Group

texts.en:
Kousar is 49 and is a responsible mother of two daughter living with her husband in a small town near Lahore,Pakistan. Her husband had a job in a factory where he use to work with a grinding machine but now due to low wage he left the job and is interested in buying in his own grinding machine. so that he could take  orders for grinding several things.

He could employ laborers for his machines on daily wages. Therefore,Kousar has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy the grinding machine. She has to look after a huge family, taking care of her children, including their school fees, diet and health. 

For these purposes she needs a large income and her husband is the only person who is responsible for bearing the household expenses.

loans.use: to use this loan for her husband to purchase a grinding machine

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
A wonderful day, lenders! 

This is Juliet. She is 43 years old and lives in Paranaque City, Philippines. 

Currently, she manages her sari-sari store (variety store) business. She started this trade ten years ago. Through this long venture in entrepreneurship, she was given a chance to join CCT. Being a member of this group of ministries, she was highly motivated to improve her business. She works persistently to provide for the daily needs of her household. 

A sari-sari store is often seen in the Philippines, especially along the sidewalks and streets. It is most like a convenience store, but smaller and generally offering limited products that are commonly needed such as toiletries, food, beverages, and other commodities. Unlike grocery stores, sari-sari stores offer products at low cost, which is really an advantage for customers. At some point, customers can also have credit, but this sometimes becomes a difficulty for Juliet, especially when debts are not paid. 

To improve her sales, Juliet asks for help from you. She would like to borrow a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase additional products and merchandise items for her store. With this, she expects to grow her sales and improve her family’s living conditions. Today, you can be a big part of her life. 

She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business, and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/ clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional products and merchandise items for her store.

loans.name: Maria Pastora

texts.es: Pastora es una señora trabajadora, ella vive con su esposo y con sus 4 hijos menores de edad que se encuentran estudiando, ella se dedica a criar chanchos y también trabaja a medio tiempo arreglando una casa, su esposo se dedica a trabajar al jornal de trabajo en el campo, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos, Pastora aspira seguir trabajando para mejorar sus ingreso y cubrir los gastos de estudio de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Pastora is a hardworking lady. She lives with her husband and their four young children, who are studying in school. She raises pigs and she also works part-time repairing a house. Her husband works as a day laborer in the country.

She is going to invest the loan in the purchase of pigs. Pastora aspires to continue working to improve her income and to cover the costs of her children’s studies.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Merli Elizabeth

texts.es:
Merli, es madre de 2 hijos, solo estudio hasta noveno grado, debido a los escasos recursos económicos, está casada, su esposo trabaja en una empresa de concentrados y sus 2 hijos están en etapa escolar.

Merli, tiene mucha experiencia en cultivos agrícolas, aprendió está actividad de sus padres porque desde muy jovencita le enseñaron a cultivar y ser independiente, tiene diez años de trabajar en sus propios cultivos, en sus momentos libres cría aves de corral para vender y tener una fuente de ingresos adicionales, el lugar donde ella siembra sus cultivos es un terreno cercano a su vivienda y se desplaza a pie por una distancia de un kilómetro aproximadamente y solo le ayuda su esposo en dichas labores.

Merli, necesita el préstamo para comprar una ternera, para criarla y engordarla para venderla cuando termine el invierno, con la venta de la ternera espera lograr obtener una buena ganancia y de esta forma poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.

Merli, planea tener a futuro varios animales de granja para comercializar y poder dar a sus hijos una buena calidad de vida; además sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Merli is the mother of 2 children. She only went to school until the 9th grade since her parents didn't have the necessary resources to continue supporting her in her studies. She is married and her husband is employed at an animal feed company and her 2 children are in school.

Merli has a lot of experience growing crops.  She learned how to grow and how to be independent from her parents since she was very young.  She has 10 years of experience working with her own crops.  In her free time, she raises corral birds to sell for an additional source of income.  The place where she plants her crops is very close to her home and she walks approximately 1 kilometer to get there.  Only her husband helps her out with the farm work.

Nelsy needs the loan to buy a calf to raise and fatten to sell at the end of winter.  She hopes that the sale of the calf will be a good source of profit so that she can help her husband with the household expenses.  

In the future, Merli plans to have various farm animals to sell and therefore be able to give her children a good quality of life.  She also dreams of seeing her children become professionals.

loans.use: to buy a calf to raise and fatten to sell at the end of winter.

loans.name: Rita Maribel

texts.es:
Rita, de 39 años de edad, tiene dos hijos y vive con su madre, es madre soltera y a criado a sus dos hijos con la ayuda de su madre y el esfuerzo y trabajo de las dos.

Rita, se dedica a los oficios del hogar, pero también es agricultora y hace milpas para poder sustentar a su familia y de los mismo producto obtener ganancias cuando los vende y así proveerse de lo necesario.

Rita, necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agricolas para sembrar maíz y frijol, ya que ella siembra de las dos clases de granos para consumo y para la venta.

Rita, sueña con poder darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos y poder devolverle a su madre un poco de la gran ayuda que ha sido para ella.
texts.en:
Rita is 39 years old and has 2 children.  She lives with her mother.  She is a single mother and she has raised her children with the help of her mother through their combined work and effort.  

Rita makes a living doing housework, but she is also a farmer and she plants corn fields to be able to sustain her family and to bring in income when she sells the corn and therefore provide for her needs.  

Rita needs this loan to buy agricultural inputs to plant corn and beans, since she plants both kinds of grains to eat and to sell.  

Rita dreams of being able to give her children a better future and returning a little bit of the large amount of help that her mother has given her.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to plant corn and beans.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is aged 32 years old, is married and supports three children.

She has been a small scale farmer for the last 11 years.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow in order to increase milk production for supply.

She plans to use the anticipated proceeds to repay the loan and educate her children to higher levels of learning.

Her hope is to improve the family's living standards

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow in order to increase milk production for supply.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 39 years old and single with three children aged 8, 6 and 3 years old.

She has been operating a shop for the last three years and now she earns a monthly income of KES 20,000.

She has borrowed a loan of KES 20,000 as her first loan and intends to purchase sugar, salt, rice and bar soap for her shop. The anticipated profits from her business shall be used to pay back the loan.

Her dream for her future business is to have a wholesale business and educate her children to higher levels of education.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, salt, rice and bar soap for her shop.

loans.name: Joram

texts.en:
Joram is 30 years old. He is not married but has one child who he supports.

Joram operates a transport business via his motorcycle, a business he has run for the last five years and it has been profitable.

He will be using the loan to purchase a motorcycle and hopes this will help him pay school fees.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to open another business and educate his child successfully.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to repay for goods taken on credit.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, formula, and sulfate for the corn, and to put aside some capital for planting beans.

loans.name: St. George School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Fr. John. He is the Head Teacher of St. George School, a mixed school in the rural area of Mutorere in Kisoro with 500 students. St. George School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

St. George School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Fr. John ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from waterborne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Franciscah

texts.en:
Fransciscah is 60 years old. She is married with two children. She is a farmer growing maize and beans. She has been in the farming business for 25 years. 

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. She will use profits from the expanded business to educate her children and expand her business. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to grow her farming to increase the yields.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Valerio

texts.es:
Valerio es un hombre de trabaja fuertemente para darle a su familia lo mejor, el desde hace varios años se ha dedicado al cultivo, pues es  una de las actividades más rentables que él tiene, Valerio cuenta que antes  de tener acceso al crédito en cultivaba muy poco y sus ganancias también eran así, el aunque se esforzaba mucho, incrementar su cultivo lo veía muy difícil fue cundo tomo la iniciativa de solicitar un préstamo que a Dios gracias fue de mucho beneficio para él, porque logro comprar sus semillas de papa, abono químico y orgánico, afortunadamente pudo venderlos en su mercado regional, con esta superación Valerio está muy satisfecho por lo que solicita un nuevo préstamo para la compra de semillas de papa y pago de mantenimiento de una parte de su cultivo.
Valerio tiene la visión de superación y es lo que busca cada, porque el espera seguir mejorado la calidad de vida de su querida familia.
texts.en:
Valerio is a man who works hard to give his family the best.  He has made a living growing crops for several years, since it is one of the most profitable business activities available to him.  Valerio says that before he had access to credit he planted very little and his earnings also small.  Even though he worked very hard, he found it very difficult to increase his production.  

Then he took the initiative to take out a loan, and, thank God, it was very beneficial to him.  He was able to buy potato seeds and chemical and organic fertilizer.  Fortunately, he was able to sell his crops at the regional market.  Valerio is very satisfied with this improvement, so he is taking out another loan to buy potato seeds and pay for the maintenance of one portion of his crops.  

Valerio has a vision of achievement and he seeks it out every day because he hopes to continue improving the quality of life of his beloved family.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and pay for crop maintenance.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
Luz Marina y su esposo siempre se han caracterizado por ser un dúo dinámico, desde que se conocieron coincidían en los planes y se empeñaban en prosperar para ofrecerles un buen futuro a sus hijos. Por ello, cuando Luz Marina se le ocurrió emprender un negocio de venta de productos de limpieza, él fue el primero en apoyarla, desde hace 21 años. 
En la actualidad, es un negocio estable y rentable, debido a la calidad, precios y accesibilidad al local. Con los ingresos han podido ampliar su casa y ofrecer una buena calidad de vida  a sus dos hijos. Sin embargo, Luz Marina, solicita un crédito para comprar esponjas, cloro, jabones, detergente, quitamanchas, cepillo para inodoro, guantes y demás artículos que pueda comercializar en su negocio. De esta forma, podrá ofrecer todos los productos de demanda y aumentará sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Luz Marina and her husband have always been characterized as the dynamic duo. Ever since they first met, they have joined forces and worked hard to prosper and give their children the best possible future. 

Therefore, when Luz Marina decided to start a business selling cleaning products, her husband was the first to support her, and has continued to do so for the last 21 years. 

Nowadays, the business is stable and profitable, thanks to the quality, prices and accessible location. With the profits from the business, Luz Marina has been able to expand the family home and offer a good quality of life to her two children. 

Luz Marina is seeking a loan to buy sponges, bleach, soaps, detergents, stain removers, toilet brushes, gloves and other items she can sell at her business. In this way, Luz Marina can offer all the products her customers are looking for increase her earnings.

loans.use: To buy sponges, bleach, soaps, detergents, stain removers, toilet brushes, gloves and other items.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, se desempeña como administrador auxiliar de una transportadora, estudia análisis de sistema y comenta que su mayor deseo es graduarse y apoyar a su familia en todos los aspectos. 
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Carlos is from the city of Coronel Oviedo. He works as an assistant manager at a transportation center. He studied systems analysis. He says that is greatest desire is to graduate and support his family in all aspects. He is requesting this loan to pay for tuition fees and thus continue studying as he has been doing.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Aida Estenia

texts.es: La vivienda en la que habita Aida de 35 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica desde hace 5 años a la venta de bebidas frías como jugos y gaseosas, además vende productos de joyería de forma ambulante. Aida vive en casa de su propiedad junto a su hija de 18 años de edad a la que ha logrado sacar adelante como madre soltera. Aida siempre busca la manera de mejorar su vivienda para contar con una mejor calidad de vida, es por ello que desea reparar el cuarto de la cocina, ya que desea tener un lugar adecuado donde preparar sus alimentos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, madera, clavos y alambre para cambiar la lámina de la cocina y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The house in which Aida, age 35, lives. She is a hardworking woman who has been selling cold beverages such as juices and soft drinks for five years; and in addition, she sells jewelry products on foot. Aida lives in her own house with her eighteen-year-old daughter, whom she has managed to raise as a single mother.
