Aida is always looking for ways to improve her house in order to have a better quality of life, which is why she wants to repair the kitchen. She wants to have a place that is fit for preparing her food. 

For this reason, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI, which she will invest it in the purchase of metal sheeting, wood, nails, and wire, in order to replace the metal sheeting in the kitchen and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in metal sheeting, wood, nails, and wire, in order to replace the metal sheeting in the kitchen and improve her quality of life.

loans.name: Kabibi

texts.en:
Kabibi is a married woman with two children, all of whom attends school. She lives at her own house but does doesn't have electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to pay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, biscuits, milk and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, biscuits, milk and wheat flour

loans.name: Hedeya

texts.en: Hedeya, 50 years old, is married and has 3 daughters and 2 sons. One of her daughters suffers from a chronic disease and she goes to Cairo for medical treatments. Hedeya has a poultry sales project but the income from the business can barely cover her family's basic needs and her daughter's medications. Hedeya is requesting a 5,000 EGP loan to buy ducks, chickens and geese for sale to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: To buy ducks, chickens and geese for sale to generate more income for her family.

loans.name: Dehisy

texts.es:
Dehisy es una estudiante muy sacrificada desde el primer año hasta hoy día que estoy por culminar mis estudios. 
Comenta que su familia siempre le ayudó hasta donde podían para poder estudiar, es una persona que se sacrifica mucho para poder estudiar. La carrera que está siguiendo es la de enfermería para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Dehisy has been a very self-sacrificing student from year 1 until now as she is about to finish her studies. She says that her family has always helped her to go to school as much as they could. She is an individual who sacrifices a lot in order to study. Dehisy is studying nursing so she can help her loved ones. She is requesting this loan to pay for tuition fees and thus continue studying as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a solar electric fence to protect his cows, to keep them inside his land and to prevent access by robbers.

loans.name: Aminu

texts.en:
Aminu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Magami Village. Aminu joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Aminu suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to increase his farmland. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Aminu has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. With ambitious goals of harvesting 80 bags of maize this year, Aminu can now ensure that his children get a post-secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Little Angels Ntungamo School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Alfred. He is the director of the Little Angels Ntungamo School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Ntungamo with 500 students. Little Angels School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a 750-liter UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term and the cost of firewood will be reduced. Alfred will use his loan to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

The Little Angels School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Alfred ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases. He also hopes it will increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for students.

loans.name: Silvino

texts.es:
El Sr. Silvino es dueño de una distribuidora de pollos, es una persona muy trabajadora, que con sacrificio está saliendo adelante, ayuda a sus seres queridos por medio de su trabajo, dándoles todo lo que el no pudo tener.
Comenta que quiere seguir creciendo en su emprendimiento, es por ello que está trabajando mucho, y por ello pide este préstamo, para poder comprar equipos refrigeración, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Silvino is the owner of a chicken distributing business. He is very hard-working and with sacrifice he has been getting ahead. 

Silvino supports his loved ones with the work he does, giving them everything he didn't have himself growing up. He says that he would like to keep growing his business, in order to do this he is working hard and he has is also seeking a loan. The loan will be used to buy refrigeration equipment. This will allow Silvino to continue selling chickens in the manner he has been doing.

loans.use: to buy refrigeration equipment.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad, 25 years old, is married to a housewife and has a baby boy. He owns a small fattening project. Mohammad is requesting a 10,000 EGP loan to buy a head of cattle to use its milk for making cheese and butter for domestic use and for sale in the local market. He believes the income from the project will help him to provide better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: To buy a head of cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more sorghum for sale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 42 years old. She is married and they have two children. She does farming and also sells cereals, maize, beans, cow peas etc. She has been in the business for five years. 

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy cereals for sale. She will use profits from the expanded business to educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cereals- maizee, beans, cow peas for sale

loans.name: Menelio

texts.es:
El Señor Menelio es dueño de una casa de repuestos y equipamientos para motos, es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que por medio de su trabajo está saliendo adelante.
El Sr. Menelio está esforzándose para poder crecer y seguir creciendo como lo viene haciendo. Pide este préstamo para poder refaccionar su negocio, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Menelio owns a spare parts and equipment shop for motorcycles. He is a very hardworking and enterprising individual. He is getting ahead by means of his job. Menelio is striving to grow and continue to grow as he has been doing. He is requesting this loan to renovate his shop and thus continue with his sales.

loans.use: to renovate his shop.

loans.name: Ancilla

texts.en:
Ancilla is 29 years old.She is married and they have four children. She operates a butcher shop. She has been in the business for five years. 

This is her second loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy meat for sale. She will use profits from the expanded business to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw meat for sale

loans.name: Nzadze

texts.en:
Nzadze is a married woman; she has eight children, all of whom attend school. Nzadzeowns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Nzadze has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a stiff competition from other firewood operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Félix es un hombre casado de 56 años de edad, es feliz mente casado con una linda familia por la que se esmera día a día, el desde hace varios años se ha dedicado al cultivo, él cuenta que los préstamo son la única forma de poder prosperar, puesto que Félix se ha visto beneficiado con el préstamo anterior, y con el deseo de seguir prosperando nuevamente solicita un préstamo para la compra de semillas y abono químico, orgánico, porque es la temporada de cultivar y el necesita un poco más de capital para cubrir todos los gastos de su cultivo porque ahora a incrementado.
Félix ama a su familia y su mayor anhelo es poder  comprar más terreno donde ahora pueda cultivar, pero en el futuro sus hijos construyan sus casas en ella.
texts.en:
Félix is 56 years old and  happily married, with a lovely family for which he strives day after day. He has been a farmer for many years, and says that these loans are the only way for him to prosper, given that Félix has benefited from the previous loan. With a desire for continued success, he is asking for another loan to purchase seeds, and chemical and organic fertilizers, because it's harvest season and he needs a little more capital to cover all of the expenses of his harvest, which has recently increased.

Félix loves his family, and his main wish is to be able to buy more land he can farm, but where in the future his children can also build their houses.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, and chemical and organic fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a solar system to light his house after sunset, to replace the use of candles and to give his children the opportunity to study and do their homework after dark.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en: Fatma, 34 years old, is married to a driver and has a frozen meat and fish sales business. She is requesting a 10,000 EGP loan to buy other types of frozen foods such as liver, chickens and ducks, to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: To buy frozen foods such as liver, chickens and ducks.

loans.name: African Outreach School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Sarah. She is the head teacher of the African Outreach School, a mixed school in the urban area of Luweero with 800 students. African Outreach School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a 1,000-liter UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. Sarah will use her loan to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

African Outreach School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Sarah ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases. She also hopes it will increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for students

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
El Sr. Julio es de la ciudad de Curuguaty, es dueño  de una empresa de excavaciones, el cual se dedica a las excavaciones de tierras, para desarrollar dicha actividad cuenta con un retroexcavadora.
Es una persona muy trabajadora que comenta que desde muy joven ha trabajado y con esfuerzo está saliendo adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar cubiertas para su retroexcavadora, ya que es su principal maquinaria de trabajo y quiere tenerla en condiciones para poder cumplir con sus clientes.
texts.en:
Julio is from the city of Curuguaty. He owns an excavation company that excavates land. In order to perform said job, he has a backhoe.

Julio is a very hardworking individual who says that from a young age, he has worked and with effort, he is getting ahead. He is requesting this loan to buy tires for his backhoe since it is his main machine and he wants to have it in good condition in order to meet his customers needs.

loans.use: to buy tires for his backhoe.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a solar system to improve his family´s living conditions by giving them access to electricity, to stop using candles as a light source, and to have more light hours each day.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay small photovoltaic solar electricity systems for their houses.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Tomasa es una mujer de 35 años de edad, casada, tiene una hija de 3 años, y trabaja en la elaboración y venta de dulces de nuez.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, dinámica, optimista, generosa, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘Sacaba’ localizada a 13 kilómetros en dirección este, capital culinaria, famosa por su cocina basadas en carne de conejo cuy y otras ofrendas gastronómicas, es también famoso por sus numerosas chicherías, que producen la chicha de maíz (Que es un fermento de la misma) de un agradable sabor, se cita al pueblo con picardía como "Sacaba - donde la chicha nunca se acaba". De clima cálido y medianamente seco.
Tomasa es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica a la agricultura y con su hija que aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe y madera con techo de calamina y piso de tierra que cuenta con agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba, energía eléctrica y no cuenta con alcantarillado. Su negocio es la elaboración y comercio de dulces de nuez. Recientemente el gobierno nacional otorgó financiamiento para la conexión de agua potable en el lugar, “usamos agua de pozo, esta es sucia y mancha la ropa, queremos conectar agua potable para mejorar nuestras vidas y también mi negocio…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con demanda, la desventaja es la falta de capital para la instalación de agua potable en su cocina, baño y lavandería. Su sueño es contar con agua potable en su hogar, ella desea realizar la instalación de agua potable en su cocina, baño y lavandería para mejorar su salud y condiciones higiénicas. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Tomasa solicita un préstamo para la instalación de agua potable en su cocina, baño y lavandería para mejorar su salud y condiciones higiénicas.
texts.en:
Tomasa is a 35-year-old woman, married, with a three-year-old daughter, and works in the production and sale of walnut sweets.  She is a good mother, enterprising, dynamic, optimistic, generous, responsible, and very hardworking.  

Her business is located in Sacaba, located 13 kilometers east, which is a culinary capital famous for its cuisine based in rabbit and guinea pig meat and other dishes.  It is also famous for its numerous pleasant-tasting "chicherías" produced from "chicha de maíz" (a purple corn drink fermented from the same), slyly citing the town name from:  "Sacaba, where the chicha never ends".  The climate is warm and moderately dry.

Tomasa is tan-skinned, brown-eyed, short-staured, and a slim physical build.  She has long black hair that she wears braided.  Her manner of dressing is traditional (hat, shawl, and pleated skirt).  She uses her native language, Quechua, in this locale and Spanish in mainstream culture and business.  She shares her life with her husband -- who works in agriculture -- and her daughter who is not yet school-aged.  They live in their own house, constructed from adobe and wood with a corrugated metal roof and an earthen floor.  It has pump-extracted well water, electric energy, and doesn't have a sewage system.

Her business is in the production and sale of walnut sweets.  Recently, the national government awarded financing to connect potable water in this locale.  "We use well water, it is dirty and stains clothing.  We want to connect potable water to better our lives and also my business," she comments.  The advantage of her business is that there is demand for it.  The disadvantage is the lack of capital for the installation of potable water in her kitchen, bathroom, and laundry.  Her dream is to have potable water in her home.  She wants to see the installation of potable water in her kitchen, bathroom, and laundry to better her health and hygienic conditions.  This is the first in a series of loans with the institution in four years she's been dedicated to this activity.

It is for these reasons that Tomasa is requesting a loan for the installation of potable water in her kitchen, bathroom, and laundry, to better her health and hygienic conditions.

loans.use: with the installation of potable water in her kitchen, bathroom, and laundry to better her health and hygienic conditions.

loans.name: Auwalu

texts.en:
Auwalu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Dokantoro Village. He joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Auwalu suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children's school fees. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Auwalu will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizer, herbicides, and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. His loan will help him to considerably increase his household income. 

Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Auwalu now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs to increase his farm's yields

loans.name: Placida

texts.en:
Placida is a farmer who lives with her family in the locality of Chirimoyo in the Mexican state of Guerrero. This locality has less than 200 residents and, due to its location, has no access to basic services such as electricity. Placida’s house is one of the houses in Chirimoyo with no access to electricity so she uses candles for light. She a farmer who cultivates corn. Placida earns the minimum Mexican salary from which she pays a 13 USD monthly to purchase candles. This is a high percentage of Placida’s income. 

Placida is requesting a loan to purchase a solar system to efficiently illuminate her house and reduce her family’s use of candles. Her loan will also enable her family to stop inhaling smoke from the candles, which is bad for their health.

loans.use: to purchase a solar system to efficiently illuminate her house and reduce her family’s use of candles

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for small photovoltaic solar electric systems for their houses.

loans.name: Virgen

texts.en:
Virgen is a farmer who lives with her family in Chirimoyo. 

Chirimoyo is a small locality in the state of Guerrero, where fewer than 200 persons live. Chirimoyo is deficient and has no access to basic services such as electricity. Since Virgen's family is one of the families with no access to electricity, she uses candles to illuminate her house. The use of candles represent a negative impact in their health because of smoke inhalation, and it also represents a high expenditure of her monthly income. 

Virgen is a farmer who cultivates corn and beans, so she earns the minimum Mexican salary. This is not enough to spend money on light sources (candles) and to make monthly savings. 

Virgen wants to purchase a solar system to have access to electricity, to be able to see better after the sunset, to give the opportunity for her children to do their homework in the dark, and to stop inhaling the smoke from the candles. With the solar system, their living conditions will improve. After paying the total amount of the solar system, she will have some money to save each month for unexpected events.

loans.use: to purchase a solar system to be able to see at night, to have electricity, and to improve her family's living conditions by having more productive hours.

loans.name: Margarita Ignacia

texts.es: Margarita es una mujer trabajadora de 35 años de edad que cada día se gana la vida con su negocio de venta de tortillas, golosinas y bebidas, actividad que le he permitido sacar adelante a su familia, desde hace 4 años, por lo que ya cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes que solicitan sus productos. Margarita desea mejorar el área del techo de su vivienda, ya que este se encuentra deteriorado, por el paso del tiempo y las inclemencias del clima, por lo que ella ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para mejorar el techo de su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Margarita is a hardworking 35 year old woman who earns a living each day with her business selling tortillas, candy and drinks. This activity is what has allowed her to provide for her family for the last four years. She has many customers who buy her products. 
Margarita wishes to repair an area of the roof of her house. It has deteriorated with the passage of time and the harsh climate. This is why she has decided to request a loan from FUSAI to invest in: galvanized metal sheets, wood, and nails in order to repair her roof as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, wood, and nails in order to repair her roof as soon as possible

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es:
Gonzalo es una más de las personas que busca prosperidad con su familia y gracias a su dedicación, esmero en su trabajo y con apoyo que obtuvo con el crédito, él logro culminar la construcción de su casa y su familia ya cuenta con un mejor hogar, Gonzalo con este avance se siente muy satisfecho porque por fin logro su objetivo, aunque uno de las prioridades ahora es instalar el servicio de drenaje  para que esta casa quede completa, a raíz de esta necesidad solicita un nuevo préstamo para poder pagar la instalación del servicio de drenaje.
Gonzalo su mayor sueño es que su familia cuente con un hogar digno para vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Gonzalo is another one of those people in search of prosperity for himself and his family. Thanks to his dedication, his care in his work, and the support he got from the loan, he succeeded in finishing the construction on his house. His family now enjoys a better home.

Gonzalo feels very satisfied with this progress because he achieved his goal at last, although now one of his priorities is to install a drainage system, so that the house will be complete. Because of this necessity, he is requesting a new loan to pay for the installation of the drainage system.

Gonzalo's biggest dream is that his family might enjoy a dignified home in order to live better.

loans.use: to pay for installation of a drainage system

loans.name: Eva Del Carmen

texts.es:
Eva de 40 años de edad, es una mujer dedicada a la agricultura vive con dos de sus hijos y su esposo con quien trabaja arduamente para sacar adelante a la familia.

Eva cuenta con la cuenta más de 25 años  en la actividad agrícola, principalmente en la siembra de granos básicos y con una gran experiencia en la venta de frijoles.


Con el crédito se le estará ayudando a Eva para comprar abono agrícola para recuperar parte de la siembra que fue afectada por la escasez de las lluvias.

Sus sueños para un futuro son comprar una vaca que le produzca leche para comercializarlo de la mejor manera.
texts.en:
40-year-old Eva is a woman dedicated to farming. She lives with two of her children and her husband, with whom she works hard to support the family.

Eva has more than 25 years of experience in farming, mainly in growing basic grains, and she has a lot of experience selling beans.

Through this loan, you will be helping Eva to buy agricultural compost in order to make up part of the crop that was affected by the lack of rain.

Her dreams for the future are to buy a cow that will produce milk that she can sell in the best way.

loans.use: to buy agricultural compost in order to make up part of the crop that was affected by the lack of rain

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan es un joven emprendedor de 25 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hija en una casa que le ha dado su padre para habitar mientras Juan construye su propia casa.
 
Juan se dedica a la crianza de animales de granja principalmente vacas y además toda la vida ha sido agricultor, ha sembrado maíz, tomate y frijol.

Él necesita este crédito para comprar abonos, fertilizantes y venenos para aplicar a su milpa y así conseguir excelente cosecha.

Él planea comprar más animales y tener la mejor granja de su cantón.
texts.en:
Juan is a young entrepreneur of 25. He lives with his wife and daughter in a house that his father gave him to live in while Juan builds his own house.

Juan raises farm animals, principally cattle, and in addition, he has been a farmer his whole life. He has raised corn, tomatoes, and beans.

He needs this loan in order to buy compost, fertilizers, and poisons to apply to his field and thus obtain an excellent harvest.

He plans to buy more animals and have the best farm in his canton.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers, and poisons to apply to his field and thus obtain an excellent harvest.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo es un hombre de 35 años de edad, es casado con una familia muy unida, el desde hace varios años se ha dedica a la elaboración de ropa típica, que es su mayor fuente de ingreso.
Pablo con el afán de ser un gran tejedor busca prepararse todos los días para superar los retos de la vida, pues el mundo de la ropa cada día evoluciona más y la competencia es mucho más fuerte, pero a pesar de todos los obstáculos Pablo ha obtenido buena fama como tejedor de ropa típica, es una de los tejedores más buscadas por las personas de su comunidad y esto le incentivo a él para acudir a los préstamos que ahora son esenciales para él, porque solo así  puedo competir con las demás personas modernizado a si sus  tejidos y vendiendo mucho mejor, Pablo viendo  todo esta competencia de la vida, solicita otro crédito para comprar hilos de tipo, seda, alemán, y lustrina para seguir elaborando los mejores trajes de su comunidad.
El gran sueño de Pablo es mejorar sus ingresos para construir su casa así poder darle a su familia una mejor hogar.
texts.en: Pablo is a 35 year old man. He is married with a very close family. For many years, he has worked making traditional clothing which is his main source of income. In order to be a great weaver, Pablo looks for ways to prepare himself every day to overcome life's challenges, because the clothing world develops every day and the competition is stronger; but, even with all these obstacles, Pablo has become famous as a weaver of traditional clothing. He is one of the most searched weavers by the people of his community, and this is what motivated to apply for loans that are now essential to him, because only with them he can compete with other people, modernizing his weaving and selling much better. Seeing all the competition in his life, Pablo is requesting another loan to buy thread of various types: silk thread, German embroidery thread and cotton thread in order to keep making the best dresses in his community. Pablo's greatest dream is to improve his income to build his house, and in this way be able to give his family a better home.

loans.use: to buy thread of various types: silk thread, German embroidery thread and cotton thread.

loans.name: Jose Leonidas

texts.es:
José  es un hombre muy trabajador de 37 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado de educación básica, tiempo atrás emigro a Estados Unidos buscando mejores oportunidades de trabajo, lamentablemente al poco tiempo de estar allá fue deportado y tuvo que regresar de nuevo al país; lo primero que hizo fue establecer un negocio de venta de comida, ahora está casado, tiene dos hijas y su esposa se dedica a atender este negocio.

José trabajó mucho tiempo en la agricultura junto a su padre, luego realizó trabajos en albañilería, actualmente tiene un negocio de venta de comida, este negocio lo atienden de lunes a sábado, su esposa es quien más lo apoya en las actividades y sus hijas en sus tiempos libres de la escuela.


Este crédito lo necesita para comprar maíz y otros insumos para su negocio de venta de comida, aprovechando el descuento que le hacen por la compra en mayoreo.

Su sueño es ver que sus dos hijas culminen sus estudios, sabe que con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo podrán lograrlo.
texts.en: José is a very hardworking 37 year old man with a sixth grade education. Some time ago he emigrated to the United States in search of better work opportunities. Unfortunately, after a short time there, he was deported and had to return to El Salvador. The first thing he did was to start a business selling meals. Now he is married, has two daughters and his wife helps him with this business. José worked a long time in farming with his father. He then worked as a builder, and currently, he has a business selling meals. He works at this business from Monday to Saturday. His wife is who supports him more in this job, and so do his daughters in their free time from school. He needs this loan to buy corn and other inputs for his business selling meals, taking advantage of the discount he gets by buying wholesale. His dream is to see his two daughters finish their studies. He knows that with a lot of work and effort they will be able to do it.

loans.use: to buy corn and other inputs for his business of selling meals.

loans.name: Candelario

texts.es:
Candelario tiene 58 años de edad, es un agricultor que vive con su mujer y sus 4 hijos, excombatiente en el conflicto armado de El Salvador, en donde quedó con daños en una de sus manos.


Candelario tiene más de 40 años dedicándose a la agricultura con gran  experiencia en la siembra frijol y maíz, lo cual es una actividad que aprendió desde pequeño con sus padres. 


Debido a la actividad productiva que realiza, Candelario solicita este préstamo para comprar insumos  agrícolas como abono y venenos para proteger a la cosecha de las malezas.

Candelario  planea en el futuro  comprarles una vaca a sus hijos para que la cuiden y comiencen a trabajar con ganado y de esta manera dejarles una herencia productiva.
texts.en:
Candelario is 58 years old. He is a farmer who lives with his wife and 4 children. He is an ex-combatant from the armed conflict in El Salvador, where he was left with injuries to one of his hands.

Candelario has more than 40 years of experience working in agriculture, with a lot of experience growing beans and corn. He learned this trade from his parents beginning when he was young. 

Because of the productive work that he carries out, Candelario is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies, such as fertilizer and herbicides to protect the harvest from weeds.

Candelario plans to buy his children a cow in the future, so that they can care for it and start to work with livestock. In this way, he will leave them a productive legacy.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies, such as fertilizer and herbicides

loans.name: María Celsa

texts.es:
María tiene 36 años de edad, es una mujer muy luchadora, en su vida ha tenido que enfrentar una serie de dificultades, entre ellas la situación económica en que sus padres vivían, razón por la cual decidió abandonar sus estudios de noveno grado. Actualmente vive con sus 2 hijos quienes son menores de edad, ella ha luchado para poder sacarlos adelante, pues su esposo tuvo que salir del país para buscar empleo y poder apoyarlos.



 María se ha dedicado al comercio desde hace 7 años, ella atendía su pequeña tienda, la cual tuvo que cerrar por falta de capital y por la ausencia de su esposo, lo que hacia difícil de mantenerla activa.

 Ella necesita el crédito para invertir nuevamente en su antigua tienda, en la que espera tener bebidas refrescantes, pan, golosinas y otros productos que son parte del consumo diario.

Su sueño es que sus hijos puedan tener mejores condiciones de las que ella tuvo, y así sacarlos adelante dándoles la alimentación diaria y el estudio.
texts.en:
Maria is 36 years old. She is a very hard-working woman. In her life, she has had to face a series of difficulties, among them the economic situation in which her parents lived, the reason why she decided to give up her studies in ninth grade. She now lives with her two children, who are minors. She has worked hard to be able to raise them, since her husband had to leave the country to look for employment and be able to support them.

Maria has worked in commerce for 7 years. She tends her little store, which she had to close for lack of capital and because of the absence of her husband, which made it difficult to keep it active.

She needs the loan to invest again in her old store, in which she hopes to have soft drinks, bread, candies, and other products that are part of daily consumption.

Her dream is that her children can have better conditions than those that she had and to thus raise them giving them daily nourishment and an education.

loans.use: to invest again in her old store, in which she hopes to have soft drinks, bread, candies, and other products that are part of daily consumption.

loans.name: Lenlai Group

texts.en:
“I’m proud to say that I can earn everyday. It doesn’t matter how much,” says 43-year-old Hoinu, a vegetable vendor. She is the featured borrower of ‘Lenlai’ group and pictured with her hand raised. Lenlai is a group of 14 women formed with a common interest to achieve their financial goals.

Hoinu is a mother of four school-going children. They are a family of six and her husband is a cultivator. Hoinu sells seasonal vegetables like cabbages, potatoes, beans and many more to generate income. Her income is used to pay household expenses, her children's educational costs and other necessities.

She has been in this business for the past five years and she enjoys doing it. Her favorite part of the business is selling good quality vegetables to her customers. She does not have a specific spot or place in her business. She sells her vegetables according to the local market day, which changes locations everyday according to the market routine of the villages.

With the Kiva loan, she will buy sacks and quintals of cabbages, potatoes, beans and other leafy vegetables from a supplier to sell for profit. The profit she makeings will help her to pay her children’s school fees and other family expenses to a great extent. She also hopes to engage in daily savings. She aspires to do better in her business like selling more vegetable items and increasing her customers. Hoinu is very happy to get a loan. She and the rest of the group members are excitedly waiting to get their loan. They say “Thank you Kiva for your support.”

loans.use: to buy a stock of vegetables to sell for profit and pay for her children's school fees and other items.

loans.name: Swaumu

texts.en:
Swaumu is 39 years old, not married but has got one son who is in school. Since 2008, she has been supporting her family by running a room as a beauty salon and selling ladies' stuff. She is really working hard and being a good customer of Tujijenge. She starts working at 8am until 6pm per working day and is able to make a good profit each month.

This is her 20th credit from Tujijenge Tanzania. Swaumu has been with Tujijenge since 2008, taking several loans which she has paid back successfully. These are benefits from previous loans; being able to pay well her son's school fee all the time, house needs, bought a plot of land and expect to build a house, bought a TV, radio, sofa set and bed. It's really given hope from Kiva lenders to herself and her life has changed tremendously. In addition to the home part, she has also improved her business, upgraded to selling ladies' stuff. In the coming years, she would like to manage a butcher shop and pharmacy business.

She is now requesting another credit which she will use to buy salon working equipment and ladies' clothes to resell, as she wants to increase service. Swaumu will be accountable for paying back her loan as per schedule.

loans.use: to buy salon working equipment and ladies' clothes to resell in the same room.

loans.name: Ayuba

texts.en:
Ayuba is a Babban Gona maize farmer from the Gidan Dauda Village. Ayuba joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Ayuba suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to pay for his children's school fees. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Ayuba will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Ayuba now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase yields.

loans.name: Natividad Mercedes

texts.es:
Natividad es una señora de 64 años de edad, ella es soltera y vive solo con una hija, pues el otro hijo ya está casado y vive aparte,  ella es luchadora y se preocupa por salir adelante día con día.


Natividad se dedica a la venta de pupusas en la escuela de su comunidad,  ya tiene varios años en dedicarse a eso, además, vende golosinas y frutas para los niños, ella asegura que esa es su principal fuente de ingresos.

Ella necesita este crédito para comprar maíz, quesillo, frijoles, aceite, chicharrón, golosinas, etc para seguir adelante con su chalet.

Ella sueña con un mejor futuro para ella y su familia dice que el trabajo es bendición pero también quiere descansar  y estar tranquila cuando sea mas mayor.
texts.en:
Natividad is a woman of 64. She is single and lives with only a daughter, since her son is already married and lives separately. She is hard-working and worries about getting ahead day by day.

Natividad sells pupusas [a typical Salvadoran dish] in the school in her community. She has already worked at this for a number of years. In addition, she sells candies and fruits to the children. She states that this is her principal source of income.

She needs this loan to buy corn, fresh cheese, beans, oil, pork rinds, candies, etc., in order to continue ahead with her school snack bar.

She dreams of a better future for herself and her family. She says that the work is a blessing, but she also wants to rest and be in peace when she is older.

loans.use: to buy corn, fresh cheese, beans, oil, pork rinds, candies, etc, in order to continue ahead with her school snack bar.

loans.name: Rosa Dinora

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer luchadora con espíritu de emprendedurismo, ella es casada, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos que estudian en la escuela de la comunidad. 


Ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado municipal, ahí ella tiene su puesto el cual se va muy temprano para atender a sus clientes, tiene varios años dedicándose a eso por lo cual sabe como manejar bien la actividad.

Ella necesita el crédito para comprar mas frutas y verduras para seguir vendiendo en el mercado.


Sueña con que sus hijos estudien y sean personas de bien y que puedan llegar a ser grandes en la vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is a hard-working woman with a spirit on entrepreneurship. She is married. She lives with her husband and their two children, who go to the school in the community.

She sells fruits and vegetables in the municipal market. There she has a stall where she goes very early to serve her customers. She has been working at this for a number of years, and for this reason she knows how to manage the business well.

She needs the loan to buy more fruits and vegetables in order to continue selling in the market.

She dreams that her children can go to school and be good people and that they can become great people in life.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables in order to continue selling in the market.

loans.name: Alhaji Iliya

texts.en:
Alhaji Iliya is a Babban Gona farmer from Magami Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realize better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Alhaji Iliya no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to pay for his children's school fees.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize / hectare, double the national average in Nigeria. This will see him increase his income considerably. This season Alhaji Iliya has ambitious plans to harvest 100 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Alhaji Iliya now has the opportunity to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields.

loans.name: Ericka Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ericka es una joven de 21 años de edad, vive junto a su mamá, hermanos y tíos en una casa bastante pequeña para el número de personas que la habitan en ella, varios de sus hermanos han emigrado debido a la situación económica pero ella sigue acá tratando de salir adelante.

Ella es la encargada de cuidar a sus padres y demás familia según el encargo que le han hecho sus hermanos mayores y además realiza oficios domésticos en casas ajenas.

Ella solicita este crédito para comprar abono, pesticidas y semillas para la cosecha de maíz que realizará con sus tíos.

Ella buscará siempre la forma de ayudar a su familia y posiblemente se siga dedicando a las actividades del hogar.
texts.en:
Ericka is 21 years old. She lives with her mother, brothers and uncles in a rather small house for the number of occupants. Several of her brothers have emigrated due to the economic situation but she is here and trying to get ahead.

She is caring for her parents and her family. This has traditionally been the responsibility of the older siblings. She also performs household chores in the homes of others.

She requests a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seeds to harvest corn with her uncles.

She always seeks ways to help her family and possibly to continue to devote to house work.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seeds to harvest corn with her uncles.

loans.name: Cristino

texts.es:
Cristino de 50 años, logró estudiar segundo año de educación básica, manifiesta que en su época de niñez y juventud era muy difícil el poder estudiar. Está acompañado, su señora se dedica al comercio, tiene un pequeño negocio (tienda, han procreado 3 hijos que ya son mayores. 

Él es empleado en la alcaldía de su municipio, trabaja como seguridad pública, en los días  libres le ayuda a atender el negocio familiar a su señora; en la alcaldía trabaja un día y otro tiene libre, su lugar de trabajo está a 10 km de su casa y viaja en bus, anteriormente se dedicaba a las actividades agrícolas con su padre y hermanos.

El crédito lo necesita para comprar materiales de construcción y mercadería para el negocio, con esta inversión su local será más amplio y ofrecerá mejores servicios.

Él desea que su negocio esté fortalecido y que sea rentable, tener mejores ingresos para su familia y poder generar en un futuro condiciones dignas a su hogar.
texts.en:
Cristino, who is 50 years old, managed to go to school through the second year of basic education. He states that in the time of his childhood and youth, it was very difficult to be able to go to school. He has a partner who works in commerce. She has a little business (a store). They have three children who are already adults.

He is employed at the town hall in his municipality. He works as a security guard. On his free days, he helps his wife to tend the family business. He works every other day at the town hall. His workplace is 10 km from his house and he travels by bus. Previously, he worked in agricultural activities with his father and siblings.

He needs the loan to buy construction materials and merchandise for the business. With this investment, his shop will be larger and he will offer better services.

He wants his business to be strengthened and be profitable, to have better income for his family, and in the future to be able to generate dignified conditions in his home.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and merchandise for the store; with this investment his shop will be bigger.

loans.name: Lucia Antonia

texts.es:
Lucia, de 53 años de edad, es ama de casa, no estudio porque sus padres nunca se preocuparon para que ella estudiara, está soltera y es madre de 3 hijos, los cuales ya están casados y trabajan para su propia alimentación, ella vive con una nieta que está estudiando.

Lucia, trabajo un tiempo en la producción de camarones, luego empezó en el negocio de venta de maíz y tiene 30 años de realizarlo, pero también se dedica a la venta de mariscos desde su casa. 

El crédito que está solicitando es para comprar concentrado y septicida para la mejora de su negocio de mariscos y para la agricultura.

Los sueños de Lucia, son tener mejores estanques camaroneros, mejorar su vivienda y ayudarle a su nieta económicamente, para que pueda seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Lucia, 53 years old, is a housewife.  She never studied because her parents were not concerned that she do so.  She is married and is mother to three children who are already married and work in their own store.  She lives with a granddaughter who is in school.

Lucia worked for a time producing shrimp.  Later, she started a business selling corn.  It took 30 years to realize, but she also works selling seafood from her home.

The loan that she is requesting is to buy chicken feed and septicide for the improvement of her seafood business and for agriculture.

Lucia's dreams are to have better shrimp tanks, to better her housing, and to help her granddaughter financially so she may continue her studies.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed and septicide to improve her seafood business and for agriculture.

loans.name: Shukronai

texts.ru:
Шукронаи 24 летняя замужняя девушка. У нее двое маленьких детей. Ее муж предоставляет услуги по ремонту домов.  Шукронаи дома занимается шитьем женской одежды на заказ. Для нее эта работа очень удобная. Она может заниматься домашними делами, ухаживать за детьми и тоже зарабатывать. Шукронаи берет за свои услуги не много 3-5 долларов за одно платье. 
Шукронаи решила приобрести новую швейную машинку, чтобы ускорить процесс работы, улучшить качество платьев и облегчить себе работу. С этими намерениями она обратилась за кредитом и верит, что ее поддержат.
texts.en:
Shukronai is a 24-year old woman. She has two young children. Her husband  works as contractor providing home renovation services. Shukronai takes orders for sewing clothing out of her home. This type of work is very convenient for her. She can take care of her household and children as well as earn money. Shukronai charges a modest fee for her services--about 3-5 USD per dress.

Shukronai has decided to buy a new sewing machine in order to speed up her work, improve the quality of her dresses and make her work easier. This is what motivated her to apply for a loan. She trusts that she will  obtain support.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith de 44 años de edad, es una madre soltera que vive con sus tres hijos, se dedicada al comercio de cócteles de conchas y camarones lo cual le permite llevar el sustento diario a sus hijos.

Edith tiene más de diez años de trabajar en la venta de cócteles y mariscos logrando una popularidad en todo el pueblo donde ella reside.

Con el crédito se le estará ayudando a Edith para comprar mariscos para continuar vendiendo en el centro de la ciudad.
 
Para un futuro ella planea ampliar sus servicios para desarrollarse adecuadamente y provocar un crecimiento en sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Edith is 44 years old. She is a single mother who lives with her three children. She works selling oyster and shrimp cocktails, which allows her to daily support her children. 
Edith has worked selling cocktails and shellfish for more than ten years, and has become popular throughout the town where she lives. 
The loan will help Edith to buy shellfish to continue selling in the city center. 
For the future, she plans to expand her services to develop adequately in order to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy shellfish to continue selling in the city center.

loans.name: Jason Lom Group

texts.en:
Kimneineng, 30 years old and a married woman, is a mother to three children (two sons and a daughter) who are still studying. She is the featured member of the group “Jason Lom” with her hand raised in the picture. The group “Jason Lom” is comprised of 10 members and they all reside in Keithelman, Senapati district, Manipur. Keithelman is a region with a moderate climate, and a lack of employment, educational and medical facilities. Weaving and sand sieve are common in this region. Her husband is a government employee.

Kimneineng is engaged in traditional weaving and she has been weaving for the past three years. But the income her husband earns is not sufficient for the family and due to the low income, she isn’t able to purchase thread for her weaving. She wants to help her husband in supporting her family by earning, which will only be possible through a WSDS loan.

Kimneineng applied for a WSDS loan with the hope of buying a stock of thread and other raw materials for weaving so that she can sell the traditional shawls and get a profit to pay her children's educational fees and use for family expenses.

Kimneineng is very happy and thankful to WSDS and the funders for their generosity and is looking forward to the loan. The rest of the members are also engaged in tea stall, pan, sand sieve, variety store and aloe vera farming. They are in need and are requesting the loan to move forward with their respective income-generating activities for better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a stock of thread and other raw materials for weaving.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a solar system to increase the electricity generated in her grocery store, to be able to be open at night, and with this increase her family's monthly income.

loans.name: Alonso

texts.en:
Alonso lives with his wife, children and mother in the locality of Betel in the state of Chiapas. This locality is a well-organized one. The people daily strive to improve both their lives and the community's conditions at large because Betel is a marginalized and rural area.

Alonso´s mother owns a grocery store in the community where she sells basic products to the community. The store is the main support for this family of nine. Alonso also has a pickup truck that he uses to transport people from the community to the municipality where most of Betel´s residents work.

Alonso wants to borrow 6,992 MXN through Kiva's field partner ERES Energía Renovable to buy a solar-powered system to light the grocery store so that it can stay open after sunset. It would also serve to light their home which is in the back of the store. Having electricity will be a great improvement in Alonso´s family’s life.

loans.use: to buy a solar-powered system to light both his family's grocery store and house after dark

loans.name: Nicomides

texts.en: Nicomides is a farmer who cultivates corn all year and he earns the minimum Mexican salary. Nicomides is one of the hardworking farmers who lives in the locality of Chirimoyo. Chirimoyo is a small locality in the state of Guerrero with less than 200 residents. Residents in this locality have no access to basic services such as electricity. Nicomides lives with his wife and two kids so he wants to purchase a solar system to improve his family´s living conditions. With a solar system, they would be able to light their house after sunset, replace the use of wood and candles as a light source and save around 200 Mexican pesos (around 13.00 USD) per month after paying the total of the solar system. Replacing the use of candles will represent a positive impact in their health conditions because they will stop inhaling smoke.

loans.use: to purchase a solar system to give his family access to electricity to be able to light their house after the sunset and stop using wood and candles as a light source.

loans.name: Hauwa

texts.en:
Hauwa is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Dan'asabe Village. She joined Babban Gona to create a better life for her children. In the past, Hauwa suffered from poor yields that crippled her ability to pay for her children's school fees. Now that she has joined Babban Gona, Hauwa has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize / hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000 /hectare.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, she will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase her yields and income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Hauwa can now ensure that her children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields.

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
Sabah is a 35-year-old widow who has a son and a daughter. After her husband's death, she started a small grocery store to generate income for her children and give them a proper education.

Sabah is applying for a 5000 EGP loan through Kiva's field partner TADE to buy a refrigerator for her store to hold fizzy drinks and ice cream and so increase her income for her family.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for her store

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina is fifty, single and a mother of three. For the past five years she has sold water sachets and bottled water in Bubiashie, a town within Accra’s metropolitan district. She has two employees who earn a daily wage by selling the water at local bus stations.

Faustina would like to develop her business and increase her income. She has applied for a 2,000 GHS loan through Kiva's field partner Ghana Women Fund for working capital and to buy more water to sell. She believes this will enable her to manage her household better.

loans.use: to buy water sachets and bottled water to sell

loans.name: Francisco Heriberto

texts.es:
Francisco de 25 años de edad, es un joven agricultor que vive con sus hermanos y sus padres, pero toma responsabilidades propias, dedicándose a la agricultura y a trabajos de electricista para apoyar a sus padres con los gastos de la casa.


Francisco tiene una experiencia muy buena ya que  lleva muchos  años junto a sus padres cosechado, sembrando granos básicos, además ellos comercializan el maíz y el frijol en los mercados locales para obtener ganancias que permitan salir adelante.


Con el crédito se le estará ayudando a Francisco  a comprar todos los pesticidas y herbicidas para proteger a la cosecha de las malezas que siempre amenazan, además de comprar abono para que el cultivo logre producirse con éxito.

El joven Francisco tiene muchos sueños y en  el futuro poner su propio taller de servicios de electricista, pero sabe que solo lo lograra luchando con los ingresos de la producción agrícola agrícola.
texts.en:
Francisco, 25 years old, is a young farmer who lives with his brothers and his parents, but takes responsibility for himself, earning a living in agriculture and working as an electrician to support his parents in paying household expenses.

Francisco has good experience since he has been working for many years along with his parents sowing crops and harvesting basic grains.  They also sell corn and beans in local markets to get profits allowing them to get ahead.

The loan will help Francisco to buy all the pesticides and herbicides to protect his harvest from the pests that always threaten, besides buying fertilizer so that growth can be successful.

Young Francisco has many dreams and in the future wants to have his own shop for electrician services, but he knows that he can only succeed in this by struggling for income from agricultural production.

loans.use: to buy all the pesticides and herbicides needed to protect his crop from pests that always threaten, as well as to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Badioula's Group

texts.fr:
Mise en place le 05 Janvier 2015, ce banc villageois est composé de femmes du groupement du village qui ont adhéré dans le programme comme les femmes des villageois environnants afin de rendre les activités dans le petit commerce plus rentables, elles s’activent également dans l’agriculture sous pluie. Une bonne ambiance anime les rencontres du groupe. 

Madame Badioula, âgée de 53ans ( assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée ), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants dont 03 garçons et 02 filles. Elle s’active dans la vente de patte d’arachide en détails.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 10 sceaux de patte d’arachide à 5000f pour le revendre en détails et renouveler son stock chaque 15 jours.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte prendre en charge les soins médicaux, l’habillement et la nourriture  de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This banc villageois, created on January 5, 2015, is composed of women from the same village who have joined the program, along with women from nearby villages, in order to make their vending businesses more profitable. In addition they are also engaged in rain-fed agriculture. The group meetings always have a congenial atmosphere.

Mrs. Badiola, 53 years old (the one seated on far right raising her hand) is the star borrower of the group. She is married and has five children: three sons and two daughters. She retails peanut paste.

With her new loan, Badiola will buy ten pails of peanut paste at 5,000 West African francs each to resell at retail prices, replenishing her stock every 15 days. Thanks to her revenues, she plans to cover the cost of healthcare, clothing and food for her children.

loans.use: to buy ten pails of peanut paste to retail.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is 30 years old. He is married with six children.

He has had a farming business for 13 years and it has been profitable.

He will be using the loan to purchase livestock and hopes this will help him pay school fees for his children with the anticipated profits.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to open another business and educate his children successfully.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Kanguka Sub Group B

texts.en: Immaculee is the group leader, aged 26 years. She is married with two children between two and six years old. The group is called Kanguka, which means “Wake up” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses to change to a better future. She sells charcoal and has been running a business for six years. With the loan, she would like to buy more charcoal to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to improve her welfare.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en:
Alphonse is 26 years old. He is married with one child.

He has had a motorcycle business for four years and it has been profitable.

He will be using the loan to complete payment for another motorcycle and hopes this will help him expand the business.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a happy family.

loans.use: to complete payment for another motorcycle.

loans.name: Vilma Maria

texts.es:
Vilma aprendió a hacer postres y pasteles desde que era adolescente, al principio lo tomó como hobby, pero con el tiempo se entusiasmó con la idea de hacer de su pasión hacia los postres un negocio que le generará un ingreso extra y con a la ayuda de su esposo emprendió una pequeña panadería en la que ofrecía sus delicias. Con el tiempo, ahorro para iniciar una pulpería en su casa y así duplicar las entradas de dinero de su hogar. 
 Por ello, solicita un crédito para comprar harina, huevos, levadura, azúcar, mantequilla, granos básicos, gaseosas, golosinas, frutas, carnes y demás productos que le permitan mantener sus negocios al máximo. Vilma recibe el apoyo de su esposo que desde hace algunos años le ayuda a atender la pulpería, mientras ella prepara los postres.
texts.en:
Vilma learned how to make desserts and cakes from the time she was an adolescent. At first, it was only a hobby, but in time she got excited about the idea of turning her passion towards desserts into a business that would generate an extra income. With the help of her husband she started a small bakery where she offered her delicacies. With time she saved up to start a grocery store in her home, and in this way she doubled the sources of income in her home.

She is requesting a loan to buy flour, eggs, yeast, sugar, butter, basic grains, sodas, candies, fruits, meat and other products that will allow her to keep her businesses at their fullest. Vilma receives support from her husband, and for a few years now he has helped her operate the grocery store while she makes desserts.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, yeast, sugar, butter, basic grains, sodas, candies, fruits, meat and other products.

loans.name: Kiteredde Vocational School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Fr. John. He is the Head Teacher of Kiteredde Vocational School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Kyotera with 120 students. Kiteredde School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Kiteredde School will repay its loan from its school fees, which are collected each term. Fr. John ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from waterborne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en:
Mavis is twenty eight years old. She is married and has two children who are between the ages of one to five years. Mavis' husband is a driver at Kasoa and with his support, she sells sachet water and some provisions in a rented shop at Kasoa.

Mavis would like to expand the sachet water business. She will use this loan to buy more sachet water and bottled water and resell to increase her income.

loans.use: To expand her sachet water business

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is twenty nine years old. She is single and has no children. Veronica is a plastic waste collector and has been doing this business for two years. She usually buys plastic waste from her neighbors and resells it to recycling companies to produce sachets, used in producing drinking water and plastic containers. 

With this loan, Veronica will be able to buy more plastic waste and resell it to recycling companies. She believes this will help her to support her family and keep her neighborhood tidy.

loans.use: To buy more plastic waste to resell

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Dan'asabe Village. Ibrahim joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Ibrahim will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him grow yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Ibrahim now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to ensure that all his chidden get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase a farmer’s yields

loans.name: Heidy

texts.en: Heidy's business, the Columbia English Institute of New Jersey, is a family-owned-and-operated facility that strives to serve the community by offering educational services. These include: English as a Second Language courses, computer classes, citizenship test study courses, and a GED program. All of the courses are developed and delivered by highly qualified professional staff with many years of experience and a background in education. In 2011, Heidy and three of her family members acquired the business from an acquaintance. Due to the challenges of running a business, the consequences of being hit by Hurricane Sandy, and the allure of other profitable job offers, two of the original owners left the business and by 2014, only Heidy and her mother remain to manage the institute. Now Heidy's mother Leyda has decided to move back to South America and leave her daughter in charge of the institute full time. Due to their excellent management skills, the business is at a self-sustainable point and the hours invested on the part of the owners has been greatly reduced as profits continue to grow. Heidy is requesting this loan so that she can buy out her mother's shares in the institute and become the sole owner of the booming educational institution they built together.

loans.use: to gain full ownership of her english language institute.

loans.name: Matta

texts.en: Matta is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Dantani Village. Matta joined Babban Gona to create a better life for her children. In the past, Matta suffered from poor yields that crippled her ability to feed her family and children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Matta will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help her earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see her increase her household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Matta now has the opportunity to increase her yields and income and use her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase her yields.

loans.name: Dauda

texts.en:
Dauda is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Dantani Village. Dauda joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Dauda will have access to the best farm inputs in the market, such as fertilisers, herbicides, and improved seeds, that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably.

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Dauda now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farm’s yields

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto lives in Hueyapan, Morelos, and works as a blacksmith, a trade that he learned from his grandfather. Roberto has been living for a long time in this land. It was given to him by his parents so he could build a house for his new family.

Roberto and his partner started building right away, but soon realized that they did not have the technical knowledge and that they did not plan correctly. Years passed and they have been able to add small things to the house. The house is not finished, and a lot of work needs to be done, but with a roof in place, they will be able to move in and continue doing the work but now have their own space.

Roberto has no access to credit from other institutions due to the informality of his job and his low income. This opportunity is unique to him because finally he will be able to live in a house of his own that has taken many years to become a home.

loans.use: to build a roof over his house so his family can move in

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Jorge runs his own hot dog truck business. He serves neighborhoods around Kearny, NJ, and he attracts a loyal customer base from those who want to grab a quick, affordable bite for lunch.

In addition to hot dogs, Jorge's truck sells drinks and other fast food items. Jorge offers a variety of combo options to satisfy all of his customers. His hot dog truck is known for its exceptional service and delicious foods.

Jorge is seeking investment in his business to refurbish his hot dog truck and better serve all of his customers.

loans.use: to refurbish his hot dog truck

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Miguel owns and operates Mr. Motor Sales, a unique car dealership. The business deals in buying, selling, and trading in cars.

Mr. Motor Sales offers highly competitive prices and customer satisfaction is 100% guaranteed. The dealership provides financing options, as well as salesmen who speak Spanish, both of which allow a for wider range of customers.

Mr. Motor Sales offers a complete list of the cars available for sale on their website, which provides customers the option to be prepared when they come in. This in turn increases turnover of customers and increases sales.

Miguel is seeking a loan to increase inventory to meet the increase in demand due to recent growth of his business. The loan will help Miguel capture this new market and expand his business.

loans.use: to increase inventory

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar operates a facility that teaches gymnastics to young children. Oscar himself has extensive experience in gymnastics. He was a member of the Colombian team at the World Championships in 1996 and 1997.

He started his business as a way to teach others and spread his passion for the sport. The Gym for Kids LLC provides a supportive environment for kids aged 18 months to 14 years to practice healthy habits and explore the world of gymnastics, along the way improving their flexibility, coordination, and confidence.

The facility has an wide range of equipment including bars, beams, rings, gymnastics floors, tumbling trampolines, and much more. The facility is also in complete compliance with all regulations of USA Gymnastics, as well as the the Township of Union and the Local Fire Department, ensuring the safety of all of its customers. In addition to gymnastics classes, The Gym for Kids also hosts birthday parties, tumbling and cheer leading, camps, and private lessons.

Oscar is seeking investment to produce the best services for his customers and market his services better. He wants to grow his business.

loans.use: to replace equipment

loans.name: Esteysi Roxana

texts.es:
Esteysi es una mujer muy humilde y trabajadora, actualmente vive con sus dos hijos de 15 y 17 años, su esposo no se encuentra con ella, ya que por motivos de insolvencia económica decidió buscar el sueño americano emigrando a los Estados Unidos en busca de mejores condiciones de vida para su familia.

Esteysi se dedica al comercio en pequeño, ya que vende pupusas en su casa de lunes a viernes, el sábado lo descansa y los domingos vende frutas y verduras en la iglesia del cantón aprovechando que todos los domingos se celebran misas en la iglesia del caserío. 

El dinero lo necesita para comprar maíz, aceite, frijoles, quesillo, chicharrón, etc para elaborar las pupusas.

Su sueño es tener una casa mucho más grande y bien amueblada para que sus hijos vivan cómodos  y tener siempre unida a su familia.
texts.en:
Esteysi is a humble and hardworking woman. Currently she lives with her two children of ages 15 and 17 years old. Her husband is not with her, since due to economic insolvency he decided to seek the American dream and emigrated to the United States in search of better living conditions for his family. 

Esteysi makes a living in small trade, selling pupusas in her home from Monday through Friday. Saturday she rests and Sunday she sells fruits and vegetables in church, taking advantage of all the Sundays masses celebrated in the church of the village.

The money is needed to purchase corn, oil, beans, cheese, pork, etc in order to make pupusas.

Her dreams are to have a bigger and better furnished home for her children to live comfortably and to always be close to her family.

loans.use: to buy corn, oil, beans, cheese, pork, etc. for making pupusas.

loans.name: Saidkhuja

texts.ru:
Саидхуча 25 лет. Он молодой человек с большой мечтой и чистой душой. Саидхуча занимается продажей учебников и школьных принадлежностей (ручки, карандаши, тетради, альбомы...) У него большая и дружная семья. Они живут в маленьком городке Исфара.
   На данный момент мама Саидхуча тяжело болеет. Он хочет отвести маму в столицу и показать профессору, чтобы то смог ей помочь. Саидхуча обещал себе, что он сделает все, чтобы его мама встала на ноги и была здоровой. Саидхуча хочет создать семью и привезти в дом невестку, но сначала он позаботится о маме. Он мечтает увидить свою маму здоровую на своей свадьбе. Саидхуча не имеет достаточно денег, чтобы отвезти маму в столицу и у него вся надежда остается на кредит. Поддержите Саидхучу и его маму.
texts.en:
Saidkhuja, age 25, is a young man with big dreams and a pure soul.  He makes a living selling textbooks and other school supplies (pens, pencils, notebooks, folders...) He comes from a large and friendly family and lives with them in the small city of Isfara.

At the moment, Saidkhuja's mom is seriously ill.  Saidkhuja would like to take her to Dushanbe and show her to a professor, so that she could get help.  He has promised himself to do everything for his mom and to see her back on her feet and healthy again. Although he wants to start a family and bring his fiancee home, he first wants to take care of his mother.  His dream is to see his mother healthy again on his wedding day.  Saidkhuja doesn't have enough money to take his mother to Dushanbe, so he is placing all his hopes in this loan.  Please support Saidkhuja and his mom.

loans.use: to take his mother to Dushanbe, so that she can get medical help.

loans.name: Rosa Daysi

texts.es:
Rosa de 45 años de edad, es madre soltera, ya que tiene que criar a su niña de 6 años de edad. Actualmente vive en una casa de alquiler junto con su madre, ya que no cuenta con los fondos suficientes para tener su casa propia.

Rosa se dedica al comercio de la ropa  desde hace 5 años, ella realiza ventas de productos como camisas, juguetes, y artículos de belleza en todo el departamento donde reside. 


El préstamo será utilizado para comprar ropa, zapatos y productos de belleza, ya que se acerca la época navideña y es necesario tener bien surtido todo y así poder mejorar sus ventas para diciembre.

Ella sueña con tener 2 locales en el mercado para extender sus ventas y así poder tener más ingresos y que no le falte nada a su hija y a su madre.
texts.en:
Rosa, 45, is a single mother raising a six-year-old daughter.  She currently lives in a rented house with her mother since she cannot afford to live on her own.

For five years Rosa has been selling clothing for a living.  She sells t-shirts, toys and beauty products in the department she lives in.

The loan will be used to buy clothing, shoes and beauty products since the Christmas season will be approaching and she must have a everything stocked and ready to sell in December.

She dreams of have two stalls in the market to increase sales and earn more income so her daughter and mother lack for nothing.

loans.use: To buy clothing, shoes and beauty products.

loans.name: Ulfridis

texts.es:
Ulfridis tiene 48 años de edad, está casado y es un hombre muy trabajador, él aprendió a trabajar en la albañilería, además trabaja en la agricultura y lo aprendió al lado de su padre, esta actividad le ha permitido ayudar a sus hijos y esposa.

Ulfridis desde pequeño se ha dedicado a la agricultura, cosechando granos básicos y hortalizas. Este año ha cultivado 1 hectárea de frijol, los beneficios que tiene es que su cultivo lo tiene cerca y esto hace que se le facilite el manejo de todos sus cultivos.


El crédito lo necesita para comprar insumos agrícolas, ya que se acerca la siembra de frijol y es necesario tener la semilla, el fertilizante y los fungicidas para darle un buen manejo. 

Ulfridis quiere en un futuro remodelar su casa para que su familia viva mejor.
texts.en:
Ulfridis, 48, is married and is a very hard worker.  He learned the trade of bricklaying and also works in agriculture which he learned from his father.  This has allowed him to help his children and wife.

Ulfridis has worked in agriculture since he was young, growing basic grains and vegetables.  This year he has planted a hectare of beans and the advantage he has is that his cropland is near so it is easier for him to care for the crops.

He is in need of a loan to buy farm supplies since the bean planting season is approaching.  He needs seeds, fertlizer and fungicides for proper handling.

Ulfridis wants to remodel his house in the future so his family is more comfortable.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies to plant beans: seeds, fertilizer and fungicides.

loans.name: Leonel Enrique

texts.es:
Leonel de 53 años de edad, se dedica al comercio de productos de primera necesidad, él se creció con sus padres quienes se dedicaban a la agricultura y comercio como principal fuente de ingresos, al paso del tiempo se  independizó y comenzó a implementar su tienda de la cual le genera las ganancias para satisfacer sus necesidades 


El señor   tiene una experiencia de 20 años en el comercio actividad que aprendió de sus padres quienes lo educaron y lo crecieron, y también le han inculcado buenos principios que lo han llevado a tener éxito en su vida y salir adelante.
