El dinero será utilizado para comprar mercadería como gaseosas, café, azúcar, arroz, etc para su tienda ya que lo ampliará y así obtendrá mayores ingresos.

 
Él sueña con tener una tienda muy surtida y así cubrir las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Leonel, 53, sells basic staple goods.  He was raised by parents who worked in agriculture and commerce.  Over time he was able to establish himself independently and set up a store which generates enough profit to cover his needs.

He has 20 years' experience in commerce which he learned from his parents .  They also instilled in him good values which have made him successful in life and allowed him to prosper.

The loan will be used to buy goods such as sodas, coffee, sugar, rice, etc. for the store that he plans to expand to earn more income.

His goal is to have a broad inventory of products to fill the needs of his customers.

loans.use: To buy goods such as sodas, coffee, sugar, rice, etc. for his store.

loans.name: Simón Pedro

texts.es:
Simón de 36 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar como chofer del trasporte de la iglesia desde su comunidad, también se dedica a la agricultura, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos que se encuentran estudiando educación básica en la escuela de su comunidad.

Simón se dedica a la prestación de servicios de chofer desde la edad de 19 años, actividad que aprendió de  su padre que le enseñó a conducir  ya que él trabajaba como chofer de una panadería, motivado decidió, continuar ejerciendo estas actividades ya que se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos, y de esta manera puede satisfacer las necesidades de su familia 



Él necesita este crédito para comprar ropa para damas, caballeros, adultos y niños ya que tiene un negocio de venta de ropa con su esposa.


Las metas que tiene a futuro son tener una vivienda propia, adquirir un nuevo préstamo para la compra de un terreno para los cultivos agrícolas, apoyar en la educación de sus hijos  ya que sueñan con estudiar ingeniería.
texts.en:
Simon, 36, works as a driver for his community's church.  He also works in agriculture and lives with his wife and their two children who attend the community grade school.

Simon has worked as a driver since he was 19, having learned the trade from his father who was a driver for a bakery.  He decided to continue this line of work which has become his main source of income to meet family needs.

He is in need of a loan to buy women's, men's and children's clothing for the clothing business he runs with his wife.

Simon's goal for the future is to have his own house, apply for a new loan to buy land for agriculture, and support his children regarding their education since they want to study engineering.

loans.use: To buy women's, men's and children's clothing for his business.

loans.name: Alexi Maricela

texts.es:
Alexi es una mujeres de 32 años de edad, actualmente está acompañada y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad que estudian en la escuela y su pareja se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos.

Alexi se dedica a la crianza de especies menores como cerdos y aves de corral, ya tiene  12 años de experiencia en esta actividad, conocimiento que adquirió de su padre,  lo cual le permite salir adelante con sus dos hijos.


Ella está solicitando este crédito para comprar 2 vacas lecheras.

Ella sueña con seguir trabajando en la crianza de aves de corral, cerdos y también con ganado lechero para obtener mejores ingresos y así mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Alexi is a 32 year old woman who has a partner and two young children who go to school. Her partner works sowing staple grains.

Alexi works raising small animals such as pigs and poultry. She has had 12 years of experience in this line of work which she learnt from her father and it has enabled her to move forward and bring up her two children.

Alexi is applying for a loan to buy two dairy cows.

Her dream is to keep working by raising poultry, pigs and also dairy cows to obtain a higher income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows

loans.name: Evelin

texts.es:
Evelin tiene 43 años d edad, estudi{o hasta tercer grado, actualmente está acompañada y su compañero de vida se dedica a la agricultura, Evelin vive tambien con una hija de 22 años que ayuda en la casa con labores domésticas y el cuidado de animales como cerdos y ganado. 


Evelin se dedica a la crianza de ganado y cerdos, ordeña 3 vacas al día y obtiene un promedio de 40 botellas de leche las cuales vende a otras personas, ambas actividades las aprendió de sus padres, Evelin se encarga de comprar cerdos pequeños, luego los desarrolla a base de concentrados así como también compra alimentos para su ganado para obtener buena cantidad de leche.-


Con el presente préstamo Evelin  pretende comprar una novilla, también alimentos  para sus cerdos y ganado, esto le servirá para obtener mas leche y poder  venderla para mejorar sus ingresos en su familia.

Evelin sueña con dar a su familia todo lo necesario para vivir bien y que en su casa no falte nada para su bienestar.- El presente préstamo le ayudara a aumentar sus ingresos porque hará una buena inversión en su negocio.
texts.en:
Evelin is 43 years old and has a third-grade education. She currently has a partner, a farmer. Evelin also lives with her 22-year-old daughter who helps with household chores and looking and after the pigs and cattle.

Evelin makes a living raising cattle and pigs. She milks three cows every day, obtaining an average 40 bottles of milk that she sells the milk to other people. Evelin learned both of these trades from her parents. Evelin buys young pigs, then raises them with feeds. She also buys feed for her cattle so that they produce a lot of milk.

Evelin plans to use this loan to buy a heifer, and feed for pigs and cattle. This will allow her to obtain more milk, and to be able to sell it to increase her family's income.

Evelin dreams of giving her family everything that they need to live well, and so that the family needs for nothing for its well-being. This loan will help Evelin to increase her income as she will make a good investment in her business.

loans.use: to buy a heifer, and feed for pigs and cattle.

loans.name: Nubia Yamileth

texts.es:
Nubia de 21 años de edad,  se dedica a administrar su tienda de productos básicos, es una persona muy responsable y con excelentes principios morales que la han llevado a tener mucho éxito en su negocio, la joven creció solo con su madre y realizó sus estudios hasta 9 grado, ahora está soltera y tiene dos hijos.

La joven  tiene una experiencia de 2 años en administrar su propia tienda con ayuda de sus madre, gracias a la realización de esta actividad ha podido cumplir con todas las necesidades de su hogar.


Ella solicita este crédito para comprar productos como arroz, maíz, café, azúcar, condimentos, gaseosas, etc para surtir su tienda ya que tiene nuevos clientes y  le demandan nueva mercadería, sus clientes aumenta y necesita el dinero para surtir y ampliar su negocio, de esta manera podrá tener, mejores ingresos los cuales serán invertidos en mejoramiento  de su casa. 


Las metas que ella tiene para un futuro son las de haber cancelado el crédito y adquirir otro financiamiento  para el mejoramiento de las instalaciones de su tienda y ampliar su casa ya que planea construir dos cuartos adicionales.
texts.en:
Nubia, 21, runs a store and sells basic products.  She is a very responsible person with excellent moral values that have made her successful in business.  She was raised by her mother and has a ninth grade education.  Now she is single and has two children.

She has two years' experience in running a store with the help of her mother.  Thanks to this activity she has been able to cover household needs.

Nubia is requesting a loan to buy products like rice, corn, coffee, sugar, condiments, sodas, etc. to stock her store for the new customers who are asking for different merchandise.  With the increase in customers she needs money to stock the store and expand the business.  This will give her more income so she can improve her house.

The goals she has for the future include paying back the loan and applying for another to renovate her store and expand her house where she plans to build two new rooms.

loans.use: To buy goods such as rice, corn, coffee, sugar, condiments, sodas, etc. for her store.

loans.name: Carolina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Carolina de 25 años de edad, estudió hasta 6º grado, es madre soltera de una hija, vive junto a sus padres pues aún no tiene casa propia.


Carolina se dedica a la elaboración de hamacas, actividad que también le ha enseñado a su hija, elaboran las hamacas según los pedidos que les hagan los clientes. 

Ella solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como hilos de diferentes clases y otros manguillos para elaborar mas hamacas.
 
El sueño de Carolina es que su hija tenga lo que necesita y que siempre se apoyen para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Carolina is 25 years old and has a sixth-grade education. She is a single mother to one daughter. Carolina lives with her parents as she does not own her own house.

Carolina makes a living producing hammocks, work that she has taught to her daughter. Together, mother and daughter make hammocks to fill orders from customers.

Carolina is applying for a loan in order to buy materials such as different types of threads, and more muffs to make hammocks.

Carolina's dream is for her daughter to have what she needs, and for mother and daughter always to support each other so that they can move forward.

loans.use: to buy materials such as different types of threads, and more muffs to make hammocks.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
María tiene 61 años de edad, estudió solo primer grado, las condicones de sus padres no eran tan buenas ya que tenían mas hijos y solo los pusieron a trabajar, está acompañada y su esposo tiene un negocio de taller de vehículos, tiene tres hijos quienes están en Estados Unidos.


María junto con su pareja tienen un taller de revisión de vehículos desde hace años, ellos se decidieron a trabajar para sacar adelante a sus hijos, tienen a dos personas ayudándoles ya que hay días que tienen bastante trabajo.

María utilizará este préstamo para comprar herramientas  para su taller, ya que son necesarias para poder revisar los vehículos que llegan con problemas, y así brindar mejores servicios a sus clientes.

Ella tiene un sueño muy grande, volver a ver a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is 61 years old. She studied only up to first grade because her parents were not from a very good class and they had more children who they only put to work. She has a husband who runs an auto-repair workshop and she has three children who live in the United States. 

Together with her partner María has run a workshop servicing vehicles for several years. They decided to work to bring up their children. They have two people who work for them since there are days when they have a lot of work to do. 

María will use this loan to buy tools for her workshop which she needs to service the vehicles that arrive with problems. This way she can offer a better service to her customers.

María's biggest dream is to see her children again.

loans.use: to buy tools for her workshop

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is been married for over 15 years, and is the mother of a little boy. She is the owner of the adobe house where she lives with her family. Veronica makes and sells cheese and her husband works as a teacher, but he helps her with the cheese when he has time. Veronica needs a loan to buy a milking cow. She would like to increase her cheese production, and she hopes you can help her. She appears in the picture with the items she uses to make the cheese.

loans.use: to buy a milking cow

loans.name: Mohira

texts.ru: Мохира жительница маленького района Рудаки. Ей 25 лет. Она замечательная жена и мать одного ребёнка. Мохира занимается шитьем около 5 лет. Это идеальная работа для неё. Всё дело в том, что чаще всего она по определённым обстоятельствам вынуждена сидеть дома. Владея такой профессией как швея, Мохира всегда сможет получать дополнительный заработок, выполняя заказы клиентов. Она очень любит свое дело и с удовольствием шьет платья своих клиенток. Из -за большого количества заказов, она вынуждена купить необходимые вещи для шитья, такие как: нитки, иголки, новые ткани и оборудование для швейной машинки. Однако у неё нет достаточных денег. После приобретения всех этих вещей, она сможет принимать больше заказов и получить неплохой доход и помогая мужу пополнить их семейный бюджет.
texts.en:
Mohira lives in the small region of Rudaki. She is 25 years old. She is a wonderful wife and mother of one child. 

Mohira has been sewing for about five years. This is an ideal job for her, because most of the time she has to stay at home because of certain circumstances. Being masterful at her profession as a tailor, Mohira will always be able to accept additional jobs, fulfilling her clients' orders. She loves her job very much and gladly sews her clients' dresses. 

As a result of the huge number of orders she receives, she needs to buy more sewing supplies, such as thread, needles, new cloths, and equipment for her sewing machine. However, she does not have enough money. After obtaining all these things, she will be able to accept more orders and receive a good income, helping her husband supplement their family budget.

loans.use: to buy necessary sewing supplies.

loans.name: Maía Eliana

texts.es:
María tiene 32 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato secretariado, está casada y su esposo reside en Estados Unidos, tienen dos hijos ya adolescentes y estudian en el colegio.



María junto a su suegra se dedica a vender tamales de pollo, su suegra le apoya debido a que elaboran quinientos tamales que les encargan, María se levanta con su suegra a las 3:00 AM para salir al puesto donde venden.

 
Este préstamo lo solicita para comprar maíz, pollo, aceite, sal para elaborar mas tamales y salir a vender.

El sueño de María es ver a sus hijos que sean profesionales y reencontrarse con su esposo.
texts.en:
María is 32 years old and has studied up to a secretarial degree. She is married and her husband lives in the United States. They have two children who are now teenagers and go to high school. 

María sells chicken tamales together with her mother-in-law who helps her since she caters to orders of 500 tamales. María and her mother-in-law get up at 3:00am to travel to the stall where they sell the tamales.
 
María is applying for a loan to buy corn, chicken, oil, and salt to make more tamales and go out and sell them.

María's dream is to see her children become professionals and reunite with her husband.

loans.use: to buy corn, chicken, oil, and salt to make more tamales and go out and sell them.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.en:
Maria Isabel lives in Hueyapan, Morelos with her family. She works as a hairdresser in a friend's salon. She and her husband have worked hard to have the house they live in. For the last 11 years Maria Isabel and her family have seen their house grow little by little with a lot of effort. They now want to finish what they consider essential, which is to cover the floor, which today is dirt, with proper tiles. This will help them keep the house clean, and avoid some respiratory illnesses they are subject to. This will also help them have a house they feel proud of. 

Maria Isabel and her husband cannot access credit through other institutions. They have a low income and informal jobs. With this opportunity they will be able to finish the most important work on the house. They will receive technical supervision to make sure the work complies with quality and safety standards.

loans.use: to cover her dirt floor with a proper tile floor and provide better living conditions for her family

loans.name: Celia

texts.en: Celia is the mother of four children. She sells diapers, cookies, and other products at El Alto. Celia is married and her husband is an electrician. Through great effort, Celia and her husband were able to purchase a house, and they need a loan to be able to make repairs. Celia hopes you can help her because she is supported by her husband and she works hard. In the picture you can see Celia's house.

loans.use: to make repairs to her house

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: Nadia works at a bakery and she is studying to be a nurse. She is good at using her hands. She lives with her parents, but legally she is the owner of the house. Her parents help her with food, but she needs a loan to make payments to the university. She hopes you can help her. Nadia is a responsible single woman, and she is dedicated to her job and her studies. Nadia is at her house in the picture.

loans.use: to make payments to the university

loans.name: María Marta

texts.es:
María estudio hasta 6º grado, está acompañada su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, tiene dos hijos ya mayores de edad que no viven en casa.


María desde hace muchos años se dedica a vender tortillas, de esa manera ha criado a sus hijos, ella aprendió el negocio por su madre, esta actividad la sigue realizando pues es su mayor fuente de ingresos.


Ella necesita el crédito para comprar maíz, y leña para continuar elaborando tortillas.

El sueño de María es siempre mantener su negocio y un día volver a ver sus hijos.
texts.en:
María studied up to sixth grade. She lives with her partner who works as a farmer. They have two children who are now adults and don't live at home. 

Many years ago María began selling tortillas and with this she was able to raise her children. She learnt this trade from her mother and she continues to work in this business because it is her main source of income. 

María needs this loan to buy corn and wood to keep making tortillas. Her dreams are to always keep working and to one day see her children again.

loans.use: to buy corn and wood to keep making tortillas.

loans.name: Bashiru

texts.en: Bashiru is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Bakutaje Village. Bashiru joined Babban Gona to improve the lives of his family and children. Since joining Babban Gona, he no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to pay his children's school fees. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Bashiru   will have access to high quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average of 14 bags/hectare. This year, Bashiru has set high goals of harvesting 30 bags of maize. With increased yields and income, Bashiru has made it his ultimate goal to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his farm yields

loans.name: Michell

texts.en:
Michell is a dealer of an Aim Global products like coffee, chocolate drink, toothpaste, soap, and food supplements.  She is a 29-year-old married woman with two dependents, aged 9 and 6. She also engages in selling prepaid cellphone load to her neighbors. Her husband earns a living as a security guard.

Michell is asking for a loan to purchase Aim Global products, and ingredients for food vending. With the availability of these resources, she will be able to sell a variety of Aim Global products, and to prepare food to sell as well. Thus, Michell's income will improve and she will be able to meet her obligations. She will also provide a nutritious diet to the whole family.

In the future, she dreams of expanding her business, to support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to purchase Aim Global products, and ingredients for food vending

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is a 31-year-old married woman with four children. Her oldest child is 9 and her youngest is 2 months old. For almost three years now, Linda has engaged in a hog raising business. She raises and sells hogs.This is the source of her income. Her husband also helps defray the family's expenses by being a carpenter.

Linda has requested a loan to buy a pig and pig feed. This will help her raise healthy hogs which will be sold in few months to come. Thus, she can also roll out her capital and be able to invest in any possible business opportunities. With these, she could be able to feed her children with nutritious meals. 

In the future, Linda would like to improve her livelihood to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a pig and pig feed

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials like fishing net for her fishing business.

Sonia has been in this business for 10 years. She earns additional income from food vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Sonia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing net for her business

loans.name: Lennie

texts.en:
Lennie operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various merchandise such as sugar, biscuits, condiments, bread, chips, shampoo, cooking oil, and soap. She is a 47-year-old married woman with a nine-year-old child. Her husband also has a small income which will helps her to meet their daily needs. She has been operating a sari-sari (variety) store for two years now.

She is asking for a loan to buy assorted stock for the store, such as beverages, toiletries, and two sacks of fertilizers. These would help maintain the content of her store and help cater to the needs of her customers. Thus, she would be able to meet her obligations and manage her finances as well.

She is determined to expand her store to continue to finance the schooling of her child, for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy assorted stock for her store, such as beverages, toiletries, and two sacks of fertilizers

loans.name: Irma Esperanza

texts.es:
Irma de 40 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado en la escuela, está casada y su esposo se dedica a los trabajos de la agricultura, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales solo dos viven en su casa y se encuentran estudiando en la escuela

Irma se dedica a los oficios domésticos, su madre le enseñó este oficio y gracias a ello ahora  puede sobrevivir con este trabajo, ella se levanta desde temprano para preparar los alimentos a su esposo y mandar a sus hijos a la escuela.

Este crédito lo necesita para comprar insecticidas, abono, venenos y pagar mano de obra para la siembra de maíz y frijol.
Sus planes son apoyar a sus hijos para que sean personas preparadas y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Irma is 40 years old, studied until ninth grade in school and is married. Her husband works in agriculture. They have 3 children, two of whom live at home with them and are studying in school.

Irma works doing domestic tasks. Her mother taught her to do this and thanks to this she has been able to survive with this work. She gets up early to prepare food for her husband and get the children ready for school.

She needs this loan to buy insecticide, manure, poisons and to pay the labour costs for sowing corn and beans.

Her plans are to support her children so that they are prepared for life and have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy insecticide, manure, poisons and to pay the labour costs for sowing corn and beans.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 36 years old and married. She has two children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Analyn has been farming rice for five years and also earns additional income from buying and selling crabs and shrimps.

Analyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Atsarina

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Atsarina works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from food vending.

Atsarina is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her fishing business.

Atsarina has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net.

loans.name: Casselena

texts.en:
Casselana owns Cassalena Rey Cosmetics, a beauty product company that offers a line of specialized products for men and women.

Casselana has always been interested in beauty products and decided to turn her passion into her career when she opened her business. Some of the products offered include bronzing cream, shimmer lotions and powders, skin care products, lip gloss, and eyebrow kits.

In addition to selling product, Cassalena also offers unique services such as private beauty consultations for photo shoots, film, television, weddings, and other special events. Cassalena Rey Cosmetics is known for its quality product.

Casselana is seeking investment to better market her products and expand her product and customer base. She hopes to grow her business and make it more profitable for the long run.

loans.use: to better market her products and expand her product and customer base.

loans.name: Nimfa

texts.en:
Nimfa is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with seven children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She supplements this income with earnings from her general store.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers.

Nimfa dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a citrus-farming business in the Philippines. Marissa has been in this business for six years. She earns additional income from a general store and raising pigs.

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies for her citris-farming business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Marissa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Leonora works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice bran business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from pig fattening.

Leonora is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy sacks of rice bran to sell for her buy and sell rice bran business.

Leonora has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice bran to sell for her business.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She supplements this income with earnings from her buy and sell rice grains business.

Saturnina is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to pay for laborers' salaries for farm preparation.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Saturnina dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to pay laborers' salaries for farm preparation.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Leticia works hard to support her family. Leticia is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Leticia has been in this business for 30 years now.

Leticia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing materials for the maintenance of her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Leticia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for the maintenance of her business.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Luisa to improve her business. She has a second-hand clothing store where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies such as trousers, shorts, long sleeve and short sleeve shirts.

She has been involving herself in business activities since 2011. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Luisa independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shorts, long sleeve and short sleeve shirts.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 46 years old, married, and has five children, two of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal business for three years and also earns an income from a general store and raising pigs.

Joy requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business.

Joy has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan.

She aspires to save money to expand her business and save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell for her business.

loans.name: Kenia Briseida

texts.es:
Kenia es una joven de 21 años de edad, estudió hasta noveno grado debido a la situación económica de su familia, está casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, tienen una hija de tres años de edad y es la única que depende de ella.


Kenia se dedica a los oficios domésticos gracias a que su madre le enseñó esta actividad, su jornada empieza bien temprano, se levanta a preparar desayuno para su esposo antes de que se retire a realizar sus actividades diarias.


Ella solicita este crédito para comprar bebidas, granos básicos, churros, entre otros productos para iniciar una tienda en su casa.


Sus planes a futuro son tener una granja grande de pollos para poder venderle a otras tiendas grandes y así tener mejores ingresos económicos, además planea ayudarle a su hija con los estudios.
texts.en:
Kenia is a 21-year-old young woman. She went to school up to the ninth grade due to her family's economic situation. She is married and her husband works in agriculture. They have a 3-year-old daughter and she is the only one who depends on her.

Kenia takes care of the domestic chores, thanks to her mother who taught her this work. Her day begins very early; she gets up to prepare breakfast for her husband before he leaves to do his daily work. 

She asks for this loan to purchase drinks, basic grains, churros, and other products to open a store in her house.

Her plans for the future are to have a large chicken farm to be able to sell them to other large stores and, in this way, have more income. In addition, she plans to help her daughter with her education.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, basic grains, churros and other products to open a store in her house.

loans.name: Peter Tomas

texts.es: Peter de 22 años creció en medio del negocio familiar de producción y venta de Bollos de maíz, este negocio nació hace más de veinte años y sus padres lograron educarlo y velar por su bienestar, gracias a los frutos recogidos en esta actividad.  Hace tres años Peter tomó la administración del negocio en compañía de sus padres, así mismo se encuentra cursando quinto semestre de matemáticas y con el negocio financia sus estudios y atiende necesidades del hogar. Con apenas 22 años, Peter es un joven que se proyecta con un excelente futuro y es un ejemplo a seguir para muchas personas, hoy en día está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar una motocicleta y poder distribuir a las tiendas del sector los Bollos de maíz.  Con esta inversión responderá a la demanda de aproximadamente 40 tiendas y sus utilidades beneficiaran a su familia.  Su meta de negocio a futuro es realizar adecuaciones locativas y mejorar la infraestructura de producción. Su meta personal es graduarse y hacer una maestría.
texts.en: Peter, 22 years old, grew up amidst the family business of making and selling corn rolls. This business was born more than twenty years ago and his parents managed to raise him and care for his well-being, thanks to the fruits of this labor. Three years ago, Peter took over the management of the business with his parents, and also he is in his fifth semester in a mathematics program and, with the business, he finances his education and takes care of the household needs. At just 22 years old, Peter is a young man who expects an excellent future and is an example for many people to follow. Today he is applying for his first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to purchase a motorcycle and be able to distribute the corn rolls to stores in the sector. With this investment, he will respond to the demand of approximately 40 stores and the profit will benefit his family. His business goal for the future is to make updates to the space and improve the production infrastructure. His personal goal is to graduate and get a master's degree.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Banner Alcides

texts.es:
Banner de 34 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato,  está acompañado y tiene dos hijos, uno está estudiando en la escuela y el otro aún no porque está muy pequeño, por lo tanto solo su esposa e hijos dependen de Banner.

Banner se dedica a la agricultura, él siembra hortalizas y granos básicos, toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura gracias a su padre que le enseñó este trabajo, además es motorista de un camión, él transporta materiales de construcción y también traslada los frutos de las hortalizas.

Él solicita este préstamo para realizar una mayor siembra de hortalizas y comprar todos los insumos para darles buen mantenimiento.

Él sueña con que sus hijos sean personas de bien y adquirir otro camión para ofrece mejores servicios de transporte de carga.
texts.en:
Banner, 34 years old, went to school up through secondary school. He is partnered and has two children, one is a student and the other isn't yet because he is very young, and only his wife and children depend on Banner.  

Banner works in agriculture. He plants vegetables and basic grains. He has worked in agriculture his whole life, thanks to his father who taught him this work. In addition, he is a truck driver and he hauls construction materials and also transports his vegetables.

He asks for this loan to have a better planting of vegetables and to purchase the supplies to maintain them well. 

He dreams of his children becoming good people and of getting another truck to offer better hauling services.

loans.use: to have a better planting of vegetables and to purchase the supplies to maintain them well.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: Jorge de 31 años, recorre los diferentes barrios del municipio de Barranquilla, ofreciendo aguacates y pescado fresco; su familia se ha dedicado durante años a la comercialización de estos alimentos por eso decidió seguir con este legado y adaptarlo como su negocio. Adicional a su actividad comercial, aprovecha las habilidades que tiene en el campo de la construcción y brinda sus servicios en este ámbito cuando se le presenta algún contrato.  Jorge es un emprendedor que con su entrega y dinamismo, ha logrado conseguir su sustento, él diariamente labora a partir de las 7 a.m. hasta las 12 p.m. y una de sus metas es ampliar la variedad de productos que ofrece. Actualmente está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar pescado y aguacates.  Con esta inversión incrementará sus ventas y con ello sus utilidades.  Jorge desea construir su casa con el fruto de su trabajo.
texts.en: Jorge, 31 years old, goes around the different neighborhoods in the municipality of Barranquilla, selling avocados and fresh fish. His family has worked selling these foods for years, so he decided to continue with this legacy and take it on as his business. In addition to his commercial work, he takes advantage of the skills he has in the field of construction and works in this area when a contract comes up. Jorge is an entrepreneur who, with his dedication and dynamism, has managed to support himself. He works daily from 7:00 am to 12:00 pm and one of his goals is to expand the variety of products that he sells. Currently he is applying for his first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to purchase fish and avocados. With this investment, he will increase his sales and, with this, his profit. Jorge wants to build a house with the fruit of his labor.

loans.use: to purchase fish and avocados.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David es un señor de 56 años de edad, solo estudió hasta cuarto grado, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios del hogar,	 tiene cuatro hijos, de ellos solo uno vive en casa pues los otros tres ya formaron su propia familia.


David se dedica a vender dulces de atado (panela), se ha dedicado ha este oficio toda su vida, aprendió esto de su padre pues él realizaba la misma actividad, David trabaja de 5:00 AM a 6:00 PM.

Este crédito lo necesita para comprar seis quintales de abono y pagará mano de obra que le ayudará con la milpa.

Él sueña con tener un lugar mas adecuado para la elaboración de dulce de panela, y de esta forma mejorar sus ingresos para el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
David is a 56 year old man, he only went to school up to the fourth grade, is married, and his wife takes care of the household tasks. He has four children, of whom only one lives in the house since the other three already have their own families.

David works selling atado (raw sugar cane) candies, he has worked in this job his whole life. He learned it from his father since he did the same work. David works from 5:00 am to 6:00 pm.

He needs this loan to purchase six quintals of manure and to pay labor costs which will help him in his cornfield.

He dreams of having a better location to make his sugar cane candies, and in this way to improve his income to sustain his family.

loans.use: to purchase six quintals of manure and to pay labor costs which will help him in his cornfield.

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es:
Isidro de 47 años de edad, en un señor muy trabajador dedicado a sus cultivos agrícolas y también a la  ganadería, de su matrimonio anterior tiene 4 hijos que ya son mayores, y con su compañera de vida actual no tiene hijos, viven solos y la pareja de Isidro se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Isidro se dedica a la agricultura y también a la ganadería, tiene muchos años de dedicarse a esta actividad la cual es la única que realiza, su padre le enseñó este oficio y hoy en día es su principal actividad, él se levanta a las 5 de la mañana para poder desplazarse al lugar e sus cultivos.

Él necesita mucho de este crédito para comprar 5 rollos de manguera para regar sus cultivos de maíz para que no se le sequen por la falta de lluvia y pagará mano de obra.

Su sueño es seguir teniendo la fuerza necesaria para seguir cultivando la tierra.
texts.en:
Isidro is 47 years old. He is a very hardworking man who works with his crops and livestock. From his previous marriage he has 4 grown children. He has no children with his current spouse. They live alone and Isidro's spouse takes care of the home. 

Isidro works in agriculture and with livestock. He has been doing this activity for many years and it is the only one he does. His father taught it to him and now it is his main activity. He gets up at 5 in the morning to be abel to get to his crops.

He really needs this loan to buy 5 rolls of hose to irrigate his corn crops so that they won't dry out due to a lack of rain and pay for labor. 

His dream is to keep having the strength necessary to keep cultivating the land.

loans.use: to buy 5 rolls of hose to irrigate his corn crops so they don't dry out from a lack of rain, as well as pay for labor.

loans.name: Ana Aracely

texts.es:
Ana de 39 años de edad,  estudió hasta tercer grado, sus padres de dedicaban a la agricultura y no contaban con el dinero suficiente para que ella pudiera  seguir estudiando, ella está casada y es madre de 3 hijos que actualmente se encuentran estudiando en la escuela, su esposo de dedica a sembrar hortalizas en invernaderos.

Ana se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, lo hace desde pequeña ya que sus padres realizaban dichos trabajos, ella y su esposo cultivan estos alimentos y luego los venden en el mercado, sus hijos siempre apoyan a Ana en sus tiempos libres de todo que así ellos van aprendiendo también a ganarse el alimento de cada día.

Ella necesita este crédito  para llevar a cabo la siembra de hortalizas para luego salir a vender las cosechas.

Ella sueña con tener un puesto de ventas y así no tener que salir a lugares lejanos a vender, además espera darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is 39 years old and studied until the third grade. Her parents made a living in agriculture and did not have enough money so that she could continue studying. She is married and is the mother of three children who are currently studying in school. Her husband makes a living planting vegetables in greenhouses.

Ana makes a living selling fruits and vegetables. She has done this since she was young since her parents did the work. She and her husband grow these foods and then sell them in the market. Their children always support Ana and in their free time so that they will also learn to make the food every day.

She needs this loan to carry out planting the vegetables to then go out and sell the crops.

Her dream is to have a sales job and so not have to go to places far away to sell, and further she hopes to give the best to her family.

loans.use: to carry out planting vegetables to then go out and sell the crops.

loans.name: Juan Pedro

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre de 36 años de edad, es unido con su esposa con la que vive muy feliz mente con sus hijos en una comunidad de Sololá.
Juan es agricultor desde hace varios años, él ha trabajado y vivido de esta labor porque es una forma digna de ganarse la vida, Juan cuenta que con las pocas ganancias a logrado cultivar, pero desde que tomo la iniciativa de realizar un préstamo su vida cambio, pues el cultiva ahora una variedad de verduras en distintos lugares de su comunidad, y esto ha sido de gran beneficio para él. Juan para seguir prosperando por el bien de sus pequeños y algún día ellos cuenten con una vida mucho mejor de la que el no puedo disfrutar, solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar en esta ocasión semillas de cebolla y abono químico para  cultivar en esta temporada.
Juan para seguir mejorando la calidad de vida espera seguir recibiendo su apoyo para construir su casa de block, pues donde actualmente vive es solo de tablas.
texts.en:
Juan is a 36-year-old man, is close to his wife with whom he lives happily and with his children in a community of Sololá.

Juan has been a farmer for a number of years. He has worked and lived this labor because it is a dignified way of earning a living. Juan says that with his little earnings, he has managed plant, but since he took the initiative to get a loan, his life has changed since his now cultivates a variety of vegetables in different places in the community, and this has been a great benefit to him. To continue prospering for the good of his little ones and so that one day they have a much better life than the one he wasn't able to enjoy, he asks for another loan, this time to purchase onion seeds and chemical fertilizer to grow in this season. 

Juan, to continue improving his quality of life, hopes to continue getting your support to build a house of concrete blocks, since the one where he currently lives is only made of lumber.

loans.use: to purchase onion seeds and chemical fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase supplies to make her meals, such as vegetables, seasonings, breads, and others.

loans.name: Carmen Elena

texts.es:
Carmen, estudio hasta noveno grado, està acompañada, su pareja es agricultor y tienen una niña de 4 años de edad.

Carmen, trabaja vendiendo productos por catalogo desde hace 7 meses, decidio trabajar de esa manera, porque se le hace màs facil, para poder cuidar de su hogar.
 
Ella necesita el prèstamo para comprar insumos agricolas para que su esposo siembre maìz y tambien para comprar los productos por catalogo.

Sus sueños son seguir trabajando y tener un hogar digno para su hija y su familia.
texts.en:
Carmen went to school up to the ninth grade, is partnered and her partner is a farmer and they have a 4-year-old girl. 

Carmen has worked selling catalog products for the past 7 months, she decided to work in this way because it is easier to be able to care for her home. 

She needs the loan to purchase agricultural supplies for her partner to plant corn and also to purchase catalog products. 

Her dreams are to continue working and to have a dignified home with her daughter and her family.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies for her partner to plant corn and also to purchase catalog products.

loans.name: Alexander Rafael

texts.es: Alexander de 37 años,  ofrece servicio de mantenimiento y reparación de motocicletas, esta idea de negocio surgió a raíz del incremento de este tipo de vehículos en el sector donde reside al sur occidente de Barranquilla, todos los días a partir de las 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. se encuentra disponible para atender cualquier eventualidad que se le presenten a los mototaxistas del sector; llantas pinchadas, cambios de aceite y repuestos en general.  Alexander cuenta con dos años ejerciendo esta labor con mucho compromiso y dedicación, su éxito ha estado ligado a un servicio oportuno y de calidad.  Actualmente está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en lubricantes, llantas, neumáticos y demás repuestos.  Con esta inversión pretende tener un stock de repuestos para continuar atendiendo oportunamente los servicios. Su meta a futuro es adquirir una casa propia y se un distribuidor autorizado de repuestos.
texts.en: Alexander, 37 years, works doing maintenance on and repairing motorcycles. This idea for a business came from the increase of this type of vehicles in the sector where he lives in the southwest of Barranquilla. Every day from 8 am to 6 pm is is available to serve whatever situation presents itself to the motorcycle drivers in the sector -- flat tires, oil changes and general parts. Alexander has been doing this work for two years with a lot of commitment and dedication. His success has been tied to an opportune service of quality. Currently he is applying for his first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which he will invest in lubricants, wheel rims, tires, and other parts. With this investment, he plans to have a stock of spare parts to continue opportunely offering his services. His goal for the future is to get his own house and be an authorized part distributor.

loans.use: to purchase lubricants, wheel rims, tires, and other parts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in a batch of veneers, etc., to improve the variety of products of her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase school bags, hand bags, packages of perfumes, etc. to improve the variety of products in her business.

loans.name: Natividad De Jesus

texts.es:
Natividad, de 33 años de edad, es un agricultor, es padre de 2 hijos y junto a su esposa lucha día a día para salir adelante.

Natividad, tiene una larga trayectoria en la actividad agrícola, ya que siempre realiza milpas, con el objetivo de comercializar granos básicos y también para dar alimentación a su familia.

Natividad, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas como abono, pesticidas y herbicidas para preparar la tierra donde sembrara, para obtener una cosecha exitosa para comercializar los granos básicos. 

Natividad, sueña con comprar un terreno para poder sembrar y dejarles un buen legado a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Natividad is 33 years old and is a farmer. He is the father of 2 children and together with his wife he struggles day after day to succeed.

Natividad has a long history in agriculture, as he has always done the corn fields, with the objective of commercializing basic grains and also to give food to his family. 

Natividad needs a loan to buy agricultural inputs such as fertilizers, pesticides and herbicides to prepare the ground where he will plant, and so obtain a successful harvest to sell the basic grains at the market.

Natividad's dream is is to buy land for planting and leave a good legacy to his children.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs such as fertilizer, pesticides and herbicides to prepare the ground where he will plant.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, spices, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures, like farming rice and raising pigs.

Teresita dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, canned goods, spices, etc.

loans.name: José Balmore

texts.es:
José de 35 años de edad, estudió hasta séptimo grado en la escuela, está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad el cual lo cuida su esposa mientras él trabaja, en su casa viven tres personas su esposa su hijo y él.

José se dedica a los trabajos de motorista, llevando materiales de todo tipo de un lugar a otro, comenzó a trabajar con un pick up y aprendió por un tío suyo, José sale a trabajar de seis de la mañana hasta las seis de la tarde,  tiene una ruta muy grande y pesada pero eso no es obstáculo para él porque sabe que tiene que darle lo necesario a su hija y a su esposa.

Él solicita este crédito para ajustar y comprarse un camión para independizarse y poder ofrecer servicios de carga a otros.

José planea para un futuro poder comprarse un autobús para obtener más ingresos económicos, pues así podrá transportar pasajeros.
texts.en:
José, 35 years old, went to school up to the seventh grade. He is partnered and his partner takes care of the household tasks. He has a 2-year-old son, and his wife cares for him while he works. Three people live in his house - his partner, his son and him.  

José works as a driver, bringing all sorts of materials from one place to another. He began to work with a pick-up and learned from his uncle. José goes out to work at six in the morning until six in the evening. He has a very big and heavy route but this is not an obstacle for him because he knows that he has to give his son and partner the best.

He asks for this loan to outfit and purchase a truck to become independent and offer hauling services to others.

José plans in the future to be able to purchase a bus to get more income, because then he would be able to transport passengers.

loans.use: to outfit and purchase a truck to become independent and be able to offer hauling services to others.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia took a loan from TRM to help her with the school in the future.

Silvia's loan of $ 1,000 will be used to buy school equipment, for school enrollment, clothes for school and other things.

loans.use: to buy school equipment, for school enrollment, clothes for school and other things.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is applying for a loan of $ 1,000 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 27 years old. She is running a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milks, water, body lotion, shop, shampoo, eggs, Fanta, Coca cola, Sprite and fish.

She is making good money from selling and she wants to apply for a bigger loan in the future.

Sonia is living in a town near by the school; her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy, including students.

loans.use: to buy noodles, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milks, water, body lotion, shop, shampoo, eggs, Fanta, Coca cola, Sprite and fish.

loans.name: Migdol Américo

texts.es:
Migdol tiene 41 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable en sus actividades y también con su familia, actualmente está acompañado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, han procreado 3 hijos que actualmente se encuentran estudiando en la escuela, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos en su casa y cuidar de los  hijos

Migdol se dedica a la agricultura, comenta que por años se dedica a esta actividad específicamente lo que más cultiva es maíz  y frijol, además realiza trabajos de albañilería y lo ha desempeñado durante 10 años. Para llegar al lugar donde cultiva Migdol tiene que caminar 30 minutos y su esposa e hijos son quienes se involucran en el trabajo.

Él solicita este crédito para comprar abono orgánico, fertilizantes y pagar mano de obra para la siembra de granos básicos.

Él sueña con que sus hijos logren estudiar mucho, tener más ganado y que la cosecha de granos básicos sea buena.
texts.en: Migdol is 41 years old. He is a very hardworking and responsible person in his work and also with his family. Currently, he has a life companion; his wife works in household chores. They have 3 children who are now attending school. His wife works in domestic chores at home and takes care of the children. Migdol works in agriculture. He comments that for years what he specifically grows more is corn and beans. Also, he does some construction work which he has done for 10 years. In order to get to the place where he farms, Migdol has to walk 30 minutes, and his wife and children also get involved in work. He is requesting a loan to buy organic manure, fertilizers, and to pay for hand labor to grow basic grains. He dreams of having his children be able to study a lot, of having more cattle and a good harvest of basic grains.

loans.use: to buy organic manure, fertilizers and to pay for hand labor to grow basic grains.

loans.name: Rosa Evelia

texts.es: Rosa de 37 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos 7,12, y 14 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogos los días lunes, martes, jueves, viernes y sábado, además el día miércoles prepara tamales para la venta ya que posee ya muchos clientes que la conocen y la recomiendan por ser una persona muy atenta, es así como genera sus ingresos económicos con los que ha sacado adelante a sus hijos., también recibe el apoyo económico con algunos insumos básicos del hogar por parte de esposo. Rosa desea adquirir un catálogo con más variedad de perfumes y la compra de productos para la elaboración de tamales, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en. Catalogo nuevo de perfumes, cremas, etc., para mejorar los productos de su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa, 37 years old, lives in her own home together with her life partner and their three children 7, 12, and 14 years old. She is a hard-working woman who is dedicated to selling products via catalogue on Mondays, Tuesdays, Thursdays, Fridays, and Saturdays. Additionally, on Wednesdays, she makes tamales to sell since she has many customers that know her and recommend her for being a very thoughtful person. This is how she generates the income with which she has supported her children. She also receives economic support for some basic household supplies from her husband. 

Rosa wants to buy a catalog with more variety of perfumes and buy products to make tamales. For these reasons, she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to invest in a new catalog of perfumes, creams, etc., in order to improve the products at her business.

loans.use: to invest in a new catalog of perfumes, creams, etc. to improve the products at her business.

loans.name: Shatar

texts.en: Mrs. Shatar, 50 years old, lives with her husband and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a cook at a restaurant since 2007. Her husband renders taxi services to local people. Their elder daughter works as a waitress at a pub and their younger one is married and currently staying at home. Using her previous loan, she has purchased an electric car in order to emit harmless pollutants into the air. Now she is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam in order to renovate her house. By doing so, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned for heating, thus releasing fewer pollutants into the air. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to renovate her house in order to burn less coal.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosa is 55 years old and has two children who are in school.

Rosa has a fishing business in the Philippines. Rosa requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Rosa has been in this business for thirty years. In the future, Rosa would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is 48 years old and has three children. Juditha is married and has two of her children in school.

She is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Juditha requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Juditha has been farming sugarcane for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Juditha would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris is 24 years old, married and has three children, one of whom in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Maricris requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to raise.

Maricris has been raising livestock for six years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to raise.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia works hard to support her family. Lilia is married and has a fruit-selling business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell in her food stall.

Lilia has been in this business for 30 years now.

In the future, Lilia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 44 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, milk, and sugar.

Mary Jane has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 23 years and also earns an income from selling dried fish.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, shampoo, milk, and sugar.

loans.name: Patron

texts.en:
Patron is 27 years old; he is a single man and is a security officer. With the loan, he would like to pay school fees.  He is in a higher level institution called INILAK College, it’s a private institution. He started his studies in 2011 and he plans to graduate in 2015. 

After studies, he plan to improve his standards of living and prepare for a better future.

loans.use: To pay his school fees so as to improve his life.

loans.name: Francisca Isabel

texts.es:
Desde hace 5 años, Francisca se dedica a la venta de ropa en las paradas de autobuses, esto le ha permitido generar un ingreso extra en su hogar, para así sacar adelante a sus 5 hijos que aún son menores de edad. Con el tiempo, decidió emprender en el negocio de la comida rápida, con ayuda de su esposo, éste le resultó rentable pues aprovecha los partidos de futbol de su barrio para vender.
Por ello, solicita un crédito para comprar camisas, shorts, camisolines, calcetines, pantalones, pan, embutidos, salsas, y demás productos con lo que pueda continuar generando dinero para su hogar.  Francisca es madre de 5 hijos que aún están pequeños.
texts.en:
For the past five years, Francisca has been selling clothing at bus stops. This has allowed her to earn some extra income for her household and to support her five children who are still minors.

Eventually, she decided to start selling fast food with the help of her husband, and this has been profitable as she takes advantage of the football matches taking place in her neighborhood to conduct business.

She is applying for a loan to buy shirts, shorts, camisoles, socks, pants, as well as bread, cold meats, sauces and more so that she can continue working to bring home some money. Francisca is the mother of five young children.

loans.use: to buy shirts, shorts, camisoles, socks, pants, as well as bread, cold meats, sauces and more.

loans.name: Eraste

texts.en:
Eraste is 53 years old. He is married with eight children aged between 9 and 30 years. They all go to school and they are in private schools, one of them is in Mount Kenya University. He sells milk and he has been doing in a business for the past 5 years. While his wife is business lady. 

With the loan, he would like to pay school fees for his children. After paying school fees, he plans to expand his business in order to prepare his better future.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Sokley

texts.en: Sokley is 29 years old, a homemaker with a one-year-old child living in the Takeo Province of Cambodia. Her child is shown in this picture with Sokley. Her husband is 24 years old and has been a construction worker since 2014, earning approximately $8 daily. Her husband always goes to work far from home, so she decided to request a loan to buy a motorcycle for her husband for commuting to work. This loan will help her husband reduce his traveling expenses. In the future, Sokley wants to save money to run her own business, build a new proper house and support her child in finishing high school.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her husband for commuting to work.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
For almost 10 years, Violeta has been managing her direct-selling business. Here, she sells different kinds of personal products like lotions, cosmetics, perfumes, clothes and other products. Through selling such, she earns a living for her family, providing food and other basic necessities. 

In fact, to further improve her business sales, she had a loan from KIVA previously that she utilized in purchasing more products to sell. This was actually a great help. Although sometimes it is inevitable to experience hardships, especially in business matters, Violeta still continues. 

Today, she would again like to request a PHP 25,000 loan. She needs support because she wants to pay for additional merchandise such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics to sell. It would be preferable if she had more direct-selling products to sell because it means additional income. 

In the future, she dreams of having a franchising business and then eventually expanding this. She also wishes to grow, not just financially but also spiritually. 

By faith, she hopes that you grant her request today. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional merchandise such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more variety of fruits such as mangos, grapes, thorny palms and apples.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 37 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, Joan works very hard to provide for them.

Joan runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like rice, liquor, home product care, and other groceries.

Joan has been in this business for 18 years. 

In the future, Joan would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like rice, liquor, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 30 years old with one child in school. Marilyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marilyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

Marilyn has been in this business for 7 years. 

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, beverages, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
Maura is 58 years old and has eight children. Maura is married and has two children who are in school.

Maura is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Maura requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Maura has been in this business for 20 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maura would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Alma is 38 years old and has four children who are in school.

Alma has a buy and sell coco lumber business in the Philippines. Alma requested a PHP 23000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of coco lumber to sell.

Alma has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Alma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of coco lumber to sell

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is 37 years old and has five children. Salvacion is married and has four of her children in school.

She is in the agricultural business, farming bananas in the Philippines. Salvacion requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Salvacion has been farming bananas for two years now, and has borrowed twice in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Salvacion would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribe is a rice farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. She is married with a six-year-old son. Aside from farming rice, she is also engaged in the buying and selling of harvested rice from other farmers and the selling of cold drinks like buko (young coconut) juice (it is usually mixed with milk and coconut meat), ice candy (popsicles) and gulaman drinks (sweet drinks made from caramel and jellies with crushed ice).

She is asking for a loan of PHP 13,000 to buy more rice from farmers, fertilizer for her farm, jellies, ice, milk and buko (young coconut).

She hopes to continue improving so that she can give her child a good education for his better future.

loans.use: to buy more rice from farmers, fertilizer for her farm, jellies, ice, milk and buko (young coconut).

loans.name: Maychelle

texts.en:
Maychelle is 23 years old, married and she doesn’t have children yet. She owns a farm and, because her husband is also a farmer, they help each other in working on it just to meet their daily needs. She wants to improved their living conditions and, in order to aim for that, she took a loan to purchase fertilizer for her farm to expand more and so that she can produce a good quality of rice to deliver more in the market that will result in a greater income.

Maychelle’s plan for the future is to save money and to expand to another field of business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her rice production.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia works hard to support her family. Antonia is married and has a vegetable-farming business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional seedlings and other farm supplies.

Antonia has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Antonia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional seedlings and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is a widowed woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cheryl is 28 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Cheryl has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Cheryl requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

Cheryl has been in this business for four years. In the future, Cheryl would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 30 years old, married and has one child who is in school.

She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to pays for the laborers' salaries for corn harvesting and land preparation.

Marilyn has been in business for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pays for the laborers' salaries for corn harvesting and land preparation.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a widowed woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Leonora is 58 years old and has three children who are in school.

Leonora has a food vending business in the Philippines. Leonora requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, rice, fish, vegetables and spices for her business.

Leonora has been in this business for three years. In the future, Leonora would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, rice, fish, vegetables and spices for her business.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a firewood vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock of firewood to sell to her customers for her firewood vending business.

Miguela has been in this business for 30 years. Miguela earns more income from a general store.

Miguela has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of firewood to sell to her customers

loans.name: Bat-Erdene

texts.en: Mr. Bat-Erdene, 42 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi services to local people since 1999. His wife is still staying at home, taking care of their children. Using his previous loan, he renovated his house and created a comfortable and warm place for his family. Now he is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cements and shingles for house expansion. As his children are growing up day by day, it becomes necessary to create a more spacious house. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to expand his house in order to create more space for his growing children.

loans.name: Sokhoeun

texts.en: Sokhoeun is a 45-year-old married woman with four children. She earns a main income from selling Khmer cake and has been in this business since 2002. Her husband is 37 years old, and he is a chief. All of them live in the Takeo Province in Cambodia. One of her children is a factory worker. Together, they can earn around $16 per day. Sokhoeun lacks the finances to buy a motorcycle for her children to commute to work and for family use, therefore she would like to request a loan. With the motorcycle from the loan, she and her family will be able to have better traveling conditions and reduce traveling expenses. For her future plans, Sokhoeun wants to expand her business, build a fence around her house, and support her children in finishing high school.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her children to commute to work and for family use.

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
Munira was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1965. She is living in small town with her big family. She is married and has seven children. She is an agrarian and her family is also active in this sphere. She has 17 years of practice planting agricultural products and looking after her harvest. 
Additionally, she likes to keep livestock and sell in animal market. 

She is planning to process and cultivate her land in order to get a good harvest. She is asking financial support from Kiva and IMON to buy fertilizer and natural chemicals. She hopes to be supported and awaits your compassion.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and natural chemicals for her farmland

loans.name: Zhuljeta

texts.en:
Zhuljeta is 55 and a villager and a married mother of two who resides in the rural southeastern Albania. For the past almost ten years, she's been practicing agriculture/livestock; planting and selling agricultural products and also raising animals and selling their products. More specifically, she's got 3 cows and also a horse  that helps her with the transportation of things.

She is also using some land that is in possession of her first cousin who lives in Germany, planting fodder in 39 dynyms, corn in 10 dynyms, rye in 15 dynyms and also has planted apple orchards in the rest 10 dynyms. She doesn't pay the cousin for the land, however, she shares with him everything she produces in half.
Zhuljeta's family has no other income, but whatever they make from the rural activities.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to add to her herd, for her only income

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Ma. Elena works hard to support her family.

She has a firewood vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Ma. Elena is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase more firewood to sell to her customers through her firewood vending business.

Ma. Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Peou

texts.en:
Peou is a 42-year-old widowed mother with five children in her care. She lives in the Takeo Province in Cambodia. For earning a living, she sells vegetables and she has been in this business for over nine years. Three of her children are the factory workers and other two children attend school. Together, they can earn approximately $22 per day. 

Now Peou would like to request a loan to buy lumber to build a house. With this loan, she will be able to have enough money to buy lumber to build a proper house. For her future plan, she is going to expand her business, build a ground-floor room and support her youngest children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy lumber to build a house

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is 48 old,married and has five children who are at school. She is currently running several activities; charcoal selling, genge business and makes bricks for selling. Varieties businesses enable Salama to be able at all time receive customers and this is a trick she has been using for two years now. She starts working from 08am to 08pm per working day and is able to make a fair profit. 

This is her third loan from Kiva partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. With her previous loans, paid back in full, she used to improve her businesses, bought most demanded stocks to all of her businesses. She looks in the coming years to be successfully in her businesses and life. With her profit received, Salama used to cover family costs and school fees. 

Salama will use this loan to buy genge stocks(fruits and vegetables) charcoal and making bricks for selling. She will be held accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy genge stocks (fruits and vegetables) charcoal and making bricks for sale.

loans.name: Chamwino Group

texts.en:
Zahara, who is in her mid 40s, is a married woman with five children (two sons and three daughters) who are in school. She is doing fine with her family. Zahara has been handling her life by having two small businesses, charcoal selling and snacks. She has been doing these for ten years. She works from 6 am to 8 pm daily, and is able to earn a good profit each month. 

This will be her 9th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, all of which were repaid successfully, she managed to purchase more charcoal stocks and some kilos of bakery flour. With the profit, she covered household expenses, school fees, and started building her house. She will use this loan to restock businesses items,charcoal and cooking ingredients. She dreams of owning another business selling foods. She will share this loan with her loan group, 'CHAMWINO' which has 2 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock businesses items, charcoal and cooking ingredients

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Alina is so happy for her first Kiva partnership and for great support that she had. In Sevan city of Gegharkunik region Alina lives with her mother (she is retired) and Alina’s daughter is still a pupil.
