Alina sustains her family needs only through farming and here she has cows, pigs and chickens. She still manages to sell her farm products (cheese, curd and sour cream) to neighborhood restaurants as the customers really like her products they are always fresh and tasty. 

Alina is divorced and she already got used of working very hard and a lot, in order to solve all her family problems herself and properly. 

This time she asks this Kiva loan as she wants to buy a calf and also a lot of fodder for her farm cattle. She wants to care and feed her farm cattle enough so that her farm products must be enough for sale.

loans.use: to buy a calf and also a lot of fodder for her farm cattle

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 29 years old. She is married and they have 4 children. She operates a butchery. She has been in the business for 5 years. 

This is her second loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will to buy additional stock of paraffin for resale.

Christine will use profits from the expanded business to pay school fees for her children. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of paraffin for resale

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is 45 years old,married and has three children to provide for. In order to support her children in their daily needs, she runs a retail store in town. For 18 years, she has been running the business. She wants to offer durable items that she could be of help to her customers. She took a loan to purchase a wider variety of useful items and goods to sell to provide for the needs of her customers.

Ellen's plan for the future is to save money for the educational needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy more different items to sell.

loans.name: Kanguka Sub Grp A Group

texts.en:
Perpetue is a group leader; aged 47years. She is married with 2 children aged between 16 and 17 years. The group is called KANGUKA means “WAKE UP” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future. 

She sells foodstuffs and has been running a business for 4 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more cassava, beans and bananas for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare and to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more cassava, beans and banana for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more fruits such as:mangos,sweet bananas and oranges for sale.

loans.name: Alh. Umaru

texts.en:
Alh. Umaru is a Babban Gona farmer from Maajah Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realise better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Alh. Umaru no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to increase his farmland. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the national average in Nigeria.  This will see him increase his income considerably.  This season Alh. Umaru has ambitious plans to harvest 40 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Alh. Umaru now has the opportunity to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family and school fees.
Halima operates a grocery vegetables selling stall, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase cabbages, Irish potatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cabbages, Irish potatoes and onions for resale

loans.name: Alhassan

texts.en:
Alhassan is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Damari Village. Alhassan joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Alhassan will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Alhassan now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields

loans.name: Kiteredde S. School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Br.Simon Peter. He is the Head teacher of Kiteredde S. School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Nyendo in Masaka with 420 students. 

Kiteredde School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Kiteredde School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Simon Peter ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Puhar- 02 Group

texts.en:
Tarali (first from the left) lives with her family of 4 in the Kamrup district in Assam. She is married and is the mother of two children. She runs a hotel business of her own, and simultaneously manages her pan shop. Though the earning from her business helps her contribute Rs. 4500 to her monthly household income of Rs.7000, it is not enough to sustain her family. She believes that expanding her business will get her the extra income her family needs. She needs a loan to purchase utensils, rice, potatoes, etc. She is confident that the expansion would increase her monthly income by Rs. 600.

Tarali is the leader of a group of 5 women. Rama, Kanti, Hira Moni and Rakhi have joined Tarali in applying for a loan of Rs. 115000. Just like Tarali, these women need funds to expand their individual businesses and thus enhance their earning capacity. The group is grateful to its lenders.

loans.use: To purchase utensils, rice, etc. to expand her hotel business

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa is accountant from Alexeevca village, Ungheni region in Moldova.  Additionally, she raises 2 pigs, chickens, one hectare of cereals, 10 Aries of grapes and 30 Aries of plums. She is married and her husband, Vasile works as a guardian abroad and occasionally helps Larisa in managing this little farm. 

Larisa wants to expand her plum orchard by planting additional plum seedlings.
This loan will help Larisa to increase surface of plum orchard and increase family level of life.

loans.use: to buy plum seedlings to expand her orchard

loans.name: Dilnigor

texts.en:
Dilnigor is a joyful woman. She was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1986. She is living in village with her family. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a doctor. For eight years she has been doing business and well knows how to keep and care for her land. She is an agrarian. She plants corns and onion in her land. 

She is planning to plant additional agricultural products in her land. She likes her activity very much. She appealed to IMON and asked for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. She awaits your kindness and support.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is 34, living with her spouse and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc. He manages to cover his household necessities from his own store; he speaks with an even tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his good behavior; he has built up very good relations among his customers. And due to good relationships his sales have increased a lot but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. 

Therefore, Shazia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband, so he can buy sacks of rice, sugar, flour, etc. She is very glad after taking this loan and hopeful that he will successfully fulfill each request for any item and prevent the disappointment of his customers.

She is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, and assures that she will pay all due installments on time and with regularity.

loans.use: to buy inventories for her husband's general store such as sacks of rice, sugar, flour.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Ella es una mujer de 46 años de edad es casada, de momento se encuentra incapacitada debido a que le detectaron un ulcera cornal en su ojo derecho a consecuencia de una bacteria que contrajo, por lo que se le perforo la cornea teniendo como consecuencia  perdida considerable de la visión. A ella le urge una operación de inmediato ya que puede llegar a perder su visita.
texts.en: She is a 46 year old woman, and she is married.  At this time she is incapacitated due to the detection of a corneal ulcer in her right eye, which is the result of a bacteria that she contracted.  Because of this, her cornea was perforated, which led to considerable loss of vision.  It is urgent for her to have an immediate operation because she could lose her vision.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Shoghan

texts.en:
In the village Ddmashen of Gegharkunik region lives Shoghan with her husband. She was born here and after getting married at a very young age, she managed neither to have higher education nor to work and she became a farmer like her husband with whom she is marred already 50 years.

 Now on her nice farm, Shoghan takes care of her cattle (she has cows, a lot of chickens) and she is also seriously engaged in bee keeping. She has the tastiest honey which is very popular in the village and as she likes to say it is because she loves her bees and cares of them with tenderness and pleasure and the result ia the bees answer to her kindness making honey of the perfect quality, which is she sells very quickly. 

Shoghan also sells her farm’s milk, macun (national dairy-product), cheese and eggs. Shoghan will be very happy and thankful if Kiva lenders help her to solve one very important question that is to buy fodder for her farm cattle and also wax papers for her bees.

loans.use: to buy fodder for her farm cattle and also wax papers for her bees

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 63 years old and married with four children.

Lourdes is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Lourdes requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Lourdes has been in pig fattening for four years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Lourdes would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Ella es una mujer viuda tiene 54 años de edad. Sufre de cataratas en el ojo derecho a consecuencia de una enfermedad  que padece desde hace varios años, por lo que ha perdido visibilidad. Debido a lo anterior dejo de trabajar, ella laboraba como afanadora. Lo que le preocupa es llegar a perder la vista totalmente y no poder disfrutar a sus nietos.  Le urge una tratamiento quirúrgico para volver a tener un nivel de vida mejor.
texts.en:
She is a 54 year old widow. She suffers from cataracts in her right eye as a result of an illness she has suffered from for several years. Therefore, she has a loss of vision. Because of this, she stopped working. She worked as a cleaning lady.

What worries her is losing her vision completely and not being able to enjoy her grandchildren. It is urgent that she have surgery in order to have a better quality of life again.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Zakia

texts.en:
Zakia is a 31-year-old poor lady. The financial condition of her family is not good and their living standards hardly seem fit for human beings. She wants to establish her house and change the living standards of her family. Her whole family depends upon a single earning person. Her husband drives an auto rickshaw which is their single source of income. 

She wants to buy an additional rickshaw for her husband as well. He wants to assemble a new auto rickshaw from a maker. He has collected almost the full amount but is short of the total. 
Therefore, Zakia wants to receive a loan for her husband so he can buy his own auto rickshaw. In this way she will encourage her husband, so that he can drive his new rickshaw and can generate income for her family. 

She hopes that her husband will be stable in this profession and drive the auto rickshaw for a long time. She is very thankful to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new rickshaw for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Elmer Esaú

texts.es:
Elmer de 34 años de edad, pudo estudiar hasta bachillerato, está acompañado y es padre de 2 hijos, una niña de 12 años la cual estudia 5° grado y un varón de 8 años que estudia 3° grado, en su casa solo vive  con su esposa y sus hijos.

Elmer se dedica a trabajar como ayudante de albañil desde hace 6 años, él trabaja con un tío el cual le enseñó dicho oficio, también se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado y en eso también le ayuda su padre.

Él solicita este financiamiento para comprar una vaca y para hacer escrituras de un terreno.

Él espera tener mas ganado y venderlo a buen precio, de esta forma podrá construir su propia casa, pues donde vive este momento no es propia.
texts.en:
Elmer, age 35, was able to complete high school. He is in a relationship, and he has two children. He has a 12 year old daughter; who is in 5th grade, and an 8 year old son; who is in third grade. He only lives with his wife and children.

Elmer has worked as an assistant bricklayer for six years. He works with an uncle, who taught him this trade. He also buys and sells livestock, and his father also helps him with this.

He is requesting this loan to buy a cow and to get the deed to a piece of land. He hopes to have more livestock, and to sell it for a good price. This way he will be able to build his own house. The house where he is now living is not his own.

loans.use: to buy a cow and to get the deed to a piece of land.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 49 years of age and has three children. In order for her to support her husband in providing for the family's needs, she engages in a buy-and-sell business.

For the past two years while running the business, Mercy has wanted to improved their living conditions and expand their business. So, she decided to take a loan to buy more good items, such as a variety of clothes, slippers, shoes and toys, to sell to her loyal customers.

Mercy's plan for the future is to save money for the educational needs of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Altantsetseg, 44 years old, lives with her husband and four daughters in Kherlen, the easternmost town of Mongolia. She has been working as an ingredient developer at a sausage factory since 2011. Her husband works at the same place as an assistant. Their eldest daughter graduated from her university and lives on her own. Their other three daughters study at university and high school.

Mrs. Altantsetseg is requesting a loan of 3,800,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, shingles and pebbles in order to complete her house. With her previous loan, she only managed to partially build her house. Before fall, she wants to complete her house and move into a comfortable and warm place.

loans.use: to complete her half-built house.

loans.name: Medelina

texts.en:
Medelina is from Trinidad, Bohol. She is 44 years old and a married woman.

Medelina is engaged in a sari-sari (general) store business selling commodities needed by people on a daily basis. She sell chips, biscuits, peanuts, canned food and toiletries. She also helps her husband in managing their chainsaw servicing business.

Medelina is asking for a loan to buy soft drinks, fertilizer, rice, a videoke machine, seasoning, toiletries and canned food.

In the future, she plans to expand her store and offer more products to make it successful.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, fertilizer, rice, a videoke machine, seasoning, toiletries and canned food.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is 65 years old and married. He lives in Molave, Zamboanga del Norte.

For the past 30 years, Francisco has been a farmer. He earns 9,500 PHP each month and is a new member of PMPC.

Francisco is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan to purchase bags of fertilizer. In the future, he hopes to expand and improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Romik

texts.en:
This young farmer’s name is Romik and he is 29 years old. He lives with his wife and two pretty daughters in Tsovagyugh village of Gegharkunik region. Romik on his farm with his nice wife runs farming and agriculture. In the farm he has cows, calves, a heifer, a bull, a pig, piglets and chickens. Romik’s wife makes very tasty cheese, macun (national dairy-product) and with their farm’s milk, meat and eggs she sells it to their neighbors and some regular customers. Romik also sells a very good sort of potato which he cultivates on his plot of land. 

As he mentioned, his farm and farming works he likes very much and he is thankful to his father who willed to him this profitable farm. So with this loan amount Romik wants to buy a piglet and also fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy a piglet and also fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Rasha

texts.en:
Rasha is 25 years old, married and has one son and one daughter. She has a small grocery project and is preparing a new place for her project near the market to increase her sales. 

She is requesting a 10,000 EGP loan to buy fruits and vegetables such as mangoes, apples, potatoes and zucchini.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables such as mangoes, apples, potatoes and zucchini.

loans.name: Arsen

texts.en:
Arsen is 39 years old and he lives in Tsaghkunk village of Gegharkunik region. Now Arsen lives alone as his wife and children are temporally living and working in the Russian Federation. 

Alone but very skilfully Arsen takes care of his farm and cattle on it. Arsen before used to work as a driver at the private workshop now he is only a farmer and also manages potato cultivation. In his farm he has cows, heifers, sheep and chickens. His farm products such as potato, milk, meat and eggs he sells locally during the week. 

Arsen hopes so much that with this Kiva partnership he will manage to solve one of the most important problems for the any farmer; with this loan amount he wants to buy fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: wants to buy fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Ramadan

texts.en:
Ramadan is 37, married and has 3 children. He has a small livestock project and he previously requested a 7000 EGP loan and successfully repaid it on due dates. 

Ramadan is requesting a 10,000 EGP loan to buy more animals such as goats and lambs to increase his monthly income for his family.

loans.use: To buy more animals such as goats and lambs.

loans.name: Mdidimua Group

texts.en:
Victor is in his late 20s, not married and supporting his life with business. He runs a business making and selling juices, he also runs genge selling banana,oranges,tomatoes,onions,carrots,cucumbers,salts etc. A business he has been with for 3.5 years now. He starts business from 07am to 10pm daily and able to make a fair profit each month. 

This is his ninth credit request to be apportioned among,MDIDIMUA, four members group who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.He used the previous loans, paid back in full, to improve his business with new items for sale. Victor received profit which he used to plow back to his business and covered his life welfare. 

In the coming years, he would like to expand his business and becoming successful. 
He will use this credit to buy fruits for making juices and genge items; fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy fruits for making juices and genge items; fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 39 years old. She is married and they have one child. She grows green grams, onions, maize and beans. She has been in the business for four years. 

This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. She will use profits from the expanded business to educate her children and expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more oranges,sweet banana and mango for sale.

loans.name: Ahlam

texts.en:
Ahlam is 37 years old, married to a farmer and has 2 young daughters. She has a small livestock project and she, previously, requested a 5000 EGP loan and successfully repaid it on due dates. 

She is requesting another loan of 10,000 EGP to buy animals such as goats and lambs to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: To buy animals such as goats and lambs.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over ten years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat

loans.name: Firuz

texts.en:
Firuz was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1987. He is married and has one daughter and his wife is a housekeeper, she looks after their kid. 

He works at government agency and has ten years of practice. His job is hard and responsible. He is tired and wanted to get the course of treatment in his vocation. He appealed to IMON asking financial support to be treated at a hospital in his vocation. He hopes to be supported and awaits Kiva lenders kindness.

loans.use: to be treated at hospital in his vocation

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en:
Fotima is a generous woman and she was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1970. She is living in a village with her family. She is divorced and lives with her parents, where she started her business with buying and selling fruits and vegetables. 

Three years ago she started doing another business of sewing traditional women dresses to orders. She has only old one sewing machine. She is planning to buy new one sewing machine. She is requesting a loan from Kiva and IMON to buy a new sewing machine. She awaits you kindness and hopes to be understood.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Sreypov's Group

texts.en:
Sreypov, 27 years old, lives in Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of four dependent children, only one of whom is in school, while the others are too young to attend school. 

For her living, Sreypov grows rice, in which she has been involved for nine years, as the main source of her family’s income. The price of crops has been decreasing and some parts of her rice fields have been destroyed by pests. These are the main challenges for her business. 

This is the first loan cycle for Sreypov to take a Kiva loan via VisionFund. In the group of four, she is the leader. Through this loan, she is going to use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seed for supporting her rice fields to produce better yields. 

She hopes that this loan will help her to get more income to update her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticides and seed for supporting her rice fields to produce better yields

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is 35 years old, married, and lives in Mahayag-Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. He engages in a poultry business that primarily supports his family.

He signed up for membership with Paglaum MPC to access additional financial support for his poultry business to meet the growing demand for dressed chicken. Christopher has successfully repaid his loans without records of delayed payments. This time, he is asking for a loan to purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 43 years old married to Priscila and blessed with five children between 21 and 8 years old.

He is a tea farmer.He has been farming for the last five years and gets a monthly income of KES.33,000.

David has applied for a loan of KES.20,000.This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya and intends to purchase fertilizers and tea seedlings to increase his production.

With the added profits,he plans to pay back the loan on time.

His dream is to become a large scale tea farmer and to ensure self reliability.

loans.use: To purchase fertilisers and tea seedlings

loans.name: Kim Sean's Group

texts.en:
Kim Sean, who is 39 years old, lives in Kampong Cham province and she has two children. To support her family condition, she does rice farm as the main source of income. Sometimes, she works for others for a fee to earn additional income for supporting her family's living. She has been involved in her job for twenty one years. The crops have been destroyed by pests; consequently, they grow unhealthily, these cause the crops produce lower yields than her expected. 

For Sean, this is her fist loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the leader of three-member group, she will apply for a Kiva loan in order to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees for better supporting her farmland. She hopes to gain high yields to get more income so that her living standard will improve than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees for better supporting her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Zarina's Group

texts.en:
Zarina is a 47-year-old woman, living with her spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  Mostly people like to chew betel leaf, so that a few years ago her son decided to open a paan shop to offer different kinds of betel leaf to the people. He offers kinds of betel leaf such as sweet pan, which consists of a mixture of chopped or coarsely ground areca nuts, betel nut, mint, coconut, fruit preserves, gulkand (rose petal preserves), and various spices, and tobacco pan, which consists of powdered tobacco.

He is an expert in preparing paan because he has been running this shop for many years, and lots of customers like to take betel leaf that is prepared by him. To cope with the increasing demand, he wants keep more stock of ingredients so that he can maximize his income. 

Therefore, Zarina has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her son can buy betel leaf, chopped areca nuts, etc. to sell. 

She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy betel leaf, chopped areca nuts and other ingredients for her son's paan shop.

loans.name: William Sr.

texts.en:
William Sr. is 73 years old, widower and lives in Sta. Cruz, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. He has a farm that he personally cultivated for over 40 years. This farming activity gives him sufficient income for the needs of his family and send all his children to school until they finished college and get a job. 

Recently, he asks for another loan of PHP 50,000.00 to purchase bags of fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers and pesticides

location.town: Tangub-Sta. Cruz, Tangub, City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Emely

texts.en: Emely is a businesswoman from Ramon Magsaysay-Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. She is 39 years old, married and has expertise in selling. She runs a rice seed retail business and a sari-sari store (convenience store). She earns approximately 35,000 PHP income that sufficiently supports her family. Emely is a full-fledged member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative and has received several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without record of default. She has applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds that produce healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. Emely continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds to sell

loans.name: Antonieto

texts.en: Antonieto is 59 years old and resides at Tudela ,Misamis Occidental, Philippines. He is married and blessed with three children of adult age. He joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in 2008 in order to access the programs and services of the Coop. He is accessing his 11th loan in the amount of 50,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory for his pharmacy business.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory for his pharmacy business

loans.name: Virgilina

texts.en:
Virgilina is managing her eatery business in Unidos, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage, and it has been doing well supporting the needs of the family. She has local customers and would also accept catering for added income.

She wishes to live in a comfortable and decent house. Recently, she borrowed an amount to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house. In the future, she wants to expand her business and would be happier to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is 51 years old and married. She lives in Mahayag-Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. For the past 20 years, Antonieta has been a farmer. She earns 80,000 PHP per cropping period. 

Antonieta is requesting a 45,000 PHP loan to pay for land preparation like plowing, harrowing, leveling & purchase bags of fertilizer. In the future, she hopes to expand and improve her business.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation like plowing, harrowing, leveling & purchase bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Mellen

texts.en:
Mellen is aged 43 years old, is married and supports 5 children. 

She has been a small scale farmer for the last 14 years. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow in order to increase milk production for supply. 

She plans to use the anticipated proceeds to repay the loan and educate her children to higher levels of learning. 

Her hopes is to improve family living standards.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow in order to increase milk production for supply

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar is a teacher with a higher education and already 8 years she has worked at the school as a teacher of Armenian History. She mentions that she is happy and likes the choice of her profession. The fact that she teaches the children the history of their nation and to the facts that each person during his life must know and remember.  Tamar also gives private courses for the pupils who are going to have entrance exams on this subject. Tamar is married and she has 3 year old son. Her husband is an architect. 

This loan of 500.000 Armenian drams she asks for, as she wants to buy a computer and also some professional literature in order to prepare more interesting materials and find more historical facts for her courses which will be useful for her pupils.

loans.use: to buy a computer and also some professional literature

loans.name: Ludencia

texts.en:
Ludencia is 35 years old and married with one child. Ludencia works very hard to provide for them.

Ludencia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, rice, eggs, and other groceries.

Ludencia has been in this business for 15 years. 

In the future, Ludencia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, rice, eggs, and other groceries

loans.name: Abadahemuka Sub Grp B Group

texts.en:
Clemance is a group leader; aged 32 years.She is married with 3 children aged between 4 and 11 years. The group is called ABADAHEMUKA means “the good people” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their future better. 

She is a tailor and has been running in business for 10 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more tailoring supplies for her business for sale. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more tailoring supplies for her business for sale.

loans.name: Nang's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Kampong Cham province, Nang is 43 years old and a mother of four children. Two of her children are in school and others are too young. 

To support her family’s living, Nang grows cassava and cashews. She has been involved in these two businesses for twenty-five years. Pests have destroyed her crops severely, and this is the main challenge for her business. 

This is Nang's second loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she paid back her past loan completely. The previous loan has helped her to improve her lifestyle as well. 

Nang leads a group of two members to get a new loan of 500,000 KHR each. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay labour fees for supporting her rice farm. 

Nang hopes that this loan will help her to earn more income in order to expand her current business and therefore improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay labour fees for supporting her rice farm.

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie is 54 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children, all of whom are now adults. 

For her means of living, Lenie has been engaged in a poultry business, particularly raising chickens for three years already. She is also earning support from her husband who is a private employee. She earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month. 

Lenie has requested a loan to be used to pay the tuition fees of her child. 

She has been a member of PMPC for nine years. 

In the future, Lenie hopes to expand her poultry business.

loans.use: To be used to pay the tuition fees of her child

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda, 37, is married with three children, all of whom are in school. For 10 years, Erlinda has raised pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 20,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed, vitamins, vaccine, and other supplies to raise her pigs. She has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.es:
Gumercinda de 48 años de edad, no estudió por problemas económicos y por la falta de interés de parte de sus padres. está casada y su esposo trabaja como jornalero en la siembra de granos básicos como maíz, maicillo, en ocasiones trabaja comprando ganado. Es madre de 6 hijos de los cuales solo 3 estudian.

Gumercinda desde pequeña trabaja en los oficios de su hogar, cuando se casó los compromisos del hogar aumentaron porque ya tenia otras responsabilidades, aprendió a negociar con cerdos porque muchas veces sale con su esposo a trabajar en eso. La distancia que camina para comprar sus cerdos es variable y sale casi siempre a las 6:00 AM y regresa a las 12:00 del mediodía.

Este préstamo le servirá para comprar fertilizantes, herbicidas, cancelar el alquiler de la tierra y pagará mano de obra.


Ella espera ahorrar para darles a sus hijos menores la oportunidad de que sigan estudiando, ya que para los mayores no fue posible.
texts.en:
Gumercinda, 48, did not attend school because her parents lacked the financial means and the interest in her schooling. She is married, her husband works a day laborer, he grows basic crops such as corn and millet, and he also buys livestock occasionally. She has six children, of which only three go to school.

She has worked from childhood at home doing housekeeping. When she got married, the home commitments increased and the responsibilities changed, and she learned to buy and sell pigs because she often goes out with her husband to do this work. She has to walk variable distances to buy the pigs, leaving home nearly always at six in the morning and returning by noon.

This loan will help to purchase fertilizers and herbicides, to pay rent on the land, and to pay for labor. 

She is looking to save money so she can give her younger children the opportunity to continue going to school, as this was not possible with her older children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and herbicides, to pay rent on the land, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Ana Concepción

texts.es:
Ana es una señora de 44 años de edad, ella estudió hasta noveno grado, no continuó con sus estudios pues debido a la guerra ella tuvo que emigrar a otro país, regresó acá y ahora está casada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y han procreado 3  hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad y están casados.

Ana se dedica  a los oficios domésticos, desde que era pequeña su madre le enseñó  este oficio y gracias a eso ella puede atender a su esposo de igual forma pudo  crecer a sus hijos dándoles la atención necesaria, además apoya a su esposo en la agricultura pues gracias a las siembras y la semilla cosechada ellos pueden obtener ingresos económicos y así tener lo necesario en su casa.

Ella solicita este crédito para comprar  3 sacos de abono, insecticidas, fertilizantes y pagar mano de obra para preparar la tierra.

Ella planea para un futuro con tener una tienda con productos para la canasta básica para así poder ayudar más a su esposo económicamente y tener ahorros necesarios para su vejez.
texts.en:
Ana is a 44-year-old lady. She studied until the ninth grade. She did not continue her studies because she had to migrate to another country because of the war. She returned here, and now she is married. Her husband is a farmer, and they have three children who are now grown up and married.

Ana devotes herself to the household duties. Her mother taught her this work when she was very young, and because of this she is able to take care of her husband, and was able to raise her children and give them the attention they needed.  In addition, she helps her husband with the farming, as they are able to earn an income and have what they need at home because of the crops that they plant and harvest.

She is requesting this loan to purchase three sacks of compost, insecticide, and fertilizers, and also to pay workers to prepare the land.

She plans to have a store with basic food basket products in the future so that she will be able to help her husband financially, and have the savings they need for their old age.

loans.use: to purchase three sacks of compost, insecticide, and fertilizer, and to pay workers to prepare the land.

loans.name: Sareth

texts.en:
Sareth is a 33-year-old single factory worker who resides with her old father and a brother in the Kampong Speu Province in Cambodia. 

She has worked as a garment factory worker since 2010, earning approximately $7 each day. 

Sareth has decided to apply for a loan because she needs finances to purchase clothes to sell in her free time from work. This is her third loan with Kiva through KREDIT MFI.

This loan will help Sareth to earn more income to support her family. For her future plans, she wants to build a fence around her house.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell in her free time from work

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 63 years old and married with six children.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Marina requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs.

Marina has been in the business of pig fattening for 20 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins, and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine has a collection of ornamental garden plants. She finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities and earn for her family as well.

As a Microfinance member of PMPC, she has to seek financial help to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell. In the future, Christine wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell.

loans.name: Perlacita

texts.en:
Perlacita makes good earnings on her farming activities in Mahayag-Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. This is how she supports her family and is able to send her children to school. She wants to increase her farm yield, especially because she has had a high cost of living since her children entered college.

Perlacita approached Paglaum to borrow an amount to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticides. She has high hopes that she will have good produce this cropping season.

loans.use: to purchase a knapsack sprayer for insecticides.

loans.name: Joao

texts.en:
Joao is a fisherman living in Maliana. Most of his daily income comes from selling the fish that he catches. He started this business in 2005 with his own working capital of $800, and he is busy working at his business every day in order to earn enough money to support his family. 

He requested a loan in the amount of of $1,500 from Tuba Rai Metin in order to improve and expand his business. He will use his loan funds to buy such essential items as trawling materials and fish crates. 

He hopes to see an upswing in the amount of fish he can catch as a result of this investment, which will allow him to improve his earnings at market.

loans.use: to buy essential fishing items such as trawling materials and fish crates

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 70 years old. She is a widow with four children of adult age and lives in Dumingag-Molave, Zamboanga del Sur.

She is a pensioner-member of Paglaum MPC, where she enjoys all the benefits of a member. She availed herself of a loan recently to pay for her medical check-up and purchase maintenance medicines.

loans.use: to pay for a medical check-up and purchase maintenance medicines.

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
Jose es un hombre que lucha cada día para llevar lo necesario a su familia, vive en una comunidad de Sololá, de 50 años de edad.

Este señor se dedica a la agricultura, él tiene experiencia sobre este trabajo, pero el problema que tenía era que no contaba con el capital de trabajo, gracias a un préstamo que se le dio en ADICLA pudo incrementar su cultivo, con el poco capital que él contaba, cultivaba muy poco, pero después del préstamo cultivaba mucho más, sin embargo con este avance él no está convencido, y él está buscando ahora un segundo préstamo para cultivar en esta temporada con ello comprara semilla de cebolla y abono químico.

El gran sueño de Jose es poder construir otra casa de block para que su familia cuente con un hogar mas digno.
texts.en:
Jose, 50, has to struggle to provide for his family.  He lives in the rural town of Sololá and operates a farming business.  He has been a farmer for many years and knows what it takes to eke out a living from a small farm.  

Jose's biggest challenge is raising the working capital he needs to carry on the business. Thanks to a past ADICLA loan, he was able to plant more land than he ever had before but he needs another loan now to consolidate his gains.  He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for planting onions.  

Jose's greatest hope is that he can one day build a more substantial house so that his family has a decent place to live.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 41 years old, residing in Western Poblacion, Lopez Jaena-Plaridel, Mis. Occ. She is married and blessed with one child who is still an infant.

Eva joined PMPC on April 17, 2009 in order to access the programs and services of the said co-op. Recently, she's accessing her 2nd loan in the amount of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) for additional working capital of her existing business to buy a variety of commodities. She sells a variety of food products in the local community.

loans.use: to buy a variety of commodities.

loans.name: Sinath's Group

texts.en:
Sinath, age 31, is a farmer living in the Sangke district in the province of Battambang. She earns an income through rice farming and raising pigs. She earns about 22,000 KHR per day, and after offsetting her business expenses, she is able to save around 6,000 KHR of these earnings toward supporting her family. Sinath and her husband have three children.

Her crops have suffered due to a recent drought, and she reports that this is her primary current business challenge. 

This is Sinath's first loan through Kiva partner VisionFund. She is the leader of a group of two members, each seeking a loan in the amount of 1,000,000 KHR. She will dedicate her entire loan portion to buying fertilizer to increase the productivity of her rice crop. 

Sinath hopes that this loan investment will help her to earn a higher income, which will allow her to expand her rice farming enterprise and eventually upgrade her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to increase the productivity of her rice crop

loans.name: Deisy Isabel

texts.es: Deisy es una microempresaria que cuenta con una amplia experiencia en ventas, puesto que laboro por varios años como vendedora en un almacén de variedades, ella se vio forzada a renunciar de su empleo, porque uno de sus hijos estuvo enfermo durante una temporada y decidió trabajar independientemente para así tener disponibilidad de tiempo y poder atender a sus hijos.  En la actualidad ella comercializa prendas de vestir entre sus amigos, familiares y vecinos del sector donde reside en el municipio de Barranquilla y todos los días a partir de las 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. se dispone a realizar ventas; su habilidad y carisma le han permitido tener éxito en su negocio.  Deisy está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para surtir con nuevos diseños de ropa y así poder incrementar su base de clientes.  A futuro ella planea ampliar su negocio y mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, sin embargo ella es muy consiente que solo podrá cumplir con sus propósitos con mucho empeño y dedicación.
texts.en: Deisy operates a small retail business.  She worked for a small retailer for many years and knows what it takes to move merchandise.  She started her own business because one of her children fell ill for a time and she needed a way to make a living while she cared for him.  She hit on clothing sales and runs a business now selling clothes to relatives, friends and her neighbors in the part of Barranquilla where she lives.  She generally works from 8:00 in the morning until 6:00 in the evening.  She is a charismatic and competent businesswoman and her business is doing well.  Deisy is applying to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for a Kiva loan that she will use to stock the latest clothing lines.  She will be able to attract more customers, she says, and grow her business.  For the future, she wants to continue expanding her business and make improvements to her house, goals that she knows she can only reach with hard work and dedication.

loans.use: to stock the latest clothing for her retail business.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith de 28 años de edad, estudió hasta 6° grado y está soltera, no tiene hijos y vive con sus padres y hermanos.



Edith se dedica a los oficios del hogar desde que era una niña, aprendió este oficio de su mamá ya que al no poder continuar estudiando tuvo que aprender un oficio para defenderse en un futuro y ganarse el alimento diario.

Este préstamo lo solicita para comprar abono para aplicarlo al cultivo de maíz y frijol que están haciendo como familia.

Ella sueña con tener su propia familia, casarse y tener hijos, desea también construir su propia casa y apoyar a sus padres y hermanos en lo que sea necesario.
texts.en:
Edith, age twenty-eight, studied until the sixth grade. She is single, with no children, and she lives with her parents and siblings. 

Edith has done housekeeping work since she was a little girl. She learned this trade from her mother, as upon being unable to continue studying, she had to learn a trade in order to get by in the future and earn a daily living.

She is requesting this loan to purchase compost, in order to apply it to the corn and bean crops that she and her family are growing.

She dreams of having her own family, of getting married, and having children. She also wants to build her own house and support her parents and siblings in any way necessary.

loans.use: to purchase compost, in order to apply it to the corn and bean crops that she and her family are growing.

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly, age 36, runs a general store to earn a living. She has been in this business for three years. In her store, she offers a variety of food items for sale, such as canned goods, soft drinks, candies, and biscuits, as well as general use products such as sanitary pads.

She and her husband have two children, both of whom attend school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jelly requested a loan in the amount of PhP 12,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy grocery items to offer for sale.

In the future, Jelly would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to offer for sale in her general store

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda has been engaged in selling snacks to the school community of Trinidad, Bohol. She has been doing this business for 10 years. She is now 44 years old woman and has five children. Her oldest child is 18 years old and her youngest child is four years old. Imelda’s husband is a farmer and works hard to provide the needs of his family. Imelda is working hard also to support her husband. 

She needs fund to continue her business to buy ingredients such as flour, vegetables, sugar, and cooking oil. She also needs the fund to buy school materials and fees for her children and to buy feed for her swine business. In the future, she dreams that all her children will finish their degree.

loans.use: to buy flour, vegetables, sugar, and cooking oil

loans.name: Maria Myrna

texts.en:
Maria Myrna is a 53-year-old woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She is married and has 28 years old son. To earn a living she is running a sari-sari store business. She has been doing this business for 11 years and earns about PHP3280 per month. 

She is asking a loan to buy grocery items such as toiletries, spices, soft drinks, drinking liquor, powdered milk and chocolate drink, coffee, sugar, chips, candies and biscuits. She also buys fertilizer and rice seeds. Probably, Maria Marina has additional source of living like owning a rice farm. In the future, her only wish is to have a comfortable living together with her family.

loans.use: to buy toiletries, spices, soft drinks, drinking liquor, powdered milk and chocolate drink, coffee, sugar, chips, candies, biscuits, fertilizer and rice seeds

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Milagros is 55 years old now.

Milagros has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Milagros requested a PHP 17000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

Milagros has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Milagros would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 58 years old with five children. Myrna works very hard to provide for them.

Myrna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, junk foods, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Myrna has been in this business for 30 years. 

In the future, Myrna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, junk foods, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Savit's Group

texts.en:
Savit, age 38, earns the bulk of her income from rice farming. In order to earn additional income, she sometimes prepares and sells snack foods, and sometimes she grows and sells garlic for additional income as well. She has been involved in these activities for 10 years. Her primary business challenge is competition.

Savit lives in the province of Banteay Meanchey and has three dependent children, all of whom attend school.

She currently lacks the necessary funding to ensure a successful farming venture this season, so she decided to request a Kiva loan via VisionFund to help her. This is her first loan cycle. As the leader of a group of two members, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer in order to improve her crop growth and increase her yields. 

She hopes to gain greater yields, which will allow her to earn a higher income. Her goal is to expand and grow her current business through this loan investment.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer in order to improve her crop growth and increase her yields

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Seanglis

texts.en:
Seanglis, 62, is a farmer, living in Kampong Cham province’s Koh Sotin district. She is a married mother of two dependent children. 

To support her living condition, she grows tobacco and sells grocery items to supplement her income. She has been involved in her job for 44 years. The price of crops sold in the market is low since the crops have been destroyed by pests. 

For Seanglis, she has never been with VisionFund Cambodia and this is her first time to take a Kiva loan. She is going to manage her entire loan to pay for school fees to support her children’s studying. 

She hopes that her children will get good jobs after their graduation and that she can improve her family's conditions.

loans.use: to pay for school fees to support her children’s studying.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Mutriba

texts.en:
Mutriba is a generous woman. She was born in northern part of Tajikistan in 1980. She is living in small city with her family. She is widow and has four children. More than six years she is working at TV and Radio committee of Sogd region. 

Her sister has health problems. Her family members are trying to save up money to her treatment. Her salary does not allow her to pay whole treatment of her sister at hospital. She appealed to IMON to ask a loan for the treatment of her sister in hospital. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders and awaits your kindness. She wants to take care and look after her sister.

loans.use: To the treatment of her sister in hospital

loans.name: Sreykar

texts.en:
Sreykar, age 33, is a factory worker. She lives in the province of Kandal with her husband, age 23, and their one-year-old baby. 

She has been working in a factory for over two years. Her husband is a factory worker as well. The two of them can earn approximately $10 per day. 

Sreykar requested a loan in order to buy a motorcycle to use for commuting to the factory. This will allow her to have better and more reliable daily traveling conditions to work. 

In the future, she hopes to save enough money to build  a proper house for her family. She also hopes to support her child's education through high school.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to use for commuting to the factory where she works

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is engaged in rice farming business for six years while her husband is a tricycle driver. She is 39 years old and work hard to provide the needs of her four children who are already attending school. She dreams in the future, that all her children will get a degree. With that she plans to increase her earnings so that she has enough money to send all her children to school. 

She is asking a loan of PHP8000 to buy fertilizer, medicines and pesticides.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, medicines and pesticides

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
“Suman” or rice cake is a native delicacy in many parts of the Philippines. It varies according to flavor and the way of preparation, but basically it’s made from sticky rice boiled in coconut milk and enclosed in banana or woven coconut leaves. It’s delicious for breakfast or snack and many travelers or commuters take it out as homecoming present to their loved ones. 

Leonora, 58 years old, from Tigbauan, Iloilo helps sustain her family’s expenses with the aid of “suman” production and sales. She has eight children with her farmer husband, Anecito. It’s hard to imagine how the couple works hard to raise them. But Leonora doesn’t consider her big family as a burden. Instead, she appreciates them as companions in her life journey. They stick together (just like her rice cake) through thick and thin. They also work together in raising hogs to augment their usual needs. 

As of now, Leonora would like to buy more ingredients for rice cake preparation. It includes glutinous rice, coconuts and sugar. Her hogs also need additional feeds, but Leonora has run out of budget for it. You may extend your generous support through a PhP 10,000 loan. She will surely appreciate it together with her whole family. 

She continuously prays for good health and more blessings from God. She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for rice cake preparation

loans.name: Tedee

texts.en:
This young hardworking entrepreneur is Tedee from Tigbauan, Iloilo. He is married to Lilith, 27, and they have two small children.  Tedee drives his own tricycle for income, while his wife raises hogs in their backyard. It’s impressing how they work together to support the needs of their two young children and how they strive to save for their future. 

However, there are times when his tricycle breaks down and his income also stops. He has to buy some spare parts and pay for its repair. He implores your heartfelt generosity to lend him an amount of PhP 15,000 for this purpose. He knows that continuous income from his tricycle can help sustain their daily expenses, because their hogs are not yet ready for selling at this time. 

As a young and starting couple, Tedee has a simple dream to buy some appliances for their house. If his savings suffices, he will have their house renovated before huge educational expenses come their way. He also desires to put up a big piggery someday. He prays for good health and complete college education for his children. He is a compliant member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with his co-fellowship* members every week to inspire and strengthen each other through the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy some spare parts for his tricycle and pay for its repair

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando is 54 years old. As a way of generating income, he has engaged in variety store business within his community in Paranaque, Philippines for nine years now. He, together with his wife Adelina, who is a vendor, they work very hard to provide for the everyday needs of their family.

In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. He earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

Due to financial insufficiency, Armando wants to make his business more profitable in order to earn a higher income. For this reason, he would like to avail a loan amounting to 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy additional grocery items that are needed. He is hoping that he will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

Armando hopes for his business to prosper and for his family to be always in good condition. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items that are needed in his business.

loans.name: Charlie

texts.en:
In the Philippines, single motorcycle is a common means of transportation. In urban areas, many individuals use it as personal service vehicle to pass through the congested traffic more easily. In remote areas, on the other hand, it is being used to transport passengers. Two to three passengers (back riders) can occupy the backseat of the motorcycle, and it can occupy more if it has an extension seat that is usually made of wood. It’s more efficient than four-wheeled vehicle because it can make its way through narrow and grassy roads. 

Charlie, 34, from Tigbauan, Iloilo drives his motorcycle for passengers to earn a living. He also runs a variety store and a hog raising venture. In times that he’s out and driving, his wife, Reymilyn, watches over their store and their small piggery while taking care of their two young children. But there are times that his motorcycle can’t function well, so he has to adjust his budget in order to sustain their everyday needs. Furthermore, he’s still paying the monthly installment of his motorcycle and it cuts a large chunk of money from his income. He wishes to fully pay it this month so he can save some money to prepare for his children’s education. A loan worth PhP 14,000 would be enough for this purpose. He can still use part of the loan to buy motor parts, additional supplies for his variety store and feed for his hogs. 

In due time, he plans to buy another unit of motorcycle which he can rent out to his friend. He wishes to acquire a house and lot for his family someday. He shares his aspirations to his co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative who regularly meet once a week to strengthen each other through the fellowship and the Word of God. *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay the last installment for his motorcycle

loans.name: Lissette

texts.es:
Lissette, de 40 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está soltera, no tiene pareja ni hijos solamente vive con su padre.

Lissette, trabaja con ganado bovino de repasto desde hace más de tres años y esto lo aprendió de su padre y decidió hacerlo para conseguir ingresos económicos que le ayuden a sobrevivir, pero también trabaja la agricultura y antes era empleada doméstica. 

Lissette, necesita el crédito para comprar ganado de repasto, con esto generara mayor ganancias y así mismo tendrá  mejor calidad de vida. 

Sus sueños son, seguir trabajando muy fuerte para tener un mejor futuro y ayudarle a su padre hasta donde pueda.
texts.en:
Lissette, 40, left school after the fourth grade.  She is single, has no children and lives with her father.

Lissette operates a farming and livestock business.  She learned cattle-rearing from her father and has operated her own livestock business for three years.  She also farms and worked as a cleaner before.

Lissette is applying for a loan that she will use to buy more cattle.  The investment will increase her earnings from the business and, in turn, improve her quality of life.

For the future, she wants to continue her business and help her father however she can.

loans.use: to buy cattle for her livestock business.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana  is 29 years old, married woman. She is a mother of 3 children. In order to meet her household expenditures, she started her business selling animals. She is motivated to provide her children with the basic necessities of life. 

Now, she has requested for a loan of 50000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount  to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She dreams of providing a prosperous future to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia  is 51 years old, married woman, with 6 children, running a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffalos for milking purpose. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses.  She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. 

She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation, now, she has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR  to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales to earn good amount of income for her dream to provide better living conditions for her children

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, age 45, is a seafood vendor. She buys and sells seafood items such as crabs, shrimp, and oysters to earn an income. She has been engaged in this business for 10 years and is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She and her husband have two children, one of whom is still in school.

Elizabeth requested a loan in the amount of PhP 15,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy seafood items such as crabs, shrimp, and oysters to offer for sale.

Her goal is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy seafood items such as crabs, shrimp, and oysters to offer for sale

loans.name: Danalyn

texts.en:
Danalyn is 49 years old and married with two children.

She is in agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Danalyn is borrowing PHP 24000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pig.

Danalyn has been in this business for 10 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Pheng's Group

texts.en:
Pheng, 51, is a resident living in Kampong Cham province and a mother of three children. The main source of her family’s income is from rice farming. Her rice does not grow not and this because of being threatened by insects and droughts. This is her second loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she repaid back her past loan successfully. For her previous loan, it helped her generate more income to update her living condition to be better than before. She is a leader of a group of four members. 

As the group leader, she will manage her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees for supporting her farmland. She hopes that she can earn more income in order to update her family’s living condition.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees for supporting her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Terzinha

texts.en:
A $1000.00 is offered to Terzinhaa to improve her business. Terzinha lives in Maliana and she is a business woman. And most of her daily income is from store so she still happy to do her business. She opened her business in 2007, with her own working capital of $300.00 . She was going to add money to her principal amount to buy more additional supplies to keep in her kiosk such as biscuits, balm, batteries, eggs, candy, shampoo, Including hard drinks and other things to sell. It has become her activity so she is happy to do her every day. 

She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods. And she will to has a management for her business with this loan.

loans.use: To buy biscuits, balm, batteries, eggs, candy, shampoo, Including hard drinks and other things to sell.

loans.name: Heann's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in Kampong Cham province, Heann is 38-year-old and a mother of four dependent children. The main source of her family’s income is from rice cropping. Meanwhile, her husband is working for others for a fee to supplement her income. She has involved in her job for eighteen years. Her crops grow unhealthy because pests have destroyed it and this is the main challenge for her business. Her business earns her about 35,000KHR per day and she is able to save around 17,000KHR each day after offsetting her business expenses. 

This is her fifth loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she repaid her past loans completely. The past loan has enabled her to have better house to live. She is now leading a group of three members to take out a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees for supporting her farmland. She hopes that this loan will help her to earn more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees for supporting her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Maria Alicia

texts.es:
María, de 37 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está casada, su pareja trabaja en oficios varios, tiene tres hijos, pero no son de su actual esposo, solo una hija vive con ella y los demás son independientes. 

María, trabaja con ganado bovino desde hace más de tres años y lo aprendió de su hermana y su cuñado, cuando se separo del padre de sus hijos, tuvo que buscar un empleo para sacarlos adelante y fue asi como decidio dedicarse a trabajar con ganado, ahora también trabaja como empleada doméstica; la distancia donde mantiene las vacas está a 1 kilómetro y su pareja le apoya. 

María, necesita el crédito para comprar un ternero, esto le ayudará para mantenerse en el mismo negocio y poder obtener ganancias, para suplir las necesidades de su famili.

Sus sueños son, tener muchas vacas lecheras y poder procesar la leche para sacar sus derivados para comercializarlos en la comunidad y que su hija tenga un mejor porvenir.
texts.en:
María, 37, left school after the fourth grade.  She is married and her husband makes a living from various odd jobs.  She has three children, as well, but none with her current husband.  One daughter still lives with her and the others are grown and on their own.  

María learned cattle-rearing from her sister and brother-in-law and has operated her own business for three years.  She also works as a cleaner.  She keeps her cattle on land about a kilometer from her house and her husband helps her with the business.  

María is applying for a loan that she will use to buy a calf.  The investment will allow her to carry on her business and, in turn, support her family.  

María hopes to keep milk cows one day so that she can sell milk, a business that would help her give her daughter a better future.

loans.use: to buy a calf for her cattle business.

loans.name: Altina

texts.en:
Altina is requesting a loan of $1000.00 to improve her business. She is married and her husband is a driver. She is doing this business because she earning a good income and every day many people come to use her truck for moving their goods from one place to another, so she still happy to do her business. 

She is taking this loan because she wants to buy some tools such as tires, oil, diesel and other tools use to fix her truck. Altina has been involved in business activities since 2005 when she started with her own working capital of $800.00.  Before she bought a truck, she was selling gasoline, so now she is stopping selling gasoline. And now she just uses a truck for moving goods from one place to another.

loans.use: To buy tires, oil, diesel and other tools use to fix her truck.

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en:
Shumaila, age 29 and married, raises and sells livestock to earn her living. She buys baby goats and calves at low prices, raises them, and sells them at market for a profit. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. She earns enough money through her business to contribute to the family income. She earns an additional income by selling milk.

Shumaila needs to improve her business in order to meet her growing household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan in the amount of PKR 40,000. She will use her loan funds to purchase additional animals, which will allow her to increase her sales. 

Through this loan, she expects to expand her business and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Thaphonsanh Group

texts.en:
Done is a member of the Thaphonsanh Group. The members of this group applied for a loan in order to purchase TerraClear water filters in order to have access to safe drinking water.

Done understands the difference that this water filter can make for her family and for her group’s families. Local water sources require boiling before consumption, and boiling water consumes natural and financial resources. Done's new water filter will increase her family’s disposable income by substantially decreasing money spent to buy charcoal, or decreasing the time and cost spent foraging for firewood. The filter also eliminates the need to purchase bottled water if it is available.

Done is excited that the filter was purchased on an affordable payment schedule, and she is glad that the filter is guaranteed for two years, so that she and her group can continue to receive the many benefits of clean water for many months to come.

loans.use: to purchase a TerraClear water filter so that she and her family can have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Cristina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Cristina es mamá de 6 hijos, todos están bajo la manutención de su esposo y de ella, sin embargo los gastos son muchos y el salario es poco. Por eso, decidió ahorrar una parte del salario que le generaba  su antiguo trabajo para emprender una pulpería en su casa, esto le permitiría cuidar  a sus hijos y ganarse ingresos económicos. 
Por ello solicita, un crédito para comprar granos básicos, golosinas, gaseosa, verduras, frutas, salsas de tomate, papel higiénico, galletas, etc. Esto le será de ayuda porque podrá ofrecer variedad a sus clientes, en consiguiente aumentará sus ganancias y podrá expandir su negocio, pues ella planea también ofrecer cosméticos.
texts.en:
Cristina has 6 children, all of whom still live with her and her husband.  Many children means many expenses and the family's earnings haven't always stretched to cover them.  Consequently, Cristina decided to start her own business and used savings scraped together from a former job to open a corner grocery.  She operates the grocery from a space in her house so that she can have a business and still take care of her family.
Cristina is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her grocery with the merchandise that she sells: grains, snacks, soft drinks, vegetables, fruits, tomato sauces, toilet paper and other everyday products.  The investment will allow her to deliver the products that local buyers most want and, in turn, increase her earnings.  For the future, Cristina wants to also sell cosmetics.

loans.use: to stock her corner grocery.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 65 years old, married and has five children.

Erlinda is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Erlinda has been pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
Ramona de 45 años de edad, no estudió pues en aquellos tiempos las escuelas estaban muy lejos y era más difícil el acceso a la educación, está casada y su esposo trabaja como jornalero y a veces comercializa ganado, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 2 trabajan y los otros 3 estudian en la escuela.


Ramona se dedica a los oficios del hogar, además tiene ingresos económicos de la venta de ganado que a veces realiza su esposo, los oficios del hogar los aprendió de sus padres ya que desde pequeña le enseñaron todas esas tareas, cuando sale a buscar ganado para comprar sale a los alrededores hasta conseguir animales que puedan comprar para venderlos en un futuro.
	

Este préstamo le servirá a Ramona para comprar fertilizantes, herbicidas y pagar de mano de obra para las labores agrícolas.
