Ella sueña con que sus hijos más pequeños se superen académicamente  pues los mayores no tuvieron esa oportunidad.
texts.en:
Ramona, 45, didn't study. Well, in those times, the schools were very far and access to education was more difficult. She is married and her husband works as a day laborer and at times he sells cattle. She has 5 children, 2 of whom work and the other 3 study in the school.

Ramona works at homemaking, additionally, she has economic income from the sale of cattle which at times her husband does. She learned homemaking work from her parents, who taught her all of these tasks since she was young. When she goes out to look for cattle to buy, she goes to the surrounding areas until she obtains animals that she can buy to sell them in the future.

This loan will serve Ramona to buy fertilizers, herbicides and pay for labor for the agricultural work.

She dreams that her smallest children will achieve academically, well, the elders didn't have this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides and pay for labor for agricultural work.

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es:
Ana de 44 años de edad, está acompañada y su esposo trabaja como seguridad en el instituto estudiantil de la comunidad, tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos están acompañados y la menor se encuentra estudiando.

Ana se dedica a vender productos como sodas, charamuscas, frutas y refrescos, este negocio lo tiene desde hace 1 año, aprendió de su madre que era comerciante, anteriormente Ana solo se dedicaba a los oficios del hogar, el pequeño negocio lo tiene en su casa y por lo tanto no tiene que movilizarse a otros lugares a trabajar, su hija y su esposo son los que se involucran en las actividades productivas que realiza Ana.
	

Ella solicita este crédito para comprar jugos, sodas, azúcar para continuar con las ventas y comprará herbicidas, abonos y venenos para aplicar a los cultivos.

Ella espera ahorrar para darle a su hija la posibilidad de ser profesional.
texts.en:
Ana, 44, is partnered and her husband works as a security guard in the student institute of the community. She has three children, two of whom are partnered and the youngest is found studying.

Ana works selling products like sodas, frozen juice, fruit and sodas. She's had this business since one year ago. She learned from her mother who was a trader. Before, Ana only worked at homemaking; she has the small business in her house and therefore doesn't have a way to mobilize herself to other areas to work. Her daughter and her husband are the ones who get involved in the productive activities that Ana does.

She is applying for this loan to buy juice, soda, sugar to continue with the sales and to buy herbicides, fertilizers and poisons to apply to the crops.

She hopes to save to be able to give her daughter the possibility of being a professional.

loans.use: to buy juice, soda, sugar to continue with the sales and to buy herbicides, fertilizers and poisons to apply to the crops.

loans.name: Cristóbal

texts.es:
Cristóbal tiene 69 años de edad, estudió hasta 3º grado, donde él vivía las escuelas estaban lejos y se le dificultaba asistir a estudiar, está acompañado y su pareja tiene un negocio de ropa en el centro de la ciudad, solamente los hijos menores viven en casa.

Cristóbal desde que se acompañó empezó a trabajar de jornalero por la necesidad de mantener a sus hijos y esposa, luego compró un vehículo para ofrecer servicios de transporte a las personas de su comunidad.


Este préstamo lo necesita para comprar repuestos para su vehículo con el que hace viajes y para comprar mas ropa para el negocio de su esposa.

Él espera seguir trabajando para su comunidad y seguir ayudándo a su esposa y sus dos hijos pequeños para que estudien.
texts.en:
Cristóbal is 69 years old, he studied until 3rd grade; where he lived the schools were far and made it difficult for him to attend to study. He is partnered and his partner has a clothing business in the center of the city. Only the younger children live at home.

Since he became partnered, Cristóbal started to work as a day laborer because of the need to maintain his children and wife. Later, he bought a vehicle to offer transportation services to the people of his community.

He needs this loan to buy parts for his vehicle with which he makes trips and to buy more clothing for his wife's business.

He hopes to continue working for his community and continue helping his wife and his two small children so that they can study.

loans.use: to buy parts for his vehicle with which he makes trips and to buy more clothing for his wife's business.

loans.name: María Erlinda

texts.es:
María tiene 54 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo grado, está casada y su esposo desde hace años administra una banda y  una orquesta musical, tienen cinco hijos, cuatro residen en estados unidos y el ultimo esta estudiando séptimo grado en la escuela.


María mas que todo se dedica a los oficios domésticos pero le ayuda a su esposo a administrar la banda, ella está pendiente de que los instrumentos estén en buenas condiciones y coordina con los alcaldes los días que tocarán en
las fiestas patronales.

Ella solicita este préstamo para reparar su vehículo ya que es el medio para trasladarse de un lugar a otro con los instrumentos y los músicos, pues es un elemento indispensable para el trabajo que realiza.

Ella siempre tiene como propósito apoyar a su esposo en las buenas y malas, y que sus hijos siempre tengan buena salud para que sigan trabajando y aprendiendo a salir adelante.
texts.en:
María is 54 years old. She studied until second grade. She is married and her husband, since years ago, manages a band and musical orchestra. They have five children, four reside in the United States and the last is studying seventh grade in school.

María, more than anything, works at the domestic jobs but she helps her husband manage the band. She makes sure the instruments are in good condition and coordinates with the mayors which days they will play in the patron saint festivals.

She is applying for this loan to repair her vehicle since it is the means of transport from one place to another with the instruments and musicians, well, it's an indispensable element for the work that she does.

She's always had as a desire to help her husband through the good and bad, and that her children always are in good health so that they can continue working and learning how to get ahead.

loans.use: to repair her vehicle since it is the means of transport from one place to another with the instruments and musicians.

loans.name: Somsaard Group

texts.en:
Keo is excited the TerraClear water filter is available on an affordable, payment plan.  
Keo and her group, along with other villagers, participated in a village meeting where they discussed the costs of treating local water supplies.  Charcoal, firewood, even bottled water were discussed and priced out over two years. The water filter Keo and her group purchased is guaranteed for two years but is known to function for up to five years.  Keo and her group also discussed the cost of medical care for water-borne disease. And after totaling up the costs, Keo and her group recognized the substantial financial savings the water filter will have for them and their families.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Khonesong Group

texts.en: Tar’s village gets much of its drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Tar and her group are excited that the Terra Clear water filter is available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now she can shift to other pursuits.  Tar and her village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for two years. Within these two years, filter users like Tar's family will see a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is a 54-year-old vigorous widow. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for many years. She knows the art of making beautiful embroidery patterns with beads and pearls. 

She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong. However, business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Nusrat ’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household. She is a mother of 5 children.

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 50,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand time after time.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand time after time

loans.name: Hulkar

texts.en: Hulkar is a generous woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1983. She is living in a beautiful town with her family. She is divorced and has one child. She wants to start her business of selling women's clothing at a domestic market. She participated in three-day training provided by IMON to start-up clients. She gained a lot of necessary information and learned how to have a successful and efficient business. She is confident now, to start a new business to be a future business woman. She is planning to buy underwear and women's clothing to sell. She asked for a loan and hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy underwear and women's clothing to sell.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is a married 33-year-old mother of five children who are all in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Marcelina has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. Marcelina requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers.

Marcelina has been in this business for four years. In the future, Marcelina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre casado de 47 años de edad, él es muy disciplinado y reprobable  que son las cualidades por las que se caracteriza en su comunidad, él es un gran albañil con muchos años de experiencia y esto le ha permitido contar con muchas personas quienes requieren de su servicio, gracias al préstamo él pudo comprar sus herramientas y su trabajo de albañil se a modernizado por las herramientas con la que cuenta y esto por supuesto que le ha beneficiado de gran forma que sus ingresos han incrementado, por lo que él ha tomado la decisión de construir una mejor casa para su familia, a raíz de esta necesidad nuevamente solicita un préstamo para comprar materiales como; cemento, cal, arena, hierro.
Manuel tiene el anhelo de poder seguir haciendo mejoras de su casa para la mejor comodidad de su amada familia.
texts.en:
Manuel 47 year old married man, he is disciplined and irreproachable, qualities which characterize him in the community.  He is a great builder with many years of experience and this has led to having many people seek him out in need of his service. Thanks to the loan he was able to buy his tools and his work as a construction worker has been modernized which of course has benefited him in a big way and his income has increased. 
For this reason he has made the decision to build a better house for his family. In accordance with this need, he has again requested a loan to purchase materials such as: cement, quicklime, sand and iron. Manuel has a desire to be able to continue improving his home to improve the comfort of his family which he loves very much.

loans.use: purchase construction materials such as: cement, quicklime, sand and iron

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna is a tailor. In addition to her tailoring business, she earns additional income as a food vendor. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. Erna and her husband have one child, and she works hard to support her family.

Erna requested a loan in the amount of PhP 20,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy materials for her business such as cloth, thread, and needles, as well as to perform maintenance on her sewing machine.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her business such as cloth, thread, and needles, as well as to perform maintenance on her sewing machine

loans.name: Flor Catalina

texts.es:
Flor de 27 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer año de bachillerato, está acompañada y su esposo trabaja como albañil y agricultor, tiene 1 hijo de 7 años de edad y estudia 1er grado en la escuela.


Desde pequeña, Flor trabaja en los oficios de su hogar, cuando se casó inicio a hacer pan, para luego salir a vender; esta actividad la aprendió de su mamá que siempre ha sido panadera, también desde hace tres meses trabaja en la alcaldía municipal de la ciudad como concejal. Para trasladarse hasta la alcaldía tarda 15 minutos y lo hace a pie y en la elaboración de pan se involucra su esposo.


Con este préstamo Flor podrá comprar fertilizantes, herbicidas, pagará alquiler del terreno y mano de obra. 


Ella sueña con que sus hijos logren ser profesionales para que tengan mejores oportunidades de trabajo en la vida.
texts.en:
Flor, age twenty-seven, studied until the third year of secondary school. She is married, and her husband works as a bricklayer and a farmer. She has one child, age seven, who is in first grade at school. 

Flor has taken care of the housework in her home since she was little, and when she got married she started baking bread, in order to then go out and sell it. She learned this occupation from her mother, who has always been a baker. Also, for three months, she has been working as a council woman in the Mayor’s Office.  It takes her fifteen minutes to walk to the Mayor’s office. Her husband helps with baking the bread. 

With this loan, Flor will be able to purchase fertilizers and herbicide, and she will also be able to pay the rent for the land and pay workers. 

She dreams that her children may be able to become professionals so that they may have better employment opportunities in life.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and herbicide, to pay the rent for the land, and to pay workers.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora, age 45 and widowed, raises pigs to earn an income. She has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She has three children, one of whom is currently attending school. 

Leonora requested a loan in the amount of PhP 15,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy feed and supplies to help her raise her pigs.

Her goal is to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and supplies to help her raise her pigs

loans.name: Shaheen

texts.en:
Shaheen, age 45 and married, engages in hand embroidery to earn an income. Her beautiful patterns are admired by the people of her community, and her designs are much in demand. She has therefore managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home.

To help her to continue her operations, Shaheen has requested a loan in the amount of 40,000 PKR. She will use her loan funds to buy spools of thread in different colors as well as packs of beads, sequins, and stones to use as embellishment. This investment will allow Shaheen consistently to cater to more customers. 

Shaheen is hopeful that she will see an increase in her income by garnering more customers for her embroidery work. She dreams of a bright future for her family, and hopes eventually to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread in different colors as well as packs of beads, sequins, and stones to use as embellishment

loans.name: Filma

texts.en:
Filma, age 32, runs a general store to earn her living. She sells grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, and eggs, and she also offers shampoo and other personal care products. She has been engaged in this business for five years. She earns an additional income from raising pigs. 

Filma and her husband have two children, and she works hard to provide for her family.

She has borrowed and successfully repaid two loans from NWTF, and she has now requested a new loan in the amount of PhP 10,000. She will use her loan funds to purchase grocery and personal care items to offer for sale in her general store.

Filma aspires to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase grocery and personal care items to offer for sale in her general store

loans.name: Mayra Lisseth

texts.es:
Mayra tiene 28 años de edad, por sus escasos recursos económicos no pudo culminar sus estudios, actualmente se encuentra casada y vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos que se encuentran estudiando.

Mayra tiene un negocio de minutas, trabaja arduamente  día con día, este trabajo lo realiza desde hace 1 año en la comunidad de su residencia, su esposo se dedica también al negocio de las minutas de forma que se apoyan mutuamente.

El financiamiento lo necesita para comprar más coco, plátano, miel entre otros ingredientes  para la elaboración de minutas.

Los sueños de Mayra son seguir trabajando con Credicampo, darles el estudio a sus hijos y tener una casa más digna.
texts.en:
Mayra is 28 years old. Due to her lack of economic resources, she wasn’t able to finish her studies. She is married and lives with her husband and her children, who attend to school. 

Mayra has a business selling shaved ice snacks and she works hard on it every day. She has done this activity in her community for the last year. Her husband also works selling shaved ice snacks so they support each other. 

She needs the loan to buy more coconut, bananas and honey among other ingredients that she uses to make the ice snacks. 

Mayra’s dreams are to continue working with Credicampo, support her children with their studies and have a better place to live.

loans.use: to buy more coconut, bananas and honey among other ingredients to make shaved ice snacks

loans.name: Maria Silvia

texts.es: María es una mujer de 48 años de edad que se gana la vida prestando sus servicios domésticos de manera domiciliar, actividad en la que se ha apoyado para sacar adelante a su familia. María vive en casa de su propiedad al lado de su compañero de vida y su hija de 4 años de edad, que es su mayor alegría. María desea colocar techo al corredor de su vivienda, ya que actualmente solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y alambre para colocar techo al corredor lo antes posible.
texts.en:
María is a 48-year-old woman who makes a living by providing her domestic services, an activity which she has relied on to provide for her family. In a house she owns, María lives with her life companion and her 4-year-old daughter, who is her greatest joy.

María wishes to lay a roof over the hallway of her house now that she is asking FUSAI for a loan to buy: galvanized sheets, wood, nails, and wire to lay a new roof over the hallway as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheets, wood, nails, and wire to lay a new roof over the hallway as soon as possible.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita, age 56, runs a sari-sari (general store) business to earn an income. Her store is well-regarded and well-known in the Molave area.

She is thankful for the opportunity to become a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC), and she is actively participating in the various programs and services that the co-op offers. She is committed to maintaining her membership in good standing, with a good repayment record. She is grateful that the financing needs of her retail business are supported by PMPC.

Esterlita requested a loan in order to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks. She will use these materials to make essential repairs to her home. She is grateful that her application was given priority, so that she can make progress toward her goal of living comfortably in a decent house.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks in order to make essential repairs to her home

loans.name: Antonieto

texts.en: Antonieto has been into motorcycle transport business for 20 years in Pelong, Aloran-Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. He is 59 years old and married with children of adult age. This business gives him sufficient income for his family needs. Antonieto learned about Paglaum MPC and signed up for membership. He uses various services of the cooperative, which greatly contributes to his general family conditions. Recently, he receives a loan of PHP 12,000 to purchase a used motorcycle for an additional unit of motorcycle transport.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle for an additional unit of motorcycle transport

loans.name: Eleodora Isabel

texts.es:
Dicen que ser barbero es trabajo de hombre, sin embargo, cuando se quiere hacer algo con dedicación no importa sexo pues con lo que se trabaja es con el corazón. Eleodora es testigo de esto pues a pesar de los comentarios negativos emprendió  una barbería, la cual él ha generado una buena entrada de dinero para proveer a sus 5 hijos.  
Con el tiempo, las ganancias le permitieron iniciar otra barbería en otra zona aledaña a su barrio. Por ello, solicita un crédito para comprar diversas herramientas que utiliza en la barbería, eso le será de gran ayuda porque de esta forma podrá generar más ingresos. Eleodora es ejemplo de dedicación y perseverancia pues gracias a sus iniciativas ha podido mejorar en su trabajo, su vivienda y sus hijos.
texts.en:
It is said that being a barber is a man's job. However, when something needs to be done with dedication, gender does not matter, as the work is done with the heart. Eleodora is witness to this, as she opened a barbershop in spite of negative comments. It has generated a good income to provide for her 5 children.

Over time, the profits allowed her to start another barbershop in a different, neighboring zone of her district. For it, she asks for a loan to buy various tools used in the barbershop. That will be extremely helpful to her because in this way she will be able to generate a greater income. Eleodora is an example of dedication and perseverance as, thanks to her initiatives, she has been able to better her job, house, and help her children.

loans.use: to buy various tools used in the barbershop.

loans.name: Cecilia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Cecilia es una joven de 20 años de edad, estudió hasta  bachillerato, está soltera y no tiene hijos, ella vive con sus padres a quienes trata de apoyar siempre con los gastos del hogar.

Cecilia se dedica a los oficios domésticos, en su casa  le colabora a su madre con el que hacer, como no pudo seguir con sus estudios decidió aprender los oficios domésticos,  en ocasiones Cecilia va a otras casas a trabajar y también realiza siembra de cultivos junto a sus padres y demás familia.


Ella solicita este crédito para comprar abono, fertilizantes, insecticidas, y pagar mano de obra para la siembra de maíz y frijol. 


Ella sueña con retomar sus estudios y sacar una carrera universitaria y después formar su propia familia.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a young woman, age twenty. She has studied through secondary school. She is single, and she doesn’t have children. She lives with her parents, whom she always tries to support with the household expenses. 

Cecilia works as a housekeeper, and she helps her mother with whatever needs to be done at home.  Because she was unable to continue with her studies, she decided to learn housekeeping, and sometimes she goes to work in other houses. She also plants crops, along with her parents and other family members. 

She is requesting this loan in order to purchase compost, fertilizer, and insecticide, and to pay workers to plant the corn and beans. 

She dreams of resuming her studies and earning a university degree, and later, forming a family of her own.

loans.use: to purchase compost, fertilizer, and insecticide, and to pay workers to plant corn and beans.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en: Leonora is a full-fledged member of Paglaum MPC and accesses its financial services to finance her stuffed toys production business. She is 48 years old from Tawi-Tawi, Aloran-Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. This business enables her to provide the needs of her family especially the education of her children. Currently, she receives a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase raw materials for her business. Leonora hopes for success in her chosen business so that she can continuously support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for stuffed toys production

loans.name: Romana

texts.en: Romana has signed up for her membership with PMPC and availed the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital it extends to a small time loaner like her. Romana is able to turn the tide in her favor and has made good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she received a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. In the future, she hopes to make a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda, age 61, engages in a fishing business to earn her living. After she and her husband catch their fish for the day, Erlinda personally sells the catch from their fishing boat in nearby municipalities. 

As much as possible, she and her husband need to have all the necessary fishing materials to minimize the chances of a low or zero catch. She already has floaters to help guard their fish cages, and she now hopes to obtain financial assistance from Paglaum MPC amounting to PhP 10,000 in order to purchase new fishing nets. Since Erlinda became a member of Paglaum MPC, she has been a member in good standing for almost five years. 

She would also like to use part of the loan funds to supplement her catch with fish caught by her neighbors, so that she can sell more fish at the nearby fish market, where they will fetch higher prices.  

In the future, she dreams of purchasing a new fishing boat by setting aside some savings every day from her daily sales.  

She is determined to see her business flourish, and she hopes to see her now-grown children find stable jobs as well.

loans.use: purchase new fishing nets

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 59 years old, a widower, and she has five children. She manages a hog raising business for income. She has been in her business for over five years now. She wants to keep ensuring good nutrition for the hogs.

That is why she is asking for additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy feed, vaccines, and medicines for her hog’s sustenance. She hopes to continue improving the flow of her business and someday achieve economic stability.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, and medicines for her hog's sustenance.

loans.name: Nazario

texts.es:
Nazario es hombre de 44 años de edad, es soltero con una linda familia de cinco hijos de las cuales son dos mujeres y tres varones, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Nazario se esfuerza mucho para darle a su  familia todo lo necesario, el desde hace 10 años, tomo la iniciativa de dedicarse a la agricultura, porque vive en una de las zonas más fértiles y produce una variedad de verduras, es por ello que él se ha esmerado mucho en cuidar la naturaleza, pues él sabe muy bien que es lo más importante para que siga dando  los mejores vegetales.
Nazario cultiva uno de los vegetales más vendibles en su región que es el tomate, pero también es uno de los vegetales más costosos para cultivar, pues requiere  de un cuidado mucho más especial para que al final de la cosecha se logre la mejor producción a raíz de esta necesidad Nazario acude a un préstamo para poder comprar sus semillas de tomate para el cultivo de esta temporada.
Nazario guarda las esperanzas de poder mejorar sus ingresos con esta inversión en su cultivo para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nazario is a 44-year-old man. He is single, with a beautiful family of five children, two of which are women and two of which are boys. This modest family lives in the community of Sololá. 

Nazario makes a great effort to give his family everything they need. Ten years ago, he took the initiative to work in agriculture because he lives in one of the most fertile areas that produces a variety of vegetables. Because of this, he has made a great effort to care for the land; he knows very well that it is the most important thing so that it keeps producing the best vegetables.

Nazario cultivates one of the most sellable vegetables in his region, which is tomato; but it is also one of the most costly vegetables to cultivate, since it requires special care to achieve the best production at the end of the harvest. 

Due to this need, Nazario is looking for a loan so he can buy his tomato seeds for this season's crop. Nazario hopes to be able to improve his income with this investment in his crop in order to provide a better qualify of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy tomato seeds.

loans.name: Tomás Emilio

texts.es: Tomás de 55 años es un microempresario que ofrece servicio de alquiler de lavadoras en el barrio donde reside al sur occidente de Barranquilla, él percibió la necesidad entre su comunidad al poco tiempo de estar residiendo en el sector y decidió invertir en estos electrodomésticos que hacen del lavado una tarea más llevadera.  Poco a poco fue adquiriendo estos electrodomésticos y hoy en día cuenta con 6 lavadoras, pero como la demanda cada vez es mayor, está dejando sin atender a un gran número de clientes y para mitigar esta situación, está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la compra de 3 lavadoras. Tomás es padre de dos jóvenes a quienes desea continuar ofreciendo una mejor calidad de vida, por eso su meta de negocio es engrandecerlo y velar por el beneficio de su familia.
texts.en:
Tomas, 55 years old, is a micro-entrepreneur who offers a service renting washing machines in the neighborhood where he lives on the southeast side of Barranquilla.  Shortly after moving into the  area, Tomas noticed the need in the community where he lives and decided to invest in these electrodomestic machines.  Today he has 6 washing machines, but with growing demand, is still leaving many customers unsatisfied. 

To help with this problem, Tomas is applying for his first Kiva loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  Tomas will invest the loan in the purchase of 3 washing machines.  Tomas is the father of young people whom he wants to continue offering a better quality of of life; that is why his business goal is growth, and being watchful for his family's benefit.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of 3 washing machines

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose is 52 years old, single, and lives at Enrile. He manages a store for income. Aside from managing the store, he also buys and sells scrap materials, bottles, and empty cans to resell to gain additional profits. He wants to continue improving his businesses.

That is why he is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, and biscuits to sell. He hopes to continue earning good profits to save for family emergency needs. He also promises to pay back his loan in full.

loans.use: to buy grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana, age 61, earns an income by operating a sara-sari (general store) business in Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She started her business because her husband's earnings as a construction worker were not enough to sustain the needs of their three children. She began by preparing small amounts of viand dishes and snack foods and selling these to members of her community, and her business grew to the point where she decided to start up a sari-sari store. She joined Paglaum Cooperative in January of 2004, and this helped her in the capitalization of her new business. She has maintained her status as member in good standing since she became a member, which is why she has received loans several times already. 

She has now requested a loan in the amount of PhP 30,000 in order to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store. 

She hopes that her business will continue to flourish, and aspires eventually to expand it into a mini-grocery.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Leah

texts.en: Leah is managing her eatery business in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. She mastered the business during the early years of her marriage. The eatery has been doing well, supporting the needs of Leah's family. She has local customers and also accepts catering jobs for added income. Recently, she borrowed money to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business. She wants to expand her business and would like to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for her eatery business

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene is 50 years old, married, and lives in Barra Puntod, Lopez Jaena-Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. 

She is a fish-vendor in her local market and is supported by her fisherman husband. Marlene is a full-fledged member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) and she has availed herself of loan products for her business. 

Recently, she availed herself of a loan to redeem pawned land for housing.

loans.use: to redeem pawned land for housing.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of supporting her family. 

Recently, she availed herself of a loan to purchase bags of animal feed. Aside from her project of concreting the pig pens, she thought of adding heads of pigs for commercial sale. 

Someday, she hopes to open a meat shop in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.name: Carmelito

texts.en: Carmelito is 55 years old, married with three school-age children and lives in Molave, Zamboanaga del Sur. He operates a business delivering products like dried fish and grocery items to neighboring towns. This supports his family's needs and sends his children to school. Recently, Carmelito asked for a loan to purchase inventory for his business. He hopes he can maintain his membership in good standing with Paglaum MPC.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for his business delivering dried fish and grocery items to neighboring towns.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en: Divina, 28, is married with one child. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for five years already. The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her child. She is still continuing the business because it provides good income due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her child. Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her child. She already took out loans previously to purchase additional grocery stock and now she is applying for another loan for her store

loans.use: To purchase additional items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena, age 40, has just started up her "palay" rice trading business this month. ("Palay" refers to unhulled rice grains.) She expects that she will be earning approximately PhP 3,000 each month. She started her business to supplement the income of her husband, who is a member of the Highway Patrol Group. She and her husband live in Sinara Bajo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, with their two children, both of whom attend school. 

Lorena has been a member of PMPC for seven years. She has requested a new loan in order to purchase sacks of palay for drying, milling, and retailing. 

In the future, Lorena hopes to expand her palay trading business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of palay (unhulled rice grains) for drying, milling, and retailing

loans.name: Aigie May

texts.en:
Aigie May works hard to support her family. Aigie May is single and has a pottery-making business in the Philippines.

Aigie May requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials like clay and sand for her pottery-making business.

Aigie May has been in this business for four years now and earns additional income from a general store.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials like clay and sand for her pottery-making business

loans.name: Alita

texts.en:
Alita is 46 years old and widowed, with two children.

She is in agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. Alita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Alita has been in this business for five years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Heroncia

texts.en:
Heroncia has a junk shop business on her place. Her neighbors and nearby villagers bring their junk to her shop. Heroncia is 48 years old, married, and lives in Unidos, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. This business adds to their monthly income and sufficiently provides for the needs of her family. 

Currently, Heroncia is asking for a loan from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) to purchase junk materials for her junk shop business.

loans.use: to purchase junk materials for her junk shop business.

loans.name: Urbano

texts.en:
In the year 2013, Urbano learned of Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives start-ups. As a farmer in Mahayag-Molave, Zamboanga del Sur, he tried his luck and borrowed a loan to jump-start his corn production. After several months, he was able to return his borrowed capital. To this day, Urbano feels he owes his good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted him with the money he used for his business.

Recently, he availed a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. Urbano wishes to sustain his business and be able to supply corn in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia, age 52, runs a general store to earn an income. She has been running this business for 15 years, selling grocery items like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, and eggs, as well as offering shampoo and other personal care products. She earns an additional income from operating a water refilling station. 

She and her husband have two children, and she works hard to provide for her family.

Cecilia has borrowed and successfully repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She requested a new loan in the amount of PhP 15,000 through NWTF in order to purchase grocery and personal care products to offer for sale in her store.

Cecilia aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery and personal care products to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Ailyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store. Ailyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in the market.

Ailyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in the market

loans.name: Edmundo José

texts.es: Edmundo reside en compañía de su cónyuge e hijos en el municipio de Barranquilla, él inició su propio negocio al sufrir un accidente en la empresa para la que laboraba, lo que le ocasionó lesiones en su pierna izquierda y un trauma difícil de superar.  En medio de una situación laboral desequilibrada y  a pesar de estar en un momento de dificultades, él emprendió su negocio un Billar, consideró en que esta actividad podría encontrar el sustento para su familia.  En su negocio también ofrece cervezas que son un aperitivo adecuado para compartir con amigos en estos sitios de entretenimiento. Actualmente está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en canastas de cervezas y así tendrá un mayor surtido, para aprovechar la demanda de consumidores.  Edmundo cuenta con dos años de funcionamiento y su meta a futuro es incrementar las ventas.
texts.en:
Edmundo lives with his spouse and children in the municipality of Barranquilla. He started his own business after having an accident in the company for which he worked, which caused injuries to his left leg, and a trauma that was difficult to overcome. 

In the midst of an unstable employment situation, and in spite of being in a difficult time, he opened his billiards hall business.  He thought that he would be able to provide for his family with this occupation.  He also sells beer at his business, which is a beverage suitable for sharing with friends in these fun places. 

Currently, he is applying for his first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will invest it in cases of beer so that he will have a larger supply on hand in order to take advantage of consumer demand. 

Edmundo has been in business for two years, and his goal for the future is to increase sales.

loans.use: to invest in cases of beer.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita, age 61, prepares and sells snack foods to earn an income. Her customers are members of her immediate community. She is proud of the fact that she has been able to use the proceeds of her business to send all of her children through school, and some of them have graduated college. She states that this was all made possible with the financial assistance of Paglaum MPC.

Pacita and her husband live in Unidos, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. 

She requested a new loan in order to purchase ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for snack vending business

loans.name: Rosalesa

texts.en:
Rosalesa is a farmer, and she has gained a wide experience in farming over the years. She has mastered the farming activities of planting, growing, caring for, and harvesting crops, as well as earning and distributing farm-related income. She supports her family through her hard work.

Just as she nurtures her crops, Rosalesa has nurtured her membership with PMPC. She has always maintained a good repayment record, so she knows that she can always turn to the Cooperative to support her financial needs. 

She requested a new loan in order to purchase rice seeds that are expected to produce healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.  

Someday, Rosalesa hopes to purchase another piece of rice farmland to cultivate. This will be an investment that will add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds that are expected to produce healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline signed up for a membership with PMPC in order to obtain the needed capital to start up a sari-sari (general store) business. She is thankful for the capital that was extended to a small-time borrower like her. 

Evangeline has been able to turn the tide in her favor and is making good sales in her new business. She wants to take advantage of her good fortune, so she requested a new loan to restock her store with basic commodities, such as canned goods, oil, and soy sauce. 

In the future, she hopes to use her income to build a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with items like canned goods, oil, and soy sauce

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Alto, Lopez Jaena , Misamis Occi

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene, age 28, sells traditional boiled egg snacks known as "balut" to earn an income. Her husband helps her, and they are able to support themselves through this business activity. They live in Bato, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.

When Irene learned about Paglaum MPC, she signed up for registration. She requested a loan in the amount of PhP 7,000 in order to purchase raw materials like duck eggs for their balut-making business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials like duck eggs for her balut-making business

loans.name: Erwin

texts.en: Erwin has wide experience in selling. He has mastered the purchasing of quality products, pricing, selling and earning income as well. He has been into this business for eight years. As Erwin recalls, he started with PHP 2,000 capital and ventured into selling bicycle parts and bolts. Through the financial assistance of Paglaum MPC, where he is a member, he slowly invested in various construction products until it became hardware that primarily supplies construction products, bicycles, motor spare parts and many more. To this date, Erwin avails a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase additional inventory like tires, bolts, angle bars, iron rod, and galvanized iron sheets for his hardware business. He hopes to expand his business so that he can provide more job opportunities to his neighborhood.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory like tires, bolts, angle bars, iron rod, and galvanized iron sheets for his hardware business.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia, age 61, runs a general store to earn an income. She has been operating her store for five years, and also earns an income from selling rice and raising pigs. She and her husband have four children, and she works hard to provide for her family. 

Celia requested a loan in the amount of PhP 15,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, and eggs, as well as personal care products such as shampoo to offer for sale. She has borrowed and successfully repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. 

She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and personal care products to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Sraun's Group

texts.en: A mother of four dependent children and living in a rural area village of Kampong Cham province, Sraun is 38 years old. For her living, she has been doing rice farming to support her family for 20 years. The price of rice has been decreasing, which is the problem for her business. Sraun has never been with VisionFund and this is the first time for her; she and her member are applying to take a Kiva loan of 1,000,000 KHR for each. As the leader, she is going to manage her entire loan portion to buy pesticide, fertilizer and seed for supporting her farmland. She hopes that this loan will help her gain high yields to earn more income in order to improve her living condition.

loans.use: to buy pesticide, fertilizer and seed for supporting her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Leslie Ann

texts.en: Leslie Ann, 27, is married with one school-aged child. Her major source of income is buying and selling grocery items. She has been in this business for four years already. The business helped her meet her family's financial needs, especially the education of her child. She is still continuing the business because it provides good income due to her loyal customers. Someday, she will have a legacy to leave to her child. Her plan is to maintain her inventory so that her customers will be served well. She is still planning for a business expansion for the good of her child. She already availed loans previously to purchase for additional stocks and now she is re-applying a loan for her store.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Fabiana

texts.en:
Fabiana has signed up her membership with PMPC and availed the needed capital to start up a sari-sari store business. She is thankful for the capital it extends to a small time loaner like her. Fabiana is able to turn the tide in her favor and has made good sales these days. She wants to take advantage of the good fortune. Recently, she availed a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil and soy sauce. 

In the future, she hopes to mount a decent home for the family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like canned goods, oil and soy sauce

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria has wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities like growing, caring, harvesting and earning income as well. Gloria has supported her husband doing this type of work. Like a farmer, Gloria has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knew she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. Recently, she applied a loan to purchase rice seeds will result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings. Someday, Gloria hopes to purchase more rice land to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds that will result in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.name: Cenedita

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Cenedita works hard to support her family.

She has a weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Cenedita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her weaving business.

Cenedita has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Delmy Maribel

texts.es:
Delmy de 46 años de edad, estudió solo hasta 6° grado,  está casada y tiene cuatro hijos, dos de ellos ya son independientes y con Delmy su esposo solo viven los dos hijos menores.

 
Delmy se dedica a la costura, trabajando con el gobierno en la elaboración de uniformes escolares para las escuelas de su cantón, ella se dedica a la costura desde hace 10 años, trabaja en su casa con la ayuda de una sobrina y así obtiene mejores ingresos sobre todo en la época de inicio de clases.

Este préstamo le servirá a Delmy para complementar el dinero de un vehículo para ofrecer servicio de transporte en las comunidades aledañas.

Ella desea esforzarse para lograr tener una mejor vivienda y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Delmy is 46 years old and studied up to Grade 6. She is married and has four children. Two of them are independent now so only her husband and her two youngest children live with Delmy.

Delmy works sewing, working for the government making school uniforms for the schools in her canton. She has worked sewing for 10 years. She works from her house with the help of a niece and doing this makes better income especially around the beginning of classes.

This loan will help Delmy to supplement the money for a vehicle to offer transportation services in the neighboring communities.

She wants to make an effort to have a better house and improve her business.

loans.use: to supplement the money for a vehicle to offer transportation services in the neighboring communities.

loans.name: Cherly

texts.en:
Cherly is 58 years old, widowed with seven children.

Cherly works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo and other personal care products. Cherly has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Cherly aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo and other personal care products

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao, age 45, farms cassava and rice to earn her living. She has been involved with her farming ventures for 27 years. It is a struggle, as many of her crops have been destroyed by pests. She tells us this is the primary challenge for her business.

Mao lives with her husband and their three children in the province of Kampong Cham. 

This is Mao's sixth loan cycle with Kiva partner VisionFund. She has successfully and completely repaid her past loans. Her previous loan helped her business and allowed her to improve her living. She is now applying for a new loan in the amount of 3,000,000 KHR. She will spend this entire amount on buying fertilizer for supporting her crops and increasing the productivity of her farm. 

Her goal is to earn enough income to upgrade her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for supporting her crops and increasing the productivity of her farm

loans.name: Channy's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in Kampong Cham province, Channy is 44 years old and has one dependent child who is in school. The main source of her income is from rice farming. Moreover, she works for others for a fee to get extra income to support her family condition. She has been involved in these businesses for 26 years. 

Because of drought, the crops do not grow well and this is the main challenge for her business. This is the third loan cycle for Channy with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) to take a new loan of 1,500,000 KHR and another member seeks 700,000 KHR as well. Channy has improved living standards from her past loans. As the leader, she is going to spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and rice seed for supporting her farmland. She hopes that this loan will enable her to get more income so that she can have enough ability to buy a motorbike to commute to work on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for supporting her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Dalia

texts.en:
Dalia is 43 years old, married and has six children, five of whom are currently in school.

Dalia is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Dalia requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pig. Dalia has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 47 years old and married with one child. With her one child currently in school, Marites works very hard to provide for them.

Marites runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items like candies, canned goods, beers, soft-drinks, shampoo, milk, diapers, etc. to sell. Marites has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items.

Marites would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like candies, canned goods, beers, soft-drinks, shampoo, milk, diapers, etc. to sell

loans.name: Generación 2015 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “GENERACIÓN 2015” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Alto Lima, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lidia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de tenis,  venta de mantas, venta de ropa deportiva, venta de frutas, venta de cuadernos, venta de sombreros, venta de papa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lidia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de sombreros; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años, por herencia de sus padres, ya que ella apoyaba desde niña, con el pasar del tiempo decide implementar un negocio independiente.
 El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de sombreros por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “GENERACIÓN 2015” communal bank is starting their 1st loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Alto Lima regional office. It is made up of eight members lead by a board of directors with Lidia as the President. The businesses that the members have are varied. Amongst them are tennis shoe sales, the sales of blankets, selling sports clothing, selling fruit, selling notebooks, selling hats and the sale of potatoes.

The loan that they are taking out will benefit all the entrepreneurs Lidia being one of them. She indicated that this is her first time being part of Pro Mujer, joining on the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. She currently has a business selling hats. She said that she learned the business a number of years ago as an inheritance from her parents, as she helped them since she was a child. With the passing of time she decided to open her own independent business.

The loan that she is taking out now is to increase her working capital (buying hats wholesale) which she will acquire at the wholesalers in the city of El Alto. Later she will sell them in her sales space. This form of working allows her to generate resources to support her family economically as she is married and has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she replied that she likes the teaching and the health services that the institution provides.

loans.use: to buy hats wholesale.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers for her fruit and vegetable business. Elma has been in this business for 15 years. She earns more income from food vending.

Elma successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Elma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en:
Felicisima is 48 years old and married with six children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Felicisima has been raising livestock for 15 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Felicisima is borrowing 16,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is 60 years old and married with four children, two children are presently in school. Diana works very hard to provide for them.

Diana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo and other personal care products. Diana has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo and other personal care products

loans.name: Diovelen

texts.en:
Diovelen is 38 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Diovelen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo and other personal care products. Diovelen has been in this business for 3 years. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo and other personal care products

loans.name: Neang's Group

texts.en:
Neang, who is a farmer and 47 years old, lives in a remote area of Kampong Cham province. 

Neang struggles for a living via rice farming. She also works on her co-villager's farm for a fee to supplement her income. She has been involved with her farming for 29 years. Drought caused her crops to poorly grow. 

For Neang, this is the second loan cycle with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner) and she completely repaid her past loan. With her past loan, her family's living condition was improved. 

As the leader of the five-member group, Neang's Group, she will manage her entire loan portion to buy rice seed and fertilizer to support her farmland. 

Neang hopes that she can get more income, so that she has enough money to buy a pumping machine to support her rice fields.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and fertilizer to support her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita works hard to support her family. Angelita is married and has a buy-and-sell toys business in the Philippines. Angelita requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of toys to sell. Angelita has been in this business for 5 years now. Angelita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of toys to sell

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en: Mom, 32, is a farmer living in Pursat province’s Bakan district and is a married mother of two dependent children who are in school. To support her living conditions, she has been growing rice for 15 years. Because of the drought, the crops have not grown well. For Mom, this is the third loan cycle for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) -- she repaid her previous loans completely. The past loan enabled her to earn good income to improve her lifestyle. In a group of three, she is the leader. She is going to use her entire loan portion to buy seeds, pesticides, and fertilizers for supporting her farmland to produce good yields. She hopes that she can upgrade her living standard to be better than before.

loans.use: to buy seeds, pesticides and fertilizers for supporting her farmland to produce good yields

loans.name: Tree's Group

texts.en:
Tree, age 62, is a rice farmer. She has been engaged in this work for 44 years. She also sometimes earns additional income by working for others for a fee. Due to drought, her crops have been producing low yields, which is the primary problem encountered in rice farming.

Tree lives in a remote area village of Kampong Cham province. 

She has been with Kiva partner VisionFund for four loan cycles already, and she has repaid her past loans successfully. Her past loans allowed her to better provide for her family with enough consumption and to upgrade her living conditions. 

Tree is now the leader of a group of two members. She will utilize her entire loan portion of 1,000,000 KHR on buying fertilizer and rice seed for supporting her farmland. She expects to see a higher yield as a result of this investment.

She hopes that this loan will help her to bring in more income, so that she can eventually buy a motorbike so that she can start her work earlier.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed for supporting her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kang Meas District

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en: Dolores is 49 years old and has six children. Dolores is married and has two children who are still in school. Dolores is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Dolores requested a PHP10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies to raise her pigs. Dolores has been in this business for 19 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF in order to sustain her business. She would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Ismaeel

texts.en:
Ismaeel is a 25-year-old, single man from Deir Al-Balah city. He lives with his family in a simple house. Because the economic situation in Gaza is not good, Ismaeel started his own business a few years ago. He has a stall for selling new and used shoes. This is the only source of income for the family.

Ismaeel took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy new inventories for his stall. This will increase his sales and also his income. Ismaeel appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new inventories (shoes) for his stall.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en: Jamila is a 49-year-old, married woman from Rafah city. She lives with her family in a simple house. Because the economic situation in Gaza is not good, two years ago, Jamila started her own business. She manages a grocery store that sells candy and other goods. This is the only source of income for the family. Jamila took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help her to buy new inventories and goods for her grocery store. This will increase her sales and also her income. Jamila appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy new inventories and goods for her grocery

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Насиба из города Душанбе очень милая и озорная девушка. Ей 21 год и она замужем. Её муж в данный момент находится в России на заработках. С самого детства Насиба увлекалась кулинарией. Все что пекла Насиба нравилось окружающим и ее семье. На каждые праздники или дни рождения она пекла вкусные торты. Постепенно ее хобби превратилось в профессию. Теперь она брала выпечку на заказ и тем самым получала неплохой доход. Однако с увеличением заказов ей стало не хватать бытовой техники таких как: хорошая духовка, миксер, кухонный комбайн. Для покупки данной техники у Насибы нет средств и ее единственная надежда это поддержка с вашей стороны.
texts.en: Nasiba, from Dushanbe, is a very sweet and spirited young woman. She is 21 years old and married. Her husband is currently in Russia as a migrant worker. Since her childhood, Nasiba has loved cooking. Her family, and everyone around her, loves everything that Nasiba bakes. For every holiday or birthday, she bakes delicious cakes. Gradually, her hobby has turned into a profession. Now she bakes to order, and from this she makes a fair profit. However, due to an increase in orders, she now needs appliances like: a good oven, a mixer, and a food processor. Nasiba does not have the funds to buy these appliances, and her only hope is support from you.

loans.use: to buy appliances for her baking business.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fruit vending. Remedios is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Remedios has been sustaining her business activities through her past 30 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 56 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Gloria has been fattening pigs for 26 years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

Gloria is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 38 year old married woman. She is involved in the cloth trade business. She purchases a variety of cloth at low prices from the city market and sells in her own town. She has a strong customer base.

Shamim has requested loan of 45,000 PKR. She wants to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to boost her earnings with her loan

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to boost her earnings with her loan.

loans.name: Imaan

texts.en: Imaan is a 26-year-old, married woman. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family, she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. She has requested a loan of 55,000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and generate more income to cover her daily expenses

loans.name: Arshid

texts.en: Arshid is 56 years old and a married woman. She is a mother of five children; one of her sons is running a general store business in order to meet their everyday expenditures. Over time he has maintained many customers. Currently, she has requested a loan of 60,000 PKR for her son to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar, and tea to cater to more customers and generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar, and tea to cater to more customers and generate a healthier source of income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new inventories and goods for her store

loans.name: Annmary

texts.en: Annmary is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells auto spares. She also does farming. She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy a water pump to pump water to her farm. She hopes that in the future she will be successful.

loans.use: to buy a water pump to pump water to her farm

loans.name: Lyra

texts.en:
Every entrepreneur’s goal is to see his or her business succeed or grow. Lyra, a CCT partner, was granted a loan in the amount of PhP 26,000 last year to use toward her sari-sari store business. ("Sari-sari store" is a Filipino term that means "variety." These small stores are found in every barrio, city, neighborhood, or barangay, and they offer items or products by volume, by kilo, or by piece.) 

CCT helped Lyra a great deal through this loan, and she is very grateful. The loan funds were used to buy additional stocks of items such as bottled drinks, grocery items, and school supplies. 

Lyra aims to have a one-stop shop that carries all items needed by consumers. She is aware that competitors on this line of business are rampant, so she is contemplating ways to attract buyers to her shop. One of her goals is to turning her sari-sari store into a grocery store. 

Since the store is her bread and butter, Lyra exerts a great deal of effort and hard work for the business, since it has allowed her to sustain her family’s needs and support her children’s education. 

Added capital will help her business flourish, which is why Lyra decided to apply for another PhP 26,000 loan this year. She will use her loan funds to buy additional stocks such as laundry products, drinks, toiletries, canned goods, and school supplies to offer for sale. 

Lyra is consistent in attending the weekly fellowship group for CCT partners, consisting of 15 to 30 members. Here she gains spiritual strength from other members' life-changing testimonies, shares her own experience of God’s love, pays micro-finance loans, and hears God’s Word each week.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items like rice, canned goods, condiments, and beverages to offer for sale

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said, age 32, saw his small house in Rafah City destroyed completely during the latest conflict in Gaza. He has been living in a small apartment in the same area ever since, with his wife, their son, and their two little daughters.

He decided to approach Palestine for Credit and Development (FATEN) for a loan in order to rebuild his old house. 

The loan funds will allow Said to finalize the needed construction in a short time and return his family to their normal life.

loans.use: to rebuild the family house, which was destroyed during the latest conflict in Gaza

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 53 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and sells a variety of items such as cereals, soft drinks, sanitary pads, beers, noodles, etc. 

She has requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy more merchandise to sell in her general store.

Teresita has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lola

texts.en:
Lola is a strong woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan into a family of workers. She lives in a pleasant place with her family. She is divorced and has two children. 

Lola would like to start up a beauty salon business. She has experience and skill in this line of work, and she enjoys bringing joy to people in this way. She approached IMON and participated in a three-day training for start-up clients. She was satisfied to have the opportunity to receive the skills needed to operate a successful business and work efficiently. 

Though the ability and the training are in place, unfortunately Lola does not currently have not enough money to start her business. She therefore applied to IMON asking for financial support to start her business. With her loan funds, she will be able to purchase necessary salon items such as cosmetics, hairbrushes, a hair dryer, and straighteners, as well as to pay for the rented premises. 

She is thankful for the kindness and support of her Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase necessary salon items such as cosmetics, hairbrushes, a hair dryer, and straighteners, as well as to pay for the rented premises

loans.name: Marcos

texts.en:
Marcos is a teacher, he loves his daughter very much. This loan of $1000 will allow Marcos to send his daughter, Maria, to university. He will use the loan to pay for registration and school materials.

Marcos loves his daughter very much and hopes that further education will give her a brighter future.

His daughter is not in the photo because his daughter's school is in the capital.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's university registration and school materials.

loans.name: Berta

texts.en:
Berta lives in Oe-cusse. She is married and is a businesswomen. She has been doing business since 2002 with her own working capital of $200.

She is requesting a loan of $1000 from Tuba Rai Metin to add to her working capital to buy additional supplies to keep in her store, including biscuits, sweets, coffee, pulses, noodles and other things to sell.

She has a small kiosk now, and she wants to open a big store in the future. She is taking this loan to improve her management for her business.

loans.use: to buy biscuits, sweets, coffee, pulses, noodles and other things to sell.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 36 years old and married and has two children, who are both in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Anecita has been raising livestock for six years now and has borrowed from NWTF 10 times in the past to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Jabir

texts.en:
Jabir, age 40, saw his small house in Jabalia City destroyed completely during the latest conflict in Gaza. He has been living in a small, rented apartment in the same area ever since, with his wife, their two sons, and their three daughters.

He decided to approach Palestine for Credit and Development (FATEN) for a loan in order to rebuild his old house. 

The loan funds will allow Said to finalize the needed construction in a short time and return his family to their normal life.

loans.use: to rebuild the family house, which was destroyed during the latest conflict in Gaza

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a married woman with four children. She is 29 years old and two of her children are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Gina has a buy-and-sell clothes business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. Gina requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more clothes to sell to her customers.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell to her customers

loans.name: Fadwa

texts.en:
Fadwa is 36-year-old woman from Jabalia City, married and mother to two sons and one little daughter.

Fadwa was living with her family in a small humble house, but during the latest conflict in Gaza her house was destroyed completely, then she had to rent a small apartment in the same area.

Recently Fadwa took a USD loan from Palestine for credit and Development (FATEN) in order to rebuild her old house. The loan will allow Fadwa to finalize the needed construction in a short time and return her family to their normal life.

Fadwa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to rebuild her old house.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
