Gladys is a married woman who is 60 years old with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Gladys has a water refilling station business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. Gladys requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials like gallons of water, filters and other materials for her business.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials like gallons of water, filters and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria operates a small kiosk to earn her living. She opened her kiosk business in 2008 with her own working capital of $200. 

She is requesting a loan in the amount of $600 to improve her business, and she will use the loan funds to buy additional supplies to offer for sale in her kiosk. These will include grocery items like noodles, eggs, and coffee, as well as miscellaneous goods like detergents, slippers, and cigarettes. She is happy with the loan offered by Tuba Rai Metin because it allows her to have more working capital with which to buy more goods.

She would like to expand her kiosk into a bigger store in the future.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and other goods to offer for sale in her kiosk

loans.name: Engrasia

texts.en:
Engrasia is applying for a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business, which is a shop. She started this business in 2013 with her own working capital of $200. She is busy every day with her business.

Now she is taking this loan because she wants to use it to buy more items to keep in her kiosk, such as hand and body care products, shampoo, bubble lights, cigarettes, toothpaste, rice, noodles, sweets and other things to sell. She hopes that with this loan she can improve her management.

loans.use: to buy hand and body care products, shampoo, bubble lights, cigarettes, toothpaste, rice, noodles, sweets and other things to sell.

loans.name: Suanepa

texts.en:
Suanepa, age 36 and the mother of five children, prepares and sells barbeque in her community to earn a living. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013, and she requested a new loan in order to buy chicken, sausage, tomato sauce, mushroom soy sauce, and a sack of onions, as well as plates and aluminum foil. This loan investment will help her to run the business smoothly.

Suanepa intends to use her profits to further expand her business.

loans.use: to buy chicken, sausage, tomato sauce, mushroom soy sauce, and a sack of onions, as well as plates and aluminum foil

loans.name: 16 De Julio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “16 DE JULIO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora  Candelaria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de papa y chuño, venta de leche, venta de queso, venta de verduras, venta de ropa, venta de comida. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Candelaria es integrante, ella indica que ingreso a Pro Mujer por una promoción realizada por el asesor que es parte de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de papa y chuño; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió, hace más de treinta años, de sus padres a la necesidad económica que tenía. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa y chuño por mayor) que adquirirá de la feria de Colquencha y posteriormente lo comercializará en la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y la socialización entre las clientas en las reuniones de pago.
texts.en:
The “16 DE JULIO” communal bank is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Senkata centre. The group has ten members and is governed by a board of directors. Candelaria is the President. The members' businesses are varied and include: potato and chuño sales; milk sales; cheese sales; vegetable sales; clothing sales; and food sales.
This loan will benefit these small businesspeople. Candelaria says that she joined Pro Mujer due to an assessor's promotion. She currently has a business selling potatoes and chuño. She says that she learned this business over thirty years ago from her parents, due to economic necessity.
This loan is for an increase in working capital (purchase of potato and chuño wholesale). She will purchase her products in the Colquencha market and sell them in the city of El Alto. This work allows her to generate an income to support her family. She is married with five children.
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the training and socialization among clients in the payment meetings.

loans.use: to buy potato and chuño wholesale.

loans.name: Walaa'

texts.en:
Wlaa' is 23-year-old single lady from Jabalia City, Wlaa' was living with her family in a small humble house, but during the latest conflict in Gaza her house was destroyed completely, then she had to rent a small apartment in the same area.

Recently Wlaa' took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit and Development (FATEN) in order to rebuild her old house. The loan will allow Wlaa' to finalize the needed construction in a short time and return her family to their normal life.

Wlaa' appears in the photo.

loans.use: to rebuild her old house.

loans.name: Khamees

texts.en:
Khamees is a 24-year-old single man from Dier Al-Balah city. He lives with his family in a simple house. Because the economic situation in Gaza is not good, two years ago Khamees started his own business. He manages a grocery store that sells candy and other goods.

This is the only source of income for the family. Khamees took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy more goods for his store inventory. This will increase his sales and also his income. Khamees appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more goods for his grocery store inventory.

loans.name: Inaam

texts.en:
Inaam is a 52-year-old married woman from Jabalia City, next to the refugee camp of the same name. Inaam was living with her family in a small, humble house, but during the latest conflict in Gaza her house was completely destroyed. At that time, she had to rent a small apartment in the same area.

Recently, Inaam took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit and Development (FATEN) in order to rebuild her old house. The loan will allow Inaam to finalize the needed construction in a short time and return her family to their normal life.

Inaam appears in the photo.

loans.use: to rebuild her old house.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man with 2 children. He describes himself to be obedient. He operates a retail business where he sells detergents, sugar, bread and other items. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in an area with lots of customers and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital.

Joseph will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, soap and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a stable business. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, soap and other items.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez is a 52 year old, hardworking woman who has 3 children. She has been providing the service of stitching clothes in her locality. She is quite popular for her skills in sewing. Kaneez ’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. Over the years, she has established a good clientele.

Kaneez has requested a loan amount of 45,000 PKR. She intends to use this loan to purchase a new sewing machine with some spools of thread and lace to consistently meet the demands of her customers.

She aspires to save money for a prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine with some spools of thread and lace to consistently meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Rosa Dalilian

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 53 años de edad, realizó sus estudios hasta el 5 grado, y por dificultades económicas en su familia no continuó, está acompañada y su esposo es agricultor desde hace  veinte años, tiene dos hijos los cuales viven con ella.

Rosa se dedica a la venta de tortillas y tamales en su comunidad, desde muy pequeña ejerció este oficio junto a su madre, por eso emprendió este negocio por si sola desde hace 15 años, ella se levanta temprano para la preparación de las tortillas y los tamales, por la mañana vende tortillas en su casa y por la tarde va de casa en casa vendiendo tamales. 

Rosa necesita  el crédito para comprar una plancha para la elaboración de tortillas.

Su sueño es tener una pupusería y que su esposo aumente la cosecha de granos básicos para que juntos le den un mejor futuro a sus hijos y que pueden estudiar una carrera académica.
texts.en:
Rosa is 53 and was in school until grade 5. Due to family economic difficulties, she did not continue with school. She has a partner; her husband has been a farmer for 20 years. They have two children who live with them.
Rosa sells tortillas and tamales in her community. She has been doing this work from a young age, with her mother. She learned the business and started working on her own at the age of 15. She gets up early to prepare the tortillas and tamales. In the morning, she sells tortillas in her home, and in the afternoon she goes door-to-door selling tamales.
Rosa needs this loan to purchase a griddle for making tortillas.
Her dream is to have a food store and for her husband to increase his cultivation of basic grains so that they can offer their children a better future, and so that their children can study.

loans.use: to buy a griddle for making tortillas.

loans.name: Gracelle

texts.en:
Gracelle is a single woman, 31 years old, with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Gracelle has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in the market.

Gracelle has been in this business for eight years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in the market

loans.name: Jenie

texts.en:
Jenie makes and sells ice cream to earn a living. She earns an additional income from operating a general store. She has been sustaining these business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. Jenie and her husband have five children, and she works hard to support her family.

Jenie requested a loan in the amount of PhP 20,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy ingredients like milk, sugar, flavoring, and ice cream cones, as well as materials needed for her food production business.
 
She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like milk, sugar, flavoring, and ice cream cones, as well as materials needed for her food production business

loans.name: Gledis Leonor

texts.es: Gledis de 51 años, es una microempresaria madre de tres hijos mayores de edad, a quienes ofreció bienestar, gracias a su trabajo en su taller de confecciones. Tras vivir una difícil situación sentimental con su pareja, decidieron separarse; ella asumió el rol de madre soltera y tuvo que llevar las riendas en su hogar, pero con mucho amor y sacrificio formó a sus hijos en valores y excelente educación. Hoy en día cuenta con  10 años de funcionamiento y una clientela fidelizada a quienes ofrece servicio de diseño y costura a la medida, así mismo ella desea ofrecer mejores acabados a sus productos y para ello está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la compra de una fileteadora industrial.  Su meta a futuro es tener más máquinas de coser para ampliar su negocio y contratar personal, lo que le generará mayores ingresos y podrá realizar adecuaciones a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Gledis, age 51, is a mother of three grown children and is a small business owner. She provided her children with well-being thanks to her work in her sewing workshop. After a difficult situation with her partner, they decided to separate. She assumed the role of single mother and had to take the reins of the household. With great love and sacrifice, she taught her children values and gave them an excellent education. 
She has been working as a seamstress for ten years now, and has a fixed clientele. She offers services designing and sewing clothing. She provides the best work. She is applying for her first loan on Kiva via the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will invest in the purchase of an industrial sewing machine. This will generate her a greater income so she can make improvements to her home.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial sewing machine.

loans.name: Blanca Asteria

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 54 años de edad, está acompañada y vive junto a 3 de sus hijos, pues los otros 3 ya han formado su propio hogar.


Blanca tiene el negocio de venta de tostadas, nuégados, tamales, enchiladas y atol; día a día sale a vender a los lugares aledaños de su comunidad, su esposo le ayuda en ocasiones pero él más que todo trabaja en la agricultura.

El financiamiento lo necesita para comprar fertilizantes para abonar la milpa.


Blanca tiene muchos sueños a futuro, como seguir trabajando  fuerte cada día y poder darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Blanca is 54, has a partner, and lives with three of her children; her other three children have already started their own families.
Blanca has a business selling toast, nougat, tamales, enchiladas, and atol [a cornflour drink]. Day after day, she goes out to sell in the areas around her community. Her husband helps her on occasion but he mainly works in agriculture.
She needs this loan to buy fertilizer for her corn.
Blanca has many dreams for the future, including continuing to work hard every day to give her children a good education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her corn.

loans.name: Njira

texts.en:
Njira sells fruits and green vegetables to earn an income. She is the widowed mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She always struggles to improve her grocery stall in an attempt to boost sales so that she can save money in order eventually to have a more formal establishment. She currently faces the major challenges of transportation and seasonality in her business. 

Njira is requesting a loan in order to purchase sacks of fruits and green vegetables to offer for sale.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits and green vegetables to offer for sale

loans.name: Anabela

texts.en:
Anabela is taking a loan of $ 1000 to improve her business. She runs a mini-shop that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as shirts, trousers, shorts, long sleeved tops, short sleeved tops and shoes.

She opened her mini shop a year ago with her own working capital of $ 600. She is a hard working woman and her husband is a teacher. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future. She is happy with this loan because it will help her to improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy shirts, trousers, shorts, long sleeved tops, short sleeved tops and shoes.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago es un gran padre de familia, es muy querido por sus hijos porque se esfuerza mucho para darles lo mejor, él tiene 58 años de edad, es feliz mente soltero y vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Santiago a pesar de tener una edad muy avanzada, no es ningún impedimento para él y sigue trabajado y obtiene sus ingresos, pues él desde hace 15 años es agricultor, vive y come de esta labor, por sus años de experiencia cosecha los mejores frijoles y maíz de su región que por cierto una parte lo utiliza para la alimentación de su familia y otra parte lo vende en el mercado regional. En estos tiempos es la temporada del cultivo de frijol y el segundo cultivo de maíz, y una de las dificultades que Santiago tiene es no contar con su capital suficiente para poder cultivar en esta temporada, es la razón que él tiene para solicitar un préstamo de dos mil quetzales.
Santiago sueña con poder construirles una casa a sus hijos para que ellos vivan mucho mejor.
texts.en:
Santiago is a great family man. He is beloved of his children because he works very hard to give them the best. He is 58, happily single, and lives in a community of Sololá.
Despite his age, Santiago continues to make a living. His age is not an impediment at all. He has been a farmer for 15 years. He lives and eats from this labour. Because of his years of experience, he cultivates the best beans and corn in the region. He feeds his family with part of his harvest and sells the rest in the regional market. This is the season of cultivation for beans, and of the second corn cultivation. One of his challenges is not having enough capital for this season. This is why he is requesting a loan of 2000 quetzals.
Santiago dreams of being able to build his children a home so they can live better.

loans.use: to cultivare corn and beans.

loans.name: Imani

texts.en:
Imani is a 40-year-old single businesswoman who has sold sunflower cooking oil for two years. She works from 8 am to 8 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

Imani requests her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to purchase sunflower cooking oil. She plans to have a wholesales and retail shop. She will repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase sunflower cooking oil.

loans.name: Aissatou's Group

texts.fr:
Mise en place le 05 Janvier 2015, ce banc villageois est composé de femmes du groupement du village qui ont adhéré dans le programme comme les femmes des villageois environnants afin de rendre les activités dans le petit commerce plus rentables, elles s’activent également dans l’agriculture sous pluie. Une bonne ambiance anime les rencontres du groupe. 

Madame Aissatou, âgée de 40 ans (assise à l’extrême droite avec une main levée ), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants dont 06 garçons et 01 fille. Elle s’active dans la vente d’arachide et d’huile de palme dans son quartier.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 05 sacs d’arachide à 20000 f le sac qu’ 'elle transforme en patte et 02 bouteilles de 20 litres d’huile de palme à 14000f la bouteille.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte assurer la nourriture familiale et renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Started on 5th January 2015, this rural bank is made up of women from the village group who joined the programme, such as women from surrounding villages. Their purpose is to improve the profitability of their trading activities, in addition they also engage in agriculture during the rainy season. A good atmosphere pervades the group meetings.

Mrs Aissatoum 40 years old (seated at the extreme right with her hand raised), is the featured group borrower.She is married and the mother of 7 children of which 6 are boys and 1 is a girl. She sells ground nuts and palm oil in her neighbourhood.

With her new loan, she intends to purchase 5 bags of ground nuts at 20000f per bag, which she will make into paste, and 2 20-litre bottles of palm oil at 14000f per bottle.

With the income, she will provide the family's food and build her activity.

loans.use: to buy 5 bags of ground nuts at 20000f each to be made into paste and 2 20-litre bottles of palm oil at 14000f per bottle.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman with 3 children. She describes herself as honest and operates a dairy farm and  grows tea. 

She requests 50,000 KES to buy fertilizer. Her business goal is to be a world class farmer  within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita makes furniture to earn her living. She has been engaged in this business for 15 years, and has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She earns additional income from selling charcoal. She is a hard-working entrepreneur. 

Amelita and her husband have three children.

She has successfully paid back her previous loan through NWTF, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. She is borrowing PhP 29,500 in order to purchase materials needed for making furniture, such as wood, nails, and paint.
 
Her goal is to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed for making furniture, such as wood, nails, and paint

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
Rufina, de 31 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, está acompañada y su pareja trabaja como albañil, tienen dos hijos que van a la escuela y viven en casa familiar.

Rufina, vende tamales en el centro de la ciudad, se dedico al este negocio porque tiene que suplir las necesidades de sus hijos y darles lo necesario, su horario de trabajo es de 1:00 p.m. a 6:00 p.m.       

Rufina, necesita el crédito para comprar medicinas para su hija, de esa manera lograra cubrir los gastos médicos de su hija porque está enferma y no tiene suficiente dinero.

El sueño de Rufina, es que su familia viva bien y que la salud de su hija mejore.
texts.en:
Rufina, age 31, studied up to the seventh grade. She is in a relationship and her partner works in construction. They have two children who go to school and they live in a family home. 

Rufina sells tamales in the city centre. She does this because she needs to provide for her children and make sure they have what they need. Her work schedule is from 1:00 PM to 6:00 PM. 

Rufina needs this loan to buy medicine for her daughter. This is how she will be able to cover her daughter's medical expenses because her daughter is sick and she doesn't have enough money.

Rufina's dream is for her family to live well and for her daughter's health to improve.

loans.use: to buy medicine for her daughter

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a 44-year-old married woman with one child.

She has raised pigs for 2 years  and has borrowed 1 time from NWTF to sustain her business.  Lilia requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Sirian Marilyn

texts.es:
Siria es una mujer emprendedora que lucha siempre por salir adelante, actualmente está  soltera y vive junto a su madre quien se dedica a oficios domésticos y con sus dos hijos quienes dependen unicamente de ella.

Siria estudió hasta sexto grado, en la actualidad ella tiene una pequeña tienda gracias a la idea de una amiga quien también le ayuda con el negocio desde hace mas de dos años. 

Ella solicita este crédito para comprar aceite, arroz, azúcar, café, gaseosas, churros, etc para surtir su tienda.  

Su sueño es tener siempre su tienda y así poder  sacar a su familia    adelante, darle el estudio necesario a sus hijos para que sean unos profesionales.
texts.en:
Siria is an enterprising woman who always fights to get ahead. She is currently single and lives with her mother, who does housework, and with her two children who depend on her alone.
Siria studied until grade 6. She currently has a small store, thanks to a friend's idea. This friend has also helped her with her business for over two years.
She is requesting a loan for the purchase of oil, rice, sugar, coffee, pop, churros, etc to stock her store.
Her dream is to always have her store so that she can support her family and give her children an education so that they can be professionals.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, sugar, coffee, pop, churros, etc.

loans.name: Maria Ernestina

texts.es:
María es una mujer trabajadora y responsable, junto a su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, trabajo que realizan desde su niñez, ellos tienen una parcela en la cual siembran sus cultivos. 

Ella solicita este crédito para comprar abono, herbicidas  y otros insumos necesarios par el cultivo de granos básicos.

El sueño de María es tener  buena cosecha y que el invierno sea favorable para tener buenos ingresos económicos ya que la agricultura es su fuente de trabajo y dependen unicamente de las cosechas.
texts.en:
María is a hard-working and responsible woman. She and her husband work in agriculture. They have been doing this since childhood. They have a plot of land where the plant their crops.
She is requesting this loan for the purchase of manure, herbicides, and other supplies for cultivating basic grains.
Maria's dream is to have a good harvest and that the winter will be favourable for a good income; agriculture is her source of income and they depend entirely on their harvests.

loans.use: to buy manure, herbicides, and other supplies.

loans.name: Geralda

texts.en:
Geralda requests $ 1000.00 to improve her business;his is her first loan. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to keep in her store such as rice, body lotion, soap, shampoo, beer, cigarettes, sugar, salt, coffee, books, and fish.

Geralda opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of $ 200.00. She earns a good income and  will use the income to support her family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy rice, body lotion, soap, shampoo, beer, cigarettes, sugar, salt, coffee, books and fish.

loans.name: Alta Gracia

texts.es:
Alta gracia es una persona trabajadora, depende de si misma y vive con su esposo, su hija y dos nietos, por falta de recursos económicos nunca fue a la escuela. 

Ella se dedica a la agricultura trabaja junto a su esposo desde que se casaron hace casi veinte años, ellos alquilan una parcela para poder realizar la siembra.

Este crédito lo necesita para pagar el alquiler del terreno, comprar abono, semillas, herbicidas y para pagar mano de obra para sembrar el cultivo.

Ella sueña con tener buenos resultados de los cultivos y que sus nietos crezcan con buenos valores morales.
texts.en:
Alta Gracia is a hard-working person. She depends on herself. She lives with her husband, daughter, and two grandchildren. She never went to school due to a lack of financial resources.
She works in agriculture with her husband. They have worked together since they married almost 20 years ago. They rent a parcel of land to cultivate.
She needs this loan to pay the rent on her land, to buy manure, seeds, and herbicides, and to pay the labourers to plant the seeds.
She dreams of having good results from the harvest, and of her grandchildren growing up with good morals.

loans.use: to pay the rend for her land, buy manure, seeds, and herbicides, and to pay the labourers.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen  is a 23-year-old energetic married woman with 4 children. She has had a hand-embroidery business  for many years.  She knows the art of making beautiful embroidery patterns with beads and pearls. She is passionate about her work and has a good client base. 

Parveen’s embroidery patterns are very popular and she provides a good income to her household. She is also a seamstress.  She requests 30,000 PKR to buy  large quantities of thread, sequins, and pearls to complete customers' orders on time.

loans.use: to buy thread, sequins, and pearls.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita has four children and works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business  and  earns additional income selling sell dried fish.  Lolita requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fish to sell at her local market.

Lolita has sustained her business through a previous loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is  to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell at her local market.

loans.name: Conelyn

texts.en:
Conelyn is married and works hard to support her family by selling bananas for 7 years.

She requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional bananas.

In the future, Conelyn would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase bananas.

loans.name: Marelis Isabel

texts.es: Marelis de 45 años es una empresaria independiente que inició con un pequeño negocio de venta de minutos, pero en la medida que la afluencia de clientes era mayor, consideró que podría proyectarse a futuro como un negocio más rentable y que sería buena idea adquirir vitrinas exhibidoras de artículos misceláneos y así fue, hoy en día complementa sus actividad con el servicio de navegación por internet.  Todos los días a partir de las 8 a.m. hasta las 7 p.m. los residentes del sector en el municipio de Barranquilla, acceden a sus servicios y productos ofrecidos en su almacén tales como papelería, maquillaje, esmaltes, productos para el aseo personal, accesorios y demás. Su meta de negocio es mantener un surtido que responda a las necesidades de los clientes, es así como está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar artículos de papelería, accesorios, lociones corporales y demás.  Ella es madre de dos hijos y su meta personal es costearles sus estudios universitarios, por eso todos los días de la semana ella trabaja muy dedicada y comprometida.
texts.en:
Marelis, age 45, is an independent businessperson who started with a small business selling cell phone minutes. When her clients became more affluent, she started to think she could have a more profitable business in the future and that it would be a good idea to buy display cases for miscellaneous items. She now has another business allowing customers to use the internet. Every day from 8 am to 7 pm, the residents of her sector in the municipality of Barranquilla come for her services and products such as stationery, makeup, nail polish, toiletries, accessories, and more. 
Her goal for her business is to maintain a stock to respond to her clients' needs. For this reason, she is applying for her first loan on Kiva via the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for the purchase of stationery, accessories, body lotion, and more. She has two children and her personal goal is to pay for their university studies. For this, she works every day of the week with great dedication and passion.

loans.use: to buy stationery, accessories, body lotion, and more.

loans.name: Bademman Lolo4 Group

texts.fr: Safoura est une femme marié âgée de 29 ans;Elle mère de 04 enfants.Elle mène l'activité de vente de pagne depuis 2009.Elle est connue par habitants de son quartier et excelle dans le métier.La qualité et la diversité de ses produits font d'elle une commerçante renommé et appréciée.Elle veut s'approvisionner en balles de pagne de marque Was,Fancy et Bazin pour accroître son bénéfice.Elle à deja bénéficié du crédit 6 fois à ACFIME et à toujours bien payé
texts.en: Safoura is a married woman aged 29 years. She is the mother of 4 children. She has engaged in pagne cloth sales since 2009. She is known among her neighbours and excels in her trade. The quality and diversity of her products make her a renowned and appreciated tradeswoman. She wants to get supplies of bails of pagne cloth in Was, Fancy and Bazin brands in order to augment her income. She has already benefitted from 6 ACFIME loans and has always diligently repaid.

loans.use: to purchase bails of pagne cloth (Was, Fancy and Bazin brands) for resale.

loans.name: Brain Group

texts.en:
Lucy  is a single woman with three children (all attend school).  She has  run a retail shop for five years and works from 6am to 10pm daily to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Lucy's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase her inventory and has repaid her loans successfully.  She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva's support. She used the profit to pay school fees, repay the loan,  and cover household expenses.  She will use this loan to increase her inventory.  She dreams of expanding her shop.

Lucy will share this loan with her loan group ("Brain") which consists of five members who hold each other accountable to repay the loan.

loans.use: to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Enith María

texts.es: Enith de 67 años en compañía de su cónyuge e hijo, residen en un barrio del municipio de Barranquilla, ella es madre de seis hijos de los cuales solo uno aún vive a su lado.  De la mano de su pareja comercializan desde su vivienda, Queso, Pescado y Cerveza, a los vecinos del sector, actividad que les genera los recursos para su sustento y gracias a ello pueden aportar a los gastos del hogar, así mismo son apoyados por su hijo quien también contribuye a la economía del hogar con los frutos de su trabajo.  Enith a partir de las 8 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m. está disponible para atender su negocio; su sonrisa y carisma hacen que se genere diariamente la compra de estos productos de consumo masivo y cabe resaltar que son de excelente calidad. Actualmente está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar canastas de cerveza, Queso y Pescado.  Su meta a futuro es ampliar su gama de producto y tener más utilidades para realizar adecuaciones a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Enith, aged 67, is the mother of six children, only one of whom lives with her and her husband in a neighbourhood located in the municipality of Barraquilla.

With her husband's help, she sells cheese, fish, and beer from their home to the residents in the area. Through this occupation, they generate the means to support themselves and cover the household expenses. Their son also helps them out through the fruits of his labour.

Enith is available to tend to her business from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. Her smile and charisma play a key part in the daily sales of these mass-market products, and it's worth noting that their quality is excellent.

Currently, she is requesting her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy cases of beer, cheese, and fish. 

Her future goals include expanding her range of products and generating a higher profit to make some home improvements.

loans.use: to buy cases of beer, cheese, and fish.

loans.name: Epenesa

texts.en:
Epenesa is a 58-year-old woman with 7 children. She has had a sewing business for a year. 

Epenesa requests a loan to buy needles, a sewing machine, and measuring tape to help her with the business. She will use her profit to expand her business. 

She became a member of SPBD in 2011.

loans.use: to buy needles, a sewing machine,  and measuring tape.

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman and owns a house without running  water and electricity.  Her greatest monthly expense is food.
 
Chizi has operated a tailoring business for three years and makes suits. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

She will use the 10,000 KES  to purchase fabric and sewing thread for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business

loans.use: to purchase fabric and thread.

loans.name: Talalelei

texts.en:
Talalelei is a 30 year old mother with 4 children, she runs a small business of selling tuna sandwich, toast sandwich in her community to earn a living. 

Talalelei requested for a loan to buy bread, tomato sauce, box of fish canned(tuna), plastic bags, container, butter, to assist with the business. She will expand her business using her profit. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy bread, tomato sauce, box of fish canned(tuna), plastic bags, container, butter,

loans.name: Rahmonali

texts.en:
Rahmonali is a 62-year-old married. He is the resident of the district of J.Rumi. He has been fattening and selling cattle for many years. Rahmonali keeps the cattle in the pasture and he is able to take care of his family with the profits, which he makes.  Rahmonali is a responsible and hard-working person, he helps his wife to earn well and improve their life. 

Rahmonali relies on this loan to buy more cattle and fodder since he does not have enough money and he is not able to provide for his family and increase his milk/dairy production. Rahmonali awaits your generosity.

loans.use: To buy cattle and feed for them

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is a 45-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Marife has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Saira

texts.en:
Saira is a single lady and has been running her own beauty parlor on her street. She is doing her job passionately as she knows the techniques of makeup and hair design and serves her customers by providing bangles, jewelry etc. She is a well-known beautician in her town.  She has slowly but surely improved her business through the support of Kashf Foundation. 

Now she has requested a loan of 55000 PKR  to buy more beauty products for her beauty parlor, including lotions, makeup kits and lightening creams to cater to a large number of customers efficiently to earn good amount of income for bearing her everyday expenditures.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products for her beauty parlor, including lotions, makeup kits and lightening creams

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem  is 55 years old, married woman doing a business of animals’ purchase and sale with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is very motivated to provide her family with the basic necessities of life. 

She has requested a loan of 35000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers

loans.name: Muth's Group

texts.en:
Muth, who lives in Kampong Cham province, is 54 years old and is the mother of three children. To support her living conditions, she grows rice as the main source of her income. Moreover, she can earn more income via working for others for a fee. She has been involved in these businesses for 34 years.

Her crops have been destroyed by pests, so they are not growing well. This has become the main challenge that she faces, and it causes her to earn less income than before.

This is Muth's second loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The previous loan helped her to have better house to live in. As the group leader of two members, she will use her entire loan portion to buy rice seed and fertilizer for supporting her farmland in order to get good yields. She hopes that she can get extra income to upgrade her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and fertilizer for supporting her farmland in order to get good yields.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is 61, living with her nine children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
Her son has been running a mobile phone shop for many years and generating income for his family. He troubleshoots the mobiles; he sells the mobile accessories such as charger, body, data cable etc and provides the recharge facilities of different networks. 

Nowadays, a lot of demand increases of accessories and for recharge, sometimes he has to refuse his customers. But he does not have savings to further invest into business because he has spent his all income over household expenses.
 
Therefore, Suriya requested a loan for her son so he can be empower to buy additional accessories and extra credit for recharge facility. 
She thanks Kiva and field partner, over this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy additional accessories and extra credit for he son's mobile phone shop.

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Maricris works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish.  Maricris is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell at her local market.

Maricris has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell at her local market

loans.name: Binapani-01 Group

texts.en:
In the Kamrup district of Assam lives a 34 year old woman named Suma. She is the leader of a group of 7 women (Suma, Momi, Sapna, Manika, Sangita, Munna, Manju) who want to take a loan to expand their individual businesses.

Suma is married and a mother of 2 children. She is a tailor and she has been running her business for the past 7 years. Her business helps her bring home a monthly income of Rs. 4500. She wants to purchase a new sewing machine as the income from a single sewing machine is insufficient to meet the expenses of a 4 member family. With the additional machine, she will make shirts, trousers, skirts, etc. She is confident that this will fetch her an additional Rs. 300 every month. 

Suma and her group need a loan of Rs. 70,000. They have agreed to take responsibility of one another until the loan is completely repaid. They thank their lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine to expand her tailoring business

loans.name: Pesio

texts.en: Pesio is 31 years old and runs a small business providing transportation services. She has been doing this for more than a year. Pesio requested a loan to buy new wheels, paint, car seat, and air conditioner to help her maintain the good service. She hopes to use her profit to buy another taxi and expand her business in the near future. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy new wheels, paint, car seat, and air conditioner

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en: Isabel is taking a loan of $1000.00 to improve her business. She is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store such as beer, fanta, cocacola, shampoo,biscuits,oils,,sugar,salt and slippers. She opened her kiosk a year ago with her own working capital of $ 400.00.  Isabel is a hard working woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: To buy beer, Fanta, Coca Cola, water, shampoo,biscuits, oils, sugar,salt and slippers

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en:
Jameela is 28 years old married woman. She is running a business of milk selling with her husband. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas.  Jameela ’s job is to look after the buffalos and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. 

However they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Jameela  has requested for 50000 PKR  to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers for providing better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers for providing better standard of living to her family members

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Marissa works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell personal care product business in the Philippines. She earns additional income from rice retailing.  Marissa is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more personal care products like perfume, body lotion, underwear, beauty soap, and make-up kits.

Marissa has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more personal care products like perfume, body lotion, underwear, beauty soap, and make-up kits.

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en: Kaneez is 50 years old, married and has five children. Some years ago she started her business selling livestock in her community. Her husband fully supports and assists her with her work. Now, she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. Kaneez wants to use this loan to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She aspires to save money for providing her family with a prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 53 years old, married and has two children. A friendly woman who is good at selling, she has been retailing used clothes (ukay-ukay) in the market for five years now, helping to support her family beyond their basic needs.

Helen is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy bulk clothes to sell. She believes that by having more items on offer, she can attract more customers to serve.

loans.use: to buy bulk clothes to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a married man with 2 children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail business where he sells auto spares. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are loyal. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. 

He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of auto spares. His business goal is to open another business outlet within 5 years. This is his fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of auto spares

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 57 years old, married with four children.

Lucia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo and other personal care products.

Lucia has borrowed and paid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from fish vending and E-loading.

Lucia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo and other personal care products

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
A $ 1.000.00 loan is offered to Juliana to improve her business.  she opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working of $ 100.00. She will use the loan to buy stocks to keep in her store like  noodles, body lotion, sugar, coffee, water, Fanta, oils and bread. Juliana is generating a good income from selling her things from the kiosk.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business and she is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy noodles, body lotion, sugar, coffee, water Fanta, oils and bread

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 54 years old, married and works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Daisy is borrowing PHP 9000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like wood, paint, nails, etc for her furniture making business.

Daisy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like wood, paint, nails, etc for her furniture making business

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 58 years old and married with four children.

She is in agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Margie is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pig.

Margie has been in this business for 15 years and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: Razia is 34 years old, married and the mother of three children. She has had a tailoring business for many years to support her husband. She accepted the fact that if her husband alone works for their family, they will not be able to pay the household expense or meet the educational needs of their children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well. She, together with her husband, manage their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Now she has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons, ribbons and laces for meeting the orders on time. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Razia hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of thread, packs of buttons, ribbons and laces for meeting the orders on time

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marissa is 53 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Marissa has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. Marissa requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fruits such as banana, mango, orange, papaya, etc. to sell at her food stall.

Marissa has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits such as banana, mango, orange, papaya, etc. to sell at her food stall

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem from Pakistan is married and has four children. 

She has requested a loan for her husband; he conducted a food stall for offering burgers to the common people of his area in the evening. He has been changing his menus time to time according to weather, climate and taste. Nowadays, he wants to offer burgers; for this is reason, he is in better need of eggs, spices, oil, onion, cauliflower and tomato ketchup. Earlier he was selling Alu Chat (Pakistani food), which is cheaper than burgers. He does not have enough cash on hand to buy ingredients for offering the next food item.

Therefore, Naseem has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, her husband can easily buy the described ingredients. 

Naseem is the age of 27, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She thanks Kiva and field partner Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy eggs, spices, oil, onion, cauliflower and tomato ketchup for her husband's food stall.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 51 years old and married with four children, one of whom is still in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marlyn, who has been running a general store in the Philippines for five years, has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo and other personal care products. 

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, eggs, shampoo and other personal care products

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 39 years old and engaged in a retailing business. He manages a bakery in the market. To make his business stall complete and gain bigger income, Alex supplies his stall with grocery items. He has been in the business for eight years. 

Alex dreams to enlarge his business and make it a one-stop shop so that his customers can buy all their needs in his stall. Therefore, Alex is requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP to buy flour, sugar and other ingredients for making breads. He will also use the loan to buy grocery items to sell. 

Alex will be having his own family soon. He wishes that he could raise his sales and income as well as to save it for their future.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and other ingredients for making breads.

loans.name: Eseta

texts.en: Eseta is a 43 year old mother with 3 children and had a business of selling vegetables(cabbage, eggplant, cucumber) in her community to earn a living. Eseta requested for a loan to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, hand gloves and safety boots, to assist her run the business. She will to expand her business by using her profit. She joined SPBD in 2013.

loans.use: to buy vegetable seeds, chemicals, wheelbarrow, water tank, rake, shovel, hand gloves and safety boots,

loans.name: Binkadi14 Group

texts.fr: Fati est âgée de 55 ans, mariée mère de 7 enfants dont tous scolarisé. Vendeuses de céréales depuis plus de 10 ans. Ce qui fait marcher son activité c’est son expérience et l’emplacement choisi pour écouler sa marchandise. Elle veut le prêt pour s’acheter des stocks de céréales à 225 000. L’utilité du prêt c’est s’approvisionner en quantité suffisante afin de revendre. Elle a déjà reçu le prêt 4 fois et à rembourser à ACFIME aux dates prévues. Elle est une bonne cliente à ACFIME.
texts.en:
Fati is 55 years old, married and the mother of seven children who all attend school.  She has been selling cereals for more than 10 years. It is her experience and chosen location that make her business work. 

She would like the loan so she can buy a stock of cereals for 225 000.  This would allow her to obtain a sufficient quantity to resell.  

Fati has had four loans in the past and has paid the money back to ACFIME before the deadline.  She is a good customer for ACFIME.

loans.use: to buy a stock of cereals for 225 000 to resell.

loans.name: Everlyn

texts.en:
Everlyn is a married woman with three children ranging in age from two years to nine years. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, rice, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for nine years.

Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are locals. Her business goal is to have a well-stocked business within five years. She hopes that in the future she will be able to educate her children.

This is Everlyn's fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid her previous loan. She will use this KES 40,000 loan to buy more rice, flour, sugar, and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy more rice, flour, sugar, and soap to sell

loans.name: Shahin

texts.en:
Shahin aged 41 years, responsible mother of three daughters and a son. Her husband has been running a tailoring shop for many years  He takes orders from boutique keepers and sews ladies clothes to order. 
His shop situated near his house in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. One of his brothers and a few appointed tailors help him for sewing clothes. In this way;  he is generating only a little income for his family. He belongs to the middle standard family, due to low earnings; he is unable to provide better living conditions to his sibling, parents and his own family because a major portion of his income is divided among the tailors. He has been facing tough time due to low income generated source. He cannot do any other business because he he is not skillful in any other profession, so he decided to expand his current enterprise. 

He does not want to sew the garments to order because the contractors criticize and find drawbacks in his completed shipments.  He wants to buy his own fine cloth, with professional sewing machine and over lock machine for sewing garments for directly selling to the retailers. 
  
Therefore, Shanin has requested a Kiva loan through BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can buy additional professional sewing machines, over-lock machine and clothing for sewing garments. She is happy after receiving the loan and thanks to Kiva and field partner, brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fine cloth, a professional sewing machine and over lock machine for her husband's tailoring business.

loans.name: Samphet's Group

texts.en:
A local residing living in Mondulkiri province, Samphet is 32 years old. She is a mother of three dependent children, two of whom are in school and other one is too young. She makes income to improve her living via cassava growing and teaching in school. Her cassava did not grow well and it is the main problem that she faced in her farm. 

This her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan completely. She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will manage her loan portion to buy organic pesticide to support her cassava farm to get a good yield. She hopes that she can get better yields from her farm with good income.

loans.use: to buy organic pesticide to support her cassava farm to get a good yield.

loans.name: Fegauiai

texts.en:
Fegauiai is a 46 year old mother with 6 children, she owns and operates a small business of selling pancake, pork cake, buns in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 2 years. 

Fegauiai  requested for a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoon, fry pan, container,  to assist her run the business, and to gain more profit to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2010.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, plastic bags, wooden spoon, fry pan, container,

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase on his fish supplies and to buy chicks for growing to sell as chickens.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a married man with 4 children. He describes himself to be ambitious and he operates a retail business where he sells sugar, flour,milk, soap and other items. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in an area with potential and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be transport. 

He will use the Kes 65,000 loan to buy flour, sugar,bread, soap and other items. His business goal is to open a supermarket within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his kids. 

This is his fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy flour, sugar,bread, soap and other items

loans.name: Neorita

texts.en:
Neorita is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Neorita is 41 years old and has two children are currently in school.

Neorita has a fertilize duck egg business in the Philippines. Neorita requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more eggs and other materials for her business.

Neorita has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more eggs and other materials for her business

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Raquel is 32 years old and has three children are presently in school.

Raquel has a upholstery business in the Philippines. Raquel requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for her upholstery business.

Raquel has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials for her upholstery business

loans.name: Set's Group

texts.en:
Set, a farmer living in Kampong Cham province, is 38 years old and a mother of six children. She can earn an income to support her living condition via cassava growing and rice cropping to get more income. Her cassava grows not well because there was a drought. She has been involved with her farming for 20 years and she can save her daily income about 38,100KHR per day. 

For Set, this is her third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has repaid her past loans completely. Her previous loan can help on her family’s living get better than before. In a group of four members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy seed, fertilizer and pay for plowing fee to improve her farmland to get more yields. She hopes that she can get more income from her farming to upgrade her lifestyle live in a good condition.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer and pay for plowing fee to improve her farmland to get more yields.

location.town: Kampong Cham province; Kroch Chhma district

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en: Nusrat is 45 years old, married and works by hand on embroidery, making beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to build a clientele that allows her to pay some of the family's expenses. To help her to continue her work, she has requested for a loan for 40,000 PKR to buy spools of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. This loan will allow her to serve more customers and increase her income. She dreams of a bright future where she can build her own house.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her business.

loans.name: Sunema

texts.en:
Sunema is a 30 year old mother with 2 children ,she runs and operates a small business of selling pancakes, buns, pork cake in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than a year. 

Sunema requested for a loan to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, fry pan, wooden spoon, bottle of vegetable oil and plastic bags, to assist her run the business. She will use her profit to expand her business and provide for family needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.

loans.use: to buy a sack of flour, sack of sugar, yeast, fry pan, wooden spoon, bottle of vegetable oil and plastic bags,

loans.name: Marian

texts.en:
Marian is still single but she persist to accumulate and improve her lifestyle. Marian is in her thirties, manages a clothing business in the market. She is selling variety of fashion dress, clothes, belts, and shoes. Marian wants to extend her business into selling of pants and for men's clothes. 

Thus, she is asking for a loan of P50,000 to buy variety of clothes, shoes, and many more. Marian believes that by having a loan she can expand the business and comply immediately for what is a trend. She is also expecting to satisfy her costumer’s wants by availing the loan and increase her profits too.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothes, shoes, and many more.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva started selling  rice grain in her village as her business. She has been five years running the business where she gain income that helps her husband sustain their needs. Eva has four children and only one of them is still studying while three are already at work. Eva receives allowance from her children from abroad but she doesn’t want to rely only for them because she wanted them to have savings for their future. 

With her desire to have additional source of income and sustain her child needs in school, Eva raises hogs in their backyard. She wanted to raise her hogs fast in able to dispose it in the right time. Hence, she is requesting a loan of P40,000 to buy piglets to raise and feed for their maintenance. Eva hopes to maintain and grow the business to sustain their needs, and her child needs in school as well.

loans.use: to buy piglets to raise and feed for their maintenance.

loans.name: Dolores Lucitania

texts.es:
La ciudad de Manta es considerada el balneario más importante, popular y visitado del Ecuador, por sus hermosas y acogedoras playas, primer puerto de aguas profundas del Ecuador y sur América.
En este lugar vive la señora Dolores, tiene 44  años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 3  hijos, dos mayores de edad e independientes y uno de 15 años que estudia en colegio. Su esposo trabaja en una empresa pública. Viven en casa propia.
Doña Dolores para salir adelante se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y productos Brilho  (joyería, relojería y accesorios).  Su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local. Trabaja todos los días cinco horas diarias, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada quince días o al mes de acuerdo a lo que necesite. Tiene diez años en esta actividad y le va muy bien, hace poco está vendiendo ropa de pacas (ropa usada y nueva que viene de Estados Unidos en bultos).
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pacas de ropa, pantalones, blusas y camisetas para hombres, mujeres, niños. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace 8 años  y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Su sueño es que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
The city of Manta is considered Ecuador's most important, popular, and visited seaside resort because of its beautiful and welcoming beaches. It has the first deep-water port in Ecuador and South America.

In this place lives Dolores. She is 44 years old, is married, and has three children—two of whom are of legal age and independent, and a 15-year-old, who goes to school. Her husband works at a state-owned company. They live in their own home.

In order to get ahead, Dolores earns a living selling different types of clothing and Brilho products (jewellery, watches, and accessories). She sells her products from door to door and also at her home, where she has a small shop. She works five hours a day every day, and she offers her merchandise on credit and collects payments every two weeks or every month, depending on her customers' needs. She goes to Guayaquil to purchase her merchandise every two weeks or every month, depending on her needs.  She has been following this occupation for 10 years, and the business is going very well. Recently, she began selling bundles of clothing (used and new clothing packed in bales that comes from the United States).

Dolores will use this loan to buy bundles of clothing, pants, blouses, and T-shirts for men, women, and children.

She has been a member of a communal bank for eight years, and she likes it because the loans are granted quickly. 

Her dream is to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy bundles of clothing, pants, blouses, and T-shirts.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia works hard to support her family. Lucia is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Lucia requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, rice, canned goods, egg, milk, etc. to sell.

Lucia has been in this business for 15 years now.

In the future, Lucia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soft drinks, rice, canned goods, egg, milk etc. to sell

loans.name: Nabarun Group

texts.en:
Twenty-six-year-old Monima (first from the left) lives with her husband in the Kamrup district of Assam. She runs a fabric business at home and seeks a loan to buy a new sewing machine and supplies. This loan will allow her to upgrade her business and help her husband run the family. As of today, the household monthly income is Rs.10,500. She feels that the purchase of the new machine and supplies will help her expand her business and contribute another Rs.1,200 to the monthly household income.

Mohima leads a loan group of four other women – Tumpa, Sunita, Tara and Bishaka. All are engaged in income-generating activities. In order to expand their individual businesses, they decided to form a group and apply for a loan for Rs. 50,000. They believe that an expansion of their businesses will help them contribute more to the well-being of their families. They are grateful to Kiva and its lenders.

loans.use: to expand a tailoring business.

loans.name: Kady Bourama

texts.fr:
Madame Kady Bourama est une dame tés engagée dans les activités du banc villageois, son activité connait une bonne amélioration et elle reste une femme exemplaire et soucieuse du devenir de sa famille. Elle est âgée de 41 ans mariée sans enfant. Elle s’active dans la vente de patte d’arachide et d’huile de palme.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 10 sacs d’arachide à 20000f qu’elle transforme pour le revendre en détails et 10 bidons de 20 litres d’huile de palme à 14000f la bouteille pour le revendre en détails dans son quartier.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte diversifiées ses activités et s’occuper de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Kady Bourama is a very engaged member in the banc villageois' activities.  Her business has had a big improvement and she remains a great woman who is anxious for her family's future.  

She is 41 years old  and married but has no children.  She sells peanut butter and palm oil.  

With her new loan she plans to buy 10 bags of peanuts at 20,000f that she will resell and 10 x 20 litre containers of palm oil at 14,000f per bottle that she will resell in her neighbourhood.  With the profits Kady Bourama hopes to diversify her business and have some children.

loans.use: to buy 10 bags of peanuts at 20,000f that she will resell and 10 x 20 litre containers of palm oil at 14,000f per bottle.

loans.name: Jerusha

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Jerusha works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling animal feeds. Jerusha is borrowing PHP 35,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like spices, meat, fish and other ingredients for her food production business.

Jerusha has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like spices, meat, fish and other ingredienrs for her food production business.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet works hard to support her family. She is married with two children and has a pottery making business in the Philippines.

Juliet requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials like clay, sand, etc for her pottery making business. She has been in this business for 30 years now, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials like clay, sand, etc for her pottery making business.

loans.name: María Mercedes

texts.es: María de 50 años es una microempresaria que ha tenido experiencia en diferentes campos de negocio; su primera actividad  fue comercializando repuestos de refrigeración y posteriormente se inclinó por la producción y venta de comidas que para ella es un placer hacerlo.  Ella es una apasionada por la culinaria y diariamente a partir de las 6 a.m. hasta las 3 p.m., ofrece para la venta deliciosos platillos típicos y aprovecha la afluencia de clientes que llegan a degustar de sus comidas para ofrecerles prendas de vestir, calzado y mercancías varias a crédito.  María es una emprendedora mujer que encuentra oportunidades de negocio al palpar las necesidades de sus clientes y vela por satisfacerlas, ofreciendo buenos precios y diseños a la vanguardia.  En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar víveres para la preparación de sus comidas y nuevo surtido de mercancías.  Su meta a futuro tener un local comercial y continuar apoyando a sus tres hijos.
texts.en: María, 50 years old, is a micro-business owner who has had experiences in different business fields. Her first business was selling spare refrigeration parts, and later she moved toward making and selling food which, for her, is a pleasure to do. She is passionate about cooking and every day from 6 am to 3 pm she sells delicious traditional dishes and takes advantage of the abundance of customers who arrive to enjoy her dishes to offer them clothing, footwear and a variety merchandise on credit. María is an enterprising woman who finds business opportunities by sensing her customers' needs and stays on top of satisfying them, offering good prices and trend-setting designs. Currently, she is applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to purchase groceries to prepare her dishes and a new assortment of merchandise. Her goal for the future is to have a retail space and to continue supporting her three children.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to prepare her dishes and a new assortment of merchandise.

loans.name: Robena

texts.en: Robena is 50 years old, married and the mother of five children who works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan from NWTF to buy more groceries to sell, including canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, bread, eggs, and shampoo and other personal care products. Robena has borrowed and repaid two prior loans from NWTF and has been running her store for the last three years. She earns additional income by fishing. Her goal for the future is to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell.

loans.name: Phat

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of the Kampong Cham province, Phat is 28 years old. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is in school and other one is too young. To support her living condition, she grows cassava on three hectares area and works for others for a fee to supplement her income. She has been involved her current business for ten years. She face with two problems in her cassava farm, the cassava does not grow well and the cassava’s price getting lower. 

This is her first micro-loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for labors fee to support on her cassava farm. She hopes that her cassava can produce more yields than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labors fee to support on her cassava farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Laulaau

texts.en:
Laulaau is a 64-year-old mother with nine children. She sells taro and bananas in her village to earn a living.

Laulaau became a member of Kiva's field partner SPBD in 2010. She has applied for a 1,500 WST loan to buy a backpack sprayer, taro roots (seedlings), banana tube (seedlings), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank and gardening gloves to help her run her farm. She hopes to use her profits to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), wheelbarrow, rake, shovel, water tank and gardening gloves

loans.name: Rarotoga

texts.en:
Rarotoga is 28 years old with 3 children. She operates a business selling bananas and taro in her community to earn a living. Rarotoga requested a loan to buy banana tubers (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a water tank, gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals to assist her in running the business.

She joined SPBD in 2012, and hopes to use her profit to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy banana tubers (seedlings), taro roots (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a water tank, gloves, a rake, a shovel, and chemicals.

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es: Álvaro encontró en una amistad,  la oportunidad que le daría a su vida un giro hacia su independencia económica, cuando en el año 2000 un amigo le enseño todo lo referente al servicio de fumigación de plagas, gracias a ello Álvaro es reconocido entres su vecinos, amigos y familiares, por sus excelentes servicios que permiten tener hogares libres de plagas y para él es muy importante acabar con el problema de raíz y así ser referenciado por sus clientes y generar un “Good Will “.  Todos los días a partir de las 8 a.m. hasta las 5 p.m. esta dispuesto a fumigar los interiores y exteriores de los domicilios, oficinas, bodegas y demás lugares donde sea necesario.  Hoy en día está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar equipos e insumos para realizar las fumigaciones.  Con esta inversión ofrecería un servicio más innovador y estaría más cerca de oficializar una empresa de fumigaciones y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Álvaro found in a friendship the opportunity that would give his life a turn toward economic independence when, in the year 2000, his friend showed him everything about pesticide fumigation service. Thanks to that, Álvaro is well-known among his neighbors, friends and family for his excellent services which allow them to have pest-free homes and for him it is very important to get the problem at its root cause and, so, to be referred by his clients and generate "good will." Every day from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm he is available to fumigate the interior and exterior of houses, offices, stores and other places where it is needed. Today, he is applying for his first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to purchase tools and supplies for fumigation. With this investment, he will offer a more innovative service and will be closer to registering a fumigation business and improving his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase tools and supplies for fumigation.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business manufacturing native products in the Philippines.

Juanita requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional raw materials for her business. Juanita has been in this business for 13 years now, and also earns additional income from pig fattening and a general store.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for her business making native products.

loans.name: Valentin

texts.es:
Valentín es un gran hombre de 36 años, feliz mente casado con una linda familia, del cual él vive trabajando para darles lo mejor. Valentín se caracteriza en su comunidad por su amabilidad, sinceridad y respeto, pues con el gran beneficio que obtuvo con el préstamo logro construirle a su molino de nixtamal un lugar más adecuado, y ahora cuenta con una  mejor presentación, con este avance se encuentra muy satisfecho mas no conforme, porque tiene ahora la necesidad de  construir una pared de su casa, que actualmente solo esta cubierto con madera y con la inseguridad que se enfrenta en esta época a el  preocupa mucho es por eso que espera conseguir el préstamo lo más pronto posible para que esta construcción comience, el necesita comprar cemento, ca, block y hierro.
Valentín espera poder comprar un terreno y también una motocicleta para su movilización.
texts.en:
Valentín is a great man, 36 years old, happily married with a lovely family for which he lives working to give them the best. Valentín is characterized in his community by his friendliness, sincerity and respect.
